About the job
R00187799

The Global Sensing & Equipment team, part of Ecolab’s Research, Development and Engineering organization, designs innovative control, dispensing and sensor instrumentation systems to improve customer value, user experience, and safety. This position supports all Ecolab businesses, creating a dynamic, challenging, and varied work environment. The primary focus of the position is new product development of advanced control, sensor and monitoring systems.

What’s In It For You

Opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, abundant energy, and healthy environments
Ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth and opportunity
Support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best
Contribute to the research and development of differentiated technologies, products, processes, and systems

What You Will Do

Development of embedded control system and wireless technology projects utilizing industry standard electrical CAD tools (schematic capture, PCB layout, circuit modeling)
Work on cross-functional teams to develop, optimize, and qualify designs that meet customer requirements and differentiate
Facilitate evaluation of designs against global regulatory standards for electrical equipment, including UL, CE/EMC, and wireless
standards; independently drive regulatory issue resolution, utilizing internal and external capabilities
Work closely with both internal and external research teams to develop innovative solutions in control and sensor technologies
Work with contract manufacturers to ensure printed circuit assemblies meet quality and continuity objectives

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field and 2 years of related experience in electrical engineering circuit design; or
Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field and 1+ year(s) of experience in electrical engineering circuit design; or
Experience with schematic capture and electrical CAD tools

Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of embedded system design experience
Experience designing with microprocessors
Embedded wireless technologies and associated IoT design experience
Altium Designer PCB design tool experience
System design for control and monitoring equipment applications including analog sensor inputs and switched load outputs
AC power design
Use of System on Modules (SOM)
Strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills with ability to clearly articulate technical subject matter to a diverse audience
Experience with equipment regulatory processes including safety, wireless and EMC compliance
Demonstrated ability to work independently, driving design work to completion and troubleshooting and solving challenging technical problems

A trusted partner at nearly three million commercial customer locations, Ecolab (ECL) is the global leader in water, hygiene and infection prevention solutions and services. With annual sales of $13 billion and more than 47,000 associates, Ecolab delivers comprehensive solutions, data-driven insights, and personalized service to advance food safety, maintain clean and safe environments, optimize water and energy use, and improve operational efficiencies and sustainability for customers in the food, healthcare, hospitality, and industrial markets in more than 170 countries around the world.

When you come to work at Ecolab, you get to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges and have the opportunity to learn and grow, shape your career, make an impact and quickly see the importance of your work.

For more Ecolab news and information, visit www.ecolab.com. Follow us on Twitter @ecolab, Facebook at facebook.com/ecolab, LinkedIn at Ecolab or Instagram at Ecolab Inc

Benefits

Ecolab strives to provide comprehensive and market-competitive benefits to meet the needs of our associates and their families. Click here to see our benefits.

If you are viewing this posting on a site other than our Ecolab Career website, view our benefits at jobs.ecolab.com/working-here.

Covid-19 Vaccine Notice

Due to local mandates and customer requirements, applicants for certain customer-facing positions must be fully vaccinated (which in some situations requires a booster if eligible), unless a religious or medical accommodation is requested by the applicant and approved by Ecolab. All applicants should be aware that Ecolab is a federal contractor. If the federal contractor vaccine mandate is reinstated in its current form, all Ecolab employees will need to be vaccinated, or have an approved religious or medical accommodation in place.

Americans With Disabilities Act (ADA)

Ecolab will provide reasonable accommodation (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with our application process upon request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require accommodation assistance in this application process, please call Ecolab Recruiting Support at (866) 841-6682 for assistance.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.

In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

About the job
Are you an experienced Senior Electrical Engineer looking for a dynamic company to join? Due to our steady growth, we have an immediate opening for a Senior Electrical Engineer. The Senior Electrical Engineer will apply expertise of engineering principles and best practices in the design and development of electrical and electronic projects in various industries such as automotive, aerospace, military, and industrial equipment. The Senior Electrical Engineer will assign and define circuit options, harness in-lines, and connector numbers to the system logical schematics and will lead electrical system compatibility reviews. The Senior Electrical Engineer will provide guidance, coaching, and technical support to team members. This position is located in Troy, MI.

Responsibilities

Manage electrical engineering team and provide leadership, guidance, coaching, and technical support to team members.
Develop wire harness architecture, routing, physical schematics, and power distribution for electrical system requirements and support design engineers in defining and selecting components based on application requirements.
Oversee prototype and low volume production of electrical harness, control modules, etc. and report out to program teams on status.
Support business development functions for new program opportunities including proposal generation and costing.
Validate and approve engineering analysis, drawings, and schematics, including managing logical design data and performing design rule checks.
Assign and define circuit options, harness in-lines and connector numbers to the system logical schematics.
Lead electrical system compatibility reviews and sign-off electrical design work.
Identify and mitigate major electrical system failure modes and effects.

Qualifications

Bachelor of Science in electrical engineering.
Must be a US citizen.
Minimum 5 years of experience in commercial and/or military vehicle electrical systems, electrical controls, electronic architecture development and schematic design.
Experience managing, mentoring, and coaching others in a leadership position.
Experience conducting presentations, program, management, and customer reviews.
Ability to lead and work in a team environment, influence and collaborate with others to deliver quality products.
Knowledge of ethernet based electrical control systems.
Knowledge of Controller Area Network (CAN) bus protocol.
Ability to work in a team environment and collaborate with others.
Excellent presentation skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Skills

Knowledge of Mentor Graphics and Zuken.
8 years’ experience in an electrical leadership position with responsibility for team and product to deliver.
Experience with development and maintenance of design verification plan and reports (DVP&R) and failure mode and effects analyses (FMEAs).
Experience in power generation and hybrid systems.
Experience conducting vehicle architecture power studies.
Experience with ethernet based power control systems.
Experience on end-to-end design and development vehicle programs.
Experience in Teamcenter environment.

Roush is an EO employer – Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Employment Type: Full Time

Salary: $100,000 - $110,000 Annual

Bonus/Commission: No

Job details

Controls Engineer

This Jobot Job is hosted by Albert Simons

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $140,000 - $160,000 per year

A Bit About Us

Are you ready to take the next step in your career and join one of the fastest-growing warehouse automation companies on the planet? Our mission is to revolutionize the industry with fully autonomous operations, and we're looking for a skilled and innovative Controls Engineer to help us get there!

We are one of the fastest growing warehouse automation companies in the industry. As a Controls Engineer with our company, you will play a vital role in designing, implementing, and maintaining the control systems that power our innovative warehouse automation solutions.



Why join us?

As a member of our team, you'll have the opportunity to work alongside some of the most brilliant minds in the industry. You'll be empowered to push the boundaries of what's possible in warehouse automation, and your contributions will be key to delivering game-changing solutions to our customers.

This position offers...

Fully remote schedule with travel
A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development
A dynamic and innovative work environment
The chance to work with cutting-edge technology and make a real impact in the world of warehouse automation

Job Details

To be successful in this role, you should have a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field, along with at least 3 years of experience in Controls Engineering or a related field. You should be an expert in PLC programming, HMI design, and motion control systems, with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Most importantly, you should be passionate about innovation and driven to make a difference in the world of automation.

You will have the opportunity to work with a team of passionate and skilled engineers who are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what is possible in the world of warehouse automation. You will also have access to state-of-the-art technology and resources, allowing you to stay on the cutting edge of your field.

Job details

Electrical Engineer

This Jobot Job is hosted by Christopher Singleton

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $85,000 - $100,000 per year

A Bit About Us

An industry leader in the manufacturing of stampings and automated assemblies. A Tier II supplier of components, systems and aftermarket products for the automotive industry with a core business market consisting of seating, ride control, exhaust components, heat shields, noise, vibration and harness (NVH), chassis and structural and window regulators.



Why join us?

Salary / Benefits

Employees become eligible for Insurance after 30 days of employment

Employer Paid Basic Life and A&D – NASG provides all Full-Time eligible employees with Employer-Paid Life and AD&D insurance in the amount of 1x annual base salary, up to $200,000

This is provided by your employer at no cost to you

401(k) Program

Paid holidays

Paid Time Off

Job Details

Experience Requirements

3-5 years of experience in metal stamping, forming, welding, and/or automation

Process design, improvement and or verification experience

Proficient with CAD software preferred

Must be able to read, write and follow wiring schematics and blueprints.

Have a working knowledge of industrial machine applications and processes and how to integrate the controls of those processes.

If Ohio based know the Ohio Revised Code regarding electrical (OSHA and NFPA) and other Standards regulating wiring practices.

Knowledgeable of OSHA general industry and press related standards

Electrical controls/ systems knowledge

Computer Skills including but not limited to PLC – 5000, HMI, Power Point and Microsoft Word, Excel and Projects

Personal/Technical Skills

Ensure safety, process capability, efficiency and standardization in assigned facility through machine standards and designs.

Assist in insuring a safe work environment

Assistance in preparation of strategic plan and budget

Participate in Associate involvement teams

Upgrade Self With Training As Required For Job Responsibilities

Participate in Problem solving and 8-D activities to ensure quality product to our customers

Regular review of downtime and plan for improvement

Ensure the manufacturing processes are constantly evolving with technological advancements.

Essential Job Functions

Verify safety controls on new machines; Maintains electrical compliance with OSHA & NFPA.

Works with other Electrical Engineers in designing controls and panels on new and rebuilt machinery based to current API Standards.

Responsible for all electrical type-controlled documents within their facility. Specifically changes made to electrical control programs, sustaining ARC flash analysis studies, electrical schematic designs, programmable logic controllers, HMI systems, compact logic 5000, etc.

Perform electrical start-up of new machinery. Commission PLC programs and HMI Screens and debug as necessary.

Build electrical control panels according to electrical prints in a neat and organized manner.

Install all control wiring and devices on new and rebuilt machinery when needed.

Inspection of hardwiring prior to electrically energizing.

Confer with engineers, customers, or others to discuss existing or potential engineering and continuous improvement projects.

Implement, maintain, or improve electrical instruments, equipment, facilities, components, products, or systems for industrial purposes.

Prepare specifications for purchases of materials or equipment.

Perform detailed calculations to compute and establish manufacturing or installation standards or specifications.

Investigate customer complaints, determine nature and extent of problem, and recommend remedial measures.

Oversee project production efforts to assure projects are completed on time and within budget.

Plan or implement research methodology or procedures to apply principles of electrical theory to engineering projects.

May supervise or lead others within the electrical maintenance department

Familiarity with gages and measurement equipment.

Ability to troubleshoot and repair mechanical production failures and initiate improvements.

Other Duties May Be Required.

Education Requirements

Required – Diploma and a two-year degree from college or technical school in the electrical field.

Preferred – B.S. Electrical Engineer Or Equivalent Field Of Education.

3-5 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Desire to continue education to maintain knowledge of technological improvements in the electrical field.

column1: Process Control Engineer/Specialist Level 2 - Decatur IL
column8:
About the job
Process Control Engineer/Specialist Level 2

Process Optimization COE

Decatur, IL

This is a full time, exempt position

Description

The Process Control Engineer/Specialist will provide plant support of automation systems to ensure Operations are successful through guidance, troubleshooting, and standard work. They will work with Operations and other COEs to execute projects while applying global standards. The Specialist will proactively seek opportunities for automation to mitigate risk, improve efficiency, and drive optimization projects. They will support and advance the standardization and documentation of automation systems.

The Specialist will also contribute to plant culture by supporting safety initiatives and Performance Excellence.

Job Requirements
Understands and is accountable for full compliance with safety and other EHS requirements.
Maintain a thorough knowledge of production processes, equipment and operations in the interest of developing, improving and maintaining process and safety interlocks
Develop or modify Automation controls to achieve desired control processes, and troubleshoot systems to identify and resolve hardware or software deficiencies
Develop and maintain documentation of automation hardware and software related to automation control systems
Ability to work well within groups or with minimal supervision to meet department goals
Communicate status updates and suggestions for improvements
Pursue/maintain industry specific training and certifications relative to this position and for career advancement
Ability to effectively coach and develop other colleagues
The candidate must be capable of working in extreme temperatures. Must have the ability to climb stairs, lift and move a minimum of 40 pounds, and sit and stand for long periods of time. Should be able to work in confined spaces and heights.
Available for on-call rotation for off-hours, holiday and weekend coverage.
Occasional company travel may be required
Experience/Education:
A Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Computer or Automation Engineering. Equivalent experience in the Process Automation field will be considered.
5+ years of experience with process control in an industrial environment
Experience with Emerson DeltaV, Novatech D/3 systems, Rockwell PlantPAx applications and OSIsoft PI
Familiarity with Industrial Networks (ie. TCP/IP, ControlNet®, DH+, Modbus, etc.)
Knowledge of Industrial Process Control including instrumentation, AC/DC Electrical systems, Piping & Instrument Diagrams
Ability to troubleshoot, solve, and repair issues with control systems and work safely with and around AC & DC voltages up to 120V
This position offers a complete benefit package, including 401K/ESOP, pension, health, life and dental insurance.

ADM requires the successful completion of a pre-employment drug screen and a background check.

About ADM

ADM unlocks the power of nature to enrich the quality of life. We're a premier global human and animal nutrition company, delivering solutions today with an eye to the future. We're blazing new trails in health and well-being as our scientists develop groundbreaking products to support healthier living. We're a cutting-edge innovator leading the way to a new future of plant-based consumer and industrial solutions to replace petroleum-based products. We're an unmatched agricultural supply chain manager and processor, providing food security by connecting local needs with global capabilities. And we're a leader in sustainability, scaling across entire value chains to help decarbonize our industry and safeguard our planet. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional and sustainability challenges of today and tomorrow. Learn more at www.adm.com.

EEO

ADM is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability and veterans status.

About the job
Description

This person will be overseeing projects, and the electrical designers. You are a systems integrator, the company purchases motors, VFD's, and PLC's from different places and then integrate them into one system. The EE is in charge of getting everything put together and operating outside of the PLC programming .

This person will oversee the entire projects as a whole so everything gets put together and is tested before it gets out of the door. This person needs to be familiar with VFD's, motors, and blowers.

Day to day: working with the customers and internal engineers while designing systems, sizing motors, sizing circuit breakers, sizing VFD, sizing cables. they have designers that would do the leg work. There day to day is overseeing the projects and getting the systems to be functioning.

Experience working in an industrial environment and has worked on large equipment.

Someone who has done system integration, heavy industrial, large generators translates well to their industry.

Skills

Electrical, Electrical engineering, Design, electrical schematic, wiring diagram, control panel design, motor controls and sensors, vfd, test-driven development, Electrical design, Schematic, Engineering, project management, Autocad, schematic design, allen bradley plc, wiring, Automation

Top Skills Details

Electrical,Electrical engineering,Design,electrical schematic,wiring diagram,control panel design,motor controls and sensors,vfd,test-driven development,Electrical design,Schematic,Engineering,project management

Additional Skills & Qualifications

Strong troubleshooting skills

Creativity to solve customers’ problems

Desire for hands-on prototyping and fabrication

Nice to have

Familiar With The Following

Control systems and PID loops
Microcontrollers and circuit board design
3 phase power systems
IEC 61131-3
EMC standards per military requirements
Refrigeration system and operation
Industrial communication networks

Experience Level

Intermediate Level

About the job
Leader in ground based electro magnetic pulsing technology is seeking 2 Junior Electrical Engineers to join their team! The team will be heavy in Research and Development, so they are looking for individuals who love being on the forefront of developing new technology and love using their creative abilities.

Pay: $35-$63/hr

Location: Onsite - Colorado Springs

Duration: 4 year contract

Clearance: eligible to obtain secret clearance

What You Need To Have

Candidates with RF Experience (could be from cellular company). Hands-on experience with fabrication and testing. Testing experience/program management experience a huge plus.
They use LTSpice for testing. They are looking for hands-on with test bench equipment (O-scopes, vectrum analyzers, etc). They will be primarily TESTING
One of the most important things is someone who can interface with BOTH internal AND external partners. Conversational, leadership, strong culture-based individual.

Primary Duties

Provide technical execution and oversight of multiple R&D, production, and customer projects
Serve as technical SME for their projects for internal managers and external clients
Lead experiments in both laboratory and field settings
Reports to the Engineering Manager and directs technicians with lab testing and fabrication
Write/review technical documents and deliverables
Responsible for research, preparation of engineering drawings, and coordination of design activities with engineering, manufacturing, and production to ensure that designs meet requirements

Additional Skills & Qualifications

BS in Engineering, preferably Electrical Engineering
Must possess a valid driver's license
Experienced with independently evaluating, selecting, adapting, and modifying standard techniques and criteria in order to plan and conduct engineering assignments
Demonstrated project development and leadership skills for planning and overseeing project tests

About the job
This position is responsible for the electrical design and development engineering for all NENA products, including engineering calculations, layouts and schematic diagrams utilizing our Computer Assisted Design (CAD) system. It is also responsible for customer technical support, as well as manufacturing support for sub-contracted and in-house manufactured control systems. This position is also responsible for providing technical support & problem solving to the assembly floor.

Engineering Area

Responsible for complete electrical design on assigned jobs (customer orders & development), including engineering calculations, schematic diagrams, PLC & HMI code and customer operating manuals
Responsible for commercial parts and electrical enclosure specifications
Responsible for cost and quality improvement design on existing machines
Develop standards for drawings, program code, & manufacturing methods & practices

Manufacturing Area

Provide technical support to manufacturing floor including, but not limited to, the following:
Answering questions and assisting in matters concerning wiring methods, routing of wires & conduits, coordination of the placement of electrical elements with mechanical engineering.
Testing machinery on manufacturing floor prior to shipment to customer.
Carefully evaluating and rendering decisions on improvements and changes recommended by manufacturing personnel.
Render decisions on parts found discrepant by incoming inspection
Estimating costs and lead times on new designs.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering
Working knowledge of commercial machinery control devices, i.e proximity switches, solenoid valves, transducers, switches, buttons & lamps, etc.
Sound understanding of principles and application of AC & DC motor control systems, mostly with VFDs.
2+ years’ experience working with Rockwell Rslogix500 and RsLogix5000 platforms along with FactoryTalk View.
Working knowledge of Siemens TIA Portal platform.

About the job
Job Title: Manufacturing Process Engineer - $95k (Gearing, Solidworks)

Location: Onsite in Addison, IL

Salary: $60k-$195k Base + 6% 401k, Great Benefits

Requirements: Manufacturing Process Engineer, Gears Experience Ideal!

Based in beautiful Addison, IL, we are high-precision gear manufacturer.

We have been in business for over 100 years and employee over 200 folks across 3 sites.

We manufacture gear in a wide range of profiles, including bevel, spur, helical, herringbone, worm gears, and gear boxes.

We also do a wide range of manufacturing in-house, including heat treating, turning, grilling, and milling.

We were at $10MM of EBITDA in 2022.

Due to growth, we are actively hiring a Manufacturing Process Engineer.

Experience with gears and/or Solidworks is a HUGE plus, but not required.

You will be working through our ERP system to process new and repeat orders, setting up component, making process molds, releasing jobs, and reviewing the contract and specs for accuracy.

If you have this experience, please apply immediately. We are actively interviewing this week and next for this high profile position.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

Compensation: $60k-$195k Base + 6% 401k, Great Benefits

Stability: 100 years in business, 200 employees over 3 sites

Culture: Fast paced, mission driven culture

Technology: Cutting edge technology

What You Will Be Doing
Design, develop, and implement new manufacturing processes for gearing products and improve existing processes to increase efficiency, productivity, and quality
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including design, quality, and production, to ensure successful implementation of new processes and process improvements
Develop and maintain process documentation, including standard operating procedures (SOPs), work instructions, and training materials
What You Need for this Position

Must Have Experience
3+ Years of Experience as a Manufacturing/Process Engineer
Nice To Have
SolidWorks
Gears/Gearing
What's In It for You
$60k-$195k Base + 6% 401k, Great Benefits
6% 401k Match
Vacation/PTO
Medical
Dental
Vision
Bonus
401k
So, if you are a Manufacturing Process Engineer - $95k (Gearing, Solidworks) with experience, please apply today!

Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information about available benefits, please contact Matt Abbasfard

About the job
Company: Siemens Industry, Inc.

Location: 7000 Siemens Rd, Wendell, North Carolina 27591

Position Title: Electrical Engineer (Multiple Positions)

Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, 40 Hours/ Week

Summary of Duties: Customize and adapt standard medium voltage metal enclosed switchgear to specific customer requirements. Review drawings with customers and provide instructions to electrical and mechanical drafters. Follow-up with aftermarket requests and convert them into sales opportunities. Analyze customer’s technical specifications, one line diagram and schematic diagram regarding the application of Siemens MV switchgear products along with associated protection and control systems and design appropriate product solutions to meet the customers’ expectations in cost-effective and timely manner. Work independently to create all documents for customer approval and manufacturing of Medium Voltage switchgears. Takes full ownership of the overall deliverables. Provide factory support during the manufacture of your projects to ensure that the final deliverable is true to the design. Be a subject matter expert, sharing knowledge of the product and process to help others on the team achieve their goals. Collaborate in efforts to improve team processes and tools to drive up overall team efficiency. Utilize the NXTools+ configurator software to prepare specifications, layout drawings and bill of material with a high degree of accuracy. Utilize knowledge of various electrical CAD software packages to complete project work and drive efficiency with process improvements. Works with bill of material in an ERP system (SAP).

Qualifications: The position requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Electrical Engineering, or a related field and two (2) years of experience in the job offered, as an Electrical Design Engineer, or an acceptable alternate occupation. The position requires one (1) year of experience with the following skills: analyzing customer’s technical specifications regarding the application of protection and control systems and applying appropriate product solutions to meet the customers’ expectations in a cost-effective and timely manner; reading, understanding, and evaluating electrical schematics to identify errors or potential improvements; demonstrated technical knowledge of the Electrical Products industry; ability to multitask and manage large workloads and business demands; knowledge of ANSI, IEEE, UL and NEMA standards for MV Switchgear; electrical CAD experience producing protection and control schematics.

About the job
Overview

Mortenson’s success is not a matter of luck; it’s a result of our ingenuity, expertise, and exceptional people coupled with our unparalleled focus on customer service.

Our foundation and culture are based upon our values of trust, safety, teamwork, responsibility, service, and stewardship. We are inspired by a compelling purpose to build structures and facilities for the advancement of modern society and a mission to create an exceptional customer experience. Mortenson has built a reputation for being a leader in our industry and in the communities in which we live and work.

It all starts with our extraordinary people and collaborative teams. Mortenson has been voted a "best place to work" over 40 times since 2002…

…What are you waiting for?

Mortenson is currently seeking an experienced Electrical Engineer to provide electrical technical support throughout the entire construction project. Effective communication skills are necessary as you will interact with staff at all levels in an ever-changing environment. Your ability to remain flexible, inventive, dedicated, and efficient with an elevated level of integrity and confidentiality is vital to your success in this role.

Provide technical lead and support for electrical portions of work project

Figure out the best layout of the collection system; including consideration of constraints such as overhead/underground, follow roads/cross country, and junction box locations
Review manufacturer’s data to determine the extent of scope for the electrical portion of the project, including wiring requirements and electrical characteristics (i.e. grounding requirements, power factor ranges, lightning protection requirements, generator outputs, etc.)
Verify that construction agrees with electrical engineering design drawings, including preparatory meetings, and QA/QC
Lead the electrical engineering design and equipment procurement using submittals, transmittals, and requests for information
Provide technical expertise to all parties concerned
Ensure subcontractors understand the scope of the project during the bidding process and provide electrical engineering resources throughout the project
Communicate with local utilities to ensure the project can interconnect to the electrical grid
Perform loss calculations (100% output/annualized)
Develop one-line diagrams of the collection system and substations, as well as standard details of electrical construction that are typical to Mortenson projects
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering
Minimum three years in electrical construction management or electrical design
Demonstrate strong teamwork orientation, initiative, communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills
Detail orientation sufficient to organize and run multiple project tasks
Possess a basic understanding of construction law, accepted business practices, construction techniques, and project management practices
Microsoft Office, project, and pertinent web application skills at an intermediate level
Positive professional attitude, and strong customer service skills
Interpret and communicate Mortenson policies effectively
Open to change based on diverse input and feedback
Effectively work with those of diverse backgrounds and organizational levels
Strong cross-cultural relationship building and influencing at all organizational levels
Consistent record of including diverse team members when assigning challenging and high-profile tasks
Working knowledge of the NEC code and NE safety code is a plus
Current driver’s license

Mortenson is an EOE/Affirmative Action/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled employer.

Responsibilities

Qualifications

About the job
A collective energy and ambition. A place where you can make a real difference.

We’re a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our consumers and the environment.

Our unique, informal culture champions courage, determination and collaboration. Knowing we have an open and supportive team means each of us has the freedom to take responsibility and ownership. We have a shared passion to work hard, innovate and push boundaries.

United by the belief that when we strive for growth, anything is possible. While we might not be the largest company in our industry, we believe we can have the biggest impact because: Together We Have the Power to Win.

Controls Engineer - Salary

This current wage range for this position is $88,600 to $133,000 annually

Monday - Friday

What We’re About

Innovation-We consistently generate new
ideas, thinking outside the box while remaining strategically focused. We always think in terms of possibilities, not limitations.
Collaboration-We rely on open and honest communication to develop productive working relationships within and across our business units and functions. The mutual respect we have for our colleagues enables us to challenge each other, leading to an even more cohesive team.
Focus-We maintain a laser-like focus on our consumers. We will grow by leveraging consumer insights on all of our brands and will continue to be industry leaders.
Entrepreneurialism-We pride ourselves on fostering this spirit where risk-taking and action is encouraged. We are extremely competitive externally, but not internally.

This highly visible position located at our Victorville, CA Facility.

What You’ll Do

This position will provide plant engineering support in the design, assembly, integration, testing, operation, troubleshooting and commissioning of PLC-based control systems.

Essential Functions

Responsible at all times for promoting a safety culture and awareness within their area.
Support and adhere to all plant safety policies and procedures at all times.
Assist with the design and modification of new and existing process control and instrumentation systems.
Manage capital projects relating to automation and controls infrastructure, etc. Complete projects as assigned within defined scope, allocated costs, time commitments and expected outcome.
Provide plant leadership for manufacturing and distribution in all technical and administrative aspects related to PLC's, microprocessors, automation, instrumentation, etc.
Continually improve packaging equipment controls logic for better efficiency and reduced waste.
Assist in the identification and development of project justification and business recommendations for engineering proposals including providing input for capital planning process.
Lead cross-functional teams, addressing technical challenges to achieve critical objectives.
Understand business needs, risks and organizational dynamics as well as their implications based on developing alternate plans and choices.
Understand processing automation for troubleshooting and improving cycle time throughput.
Identify and support cost reduction and efficiency improvement initiatives.
Develop and coordinate all technical training requirements for operations and maintenance personnel as related to instrumentation and controls.
Promote active leadership in the implementation of plant-wide lean manufacturing efforts and TPS, integrating lean manufacturing disciplines in the engineering department.
Assist with quality software system for customized reports and data analysis.
Support and recommend continuous improvements initiatives utilizing lean manufacturing tools and techniques.
Promote fair and consistent adherence to all local and corporate policies and procedures.
Ensure all quality and safety practices are followed at all times.
Performs other related duties as required and assigned.

What You’ll Need
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or related field.
5-7 years previous engineering experience in high volume, multiple SKU, fast-paced manufacturing environment. CPG experience preferred.
Flexibility to work various hours and shifts as needed, especially during large projects, installations, etc.
Excellent interpersonal skills — ability to build positive relationships at all levels of the organization
Excellent communications skills — ability to communicate clearly and concisely in multiple media — verbal, written, etc.
Excellent organizational/time management skills.
Direct technical experience in the design, assembly, integration, testing, troubleshooting and commissioning of PLC-based control systems
Proven knowledge of National Electrical Code (NEC) and Underwriter Laboratories (UL) standards, Allen Bradley Controls, AC and motor controls, and process sensors of all types
Capability to calibrate and test controls, verify instrumentation accuracy and effectiveness and perform routine maintenance on the plant-wide controls system
Ability to interpret, red-line and prepare detailed control and instrumentation schematics, ladder logic diagrams, wiring schematics and PID's/PFD' s.
Ability to prioritize work assignments in a fast-paced, dynamic, production driven work environment.
Solid critical thinking skills and ability to create new, innovative ways to handle situations with a strong bias towards Continuous Improvement fundamentals.
Understanding of lean manufacturing principles including Six Sigma, 5S, TPS, etc.
Strong computer skills:
Allen Bradley Software:
RSLogix 5000/Studio 5000
FactoryTalk View Studio
RSLogix 500
MS Office Suite, MS Project, CMMS and SAP.
Working knowledge of SAP Maintenance Module, & AutoCAD, a plus
Ability to methodically collect and analyze data and make appropriate recommendations, Wonderware and/or OSI-PI a plus.
Strong knowledge of production operation, including equipment, materials, workflow, etc.

What We’ll Offer

Competitive salary including annual bonus & Stock Incentive Program
Comprehensive benefits package along with generous 401K
Career ownership & development
Diversity & Sustainability

About the job
About Us

Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com.

About Cognizant’s QEA Practice

We are the largest Quality Assurance Practice Globally servicing 800+ Clients including 50+ clients in Fortune 100. We bring the industry leading vision and expertise to help with Quality Engineering transformation journey for our reputed clients. We provide Next Gen QA offerings like System Modernization assurance, Business Process Assurance, Quality Engineering, Cloud Platform Assurance, Customer Experience Assurance and Robotic Test Automation. We have been ranked #1 for Market Impact by Everest Group for four times in a row and ranked #1 for completeness of vision, test advisory and Digital Business Assurance in Gartner Magic Quadrant.

Sr. Automation Engineer

Roles And Responsibilities
Provides technical leadership at the product team level. Mentor, guide, and provide technical oversight to Junior team members in your area of responsibility.
Ability to work independently, and manage initiatives to meet schedules in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Skilled at communicating with, presenting to, and influencing internal customers.
Work closely with product teams and product management to understand requirements and translate them into test cases that capture all test conditions.
Have expert knowledge of testing concepts, test processes, test design skills, and testing techniques.
Specific duties and responsibilities include creating, maintaining, and executing test plans and test cases against our software platforms, estimating test efforts, analyzing, and communicating test results, Peer reviews, defect tracking, and participating in day-to-day Quality Engineering Activities.
Provide enterprise-level guidance on test framework architecture, CI/CD integration, and DevOps principles as related to software testing COTS/custom web solutions.
Experience in open-source frameworks (Selenium, Playwright, Jest), API testing using POSTMAN or similar tools, Testing Grids (BrowserStack), or equivalent.
Effective in written, verbal, and presentation skills with the ability to clearly articulate ideas and concepts enabling teams to be successful.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate, negotiate and work with cross-functional teams. Flexibility to work with people from diverse backgrounds.
Ability to think on your feet, assess problems, and lead others to find well-thought-out solutions.

About the job
Position Summary

Odyssey Systems has a new exciting opportunity for a Sr. Electrical Engineer located at Robins AFB, GA supporting The Agile Combat Support Directorate (ACS). ACS is one of AFMC’s largest materiel systems directorates with over 1,600 military, civilian, and Contractor personnel charged with executing an annual budget in excess of $2.1 billion

Responsibilities

Duties includ e, but not limited to:
Accomplish Engineering Management tasks and interact with lateral AFLCMC organizations or any external agencies required including base facility, personnel, security, computer support, foreign disclosure, foreign travel, public affairs, test organizations and the building managers to facilitate and support uninterrupted day-to-day operations.
Assist in providing technical planning, systems integration, verification and validation, cost and risk analysis, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for overall weapons system.
Assist in performing engineering activities to include defining system requirements, reviewing vendor designs and technical proposals, researching and developing technical solutions, performing systems functional analysis, conducting trade studies, conducting technical reviews, and performing test and evaluation activities.
Coordinate with USG agencies, prototype facilities, commercial vendors, and engineering firms to conduct analyses.
Aid in creating engineering documentation and electrical engineering analyses.
Assist in identifying, managing, mitigating, and addressing technical and program architecture risks, including interoperability analysis and risk assessment.
Provide support for the integration of current and evolving systems into the weapons system platforms.
Provide engineering support involving the application of Electrical engineering principles to determine the business and technical needs of Mission Partners in the acquisition, development or sustainment of weapon systems, subsystems, support systems, equipment items, or an equivalent product.
Qualifications

Minimum Required Qualifications:

Citizenship: Must be a US citizen

Clearance: Secret

Education/Experience
Master's degree in engineering and ten (10) years experience
Or ABET-accredited Bachelor’s degree in engineering and twenty (20) years experience
Additional Information

Location: Robins AFB, GA

Travel: 10%

Company Overview

Odyssey Systems Consulting Group, is an innovative small business committed to providing world-class technical, management, and training support services to government and public sector clients. We focus on people, processes, and performance to deliver superior results. Since our inception in 1997, our commitment to mission success and customer satisfaction has been recognized with exponential growth and exceptional past performance ratings. We accept challenging assignments and drive projects from the planning stages, through implementation, and into operations and support.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

About the job
Summary

Job Description:

The person in this position will work on multidisciplinary project teams providing electrical engineering and related technical expertise. Work will include integrating process, mechanical, and control requirements into comprehensive electrical systems. Projects will focus on design and analysis and will include preparing plans and specifications, writing reports, and developing cost estimations, and will include design of power and controls from the ground up. The work will be related to industrial processing facilities, power plants, mining facilities, and municipal water and wastewater facilities. The person in this position will also be responsible for the management of projects, coaching and mentoring less-experienced staff, providing technical leadership, and team management to meet clients' needs. The work may at times involve short-term out-of-town assignments.





A hybrid work arrangement may be considered for this position. A hybrid work arrangement refers to splitting time worked between a Barr office and a home office. This position is/can be based out of Barr's Reno, Nevada, and Salt Lake City, Utah, offices.



The anticipated base salary range for this position is $75,982—$96,242/year. Compensation will vary based upon experience, education, skill level, and other compensable factors. Employees in this position may also be eligible for a discretionary cash bonus. Our compensation comes in more ways than traditional base salary, and we believe that when all those elements are combined, our compensation is a competitive part of the total value proposition of working at Barr.


People report that they stay at Barr because of the camaraderie and career opportunities. Another draw is our competitive package of employee benefits, which includes professional development funding, 401(k) retirement savings plan, employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) participation, medical and dental insurance, life insurance, disability and accidental death insurance, flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses, paid holidays, paid time off, and compensatory time for exempt/salaried staff (time off or pay for extra time worked).

NOTE: Some work locations may feature rough terrain typical of construction sites and may also require entering and working in facilities that include limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. Job assignments may involve work on waste disposal sites and sites requiring cleanup of hazardous materials. An OSHA-mandated physical exam may be required. Safety training will be provided.

About the job
Description

60% electrical design, schematics, BOM/part generation. 20% shop production assistance. 20% customer assistance.

Working with electrical schematics
Designing in AutoCAD
Creating BOMs
VFD sizing, programming, and troubleshooting
Interacting with customers to troubleshoot through operational issues like VFD control and general electrical control
Electrical circuit load calculations
Assist electrical shop personnel with in-house testing
Power up/troubleshooting of control systems, including: electrical power circuits, control circuits, light PLC programming, VFD programming/set up, and systems testing

Must Have

Additional Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, or a similar field
2+ years of Electrical Engineering experience
AutoCAD panel layout / electrical design
Solid understanding / experience with VFDs (variable frequency drives)

Experience Level

Intermediate Leve

About the job
Description

INVISTA is looking for a motivated individual to join our Process Control and Automation team as a Process Automation Engineer based in Houston, Texas or Longview, Texas.

This position will focus on developing automation strategies, leading project implementations as well as sustaining existing applications across multiple process unit operations at INVISTA sites. The successful candidate will receive training as appropriate.

What You Will Do In Your Role

Work closely with the Process Engineering and Production Teams to understand where the deployment of process control automation (state-based control, automated procedures, advanced process control) would help maximize value.
Continually prioritize opportunities for process automation based on economic value and/or operating risk.
Implement process automation on DCS platforms either by coordinating in small site-based teams working with leveraged resources and/or external vendors.
Develop and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to ensure that the project goals are achieved.
Ensure that the gains achieved from process automation projects are sustained.
Continually improve value from process automation by suggesting and/or applying other process control improvements through technologies and tools.

The Experience You Will Bring

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and 2+ years of relevant technical experience OR 3+ years of relevant industry experience in DCS/process control configuration

About the job
About Us

The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.

No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!

Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration

We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.

About the job
Company Description

Brooks Instrument is an industry leader in flow measurement and flow control products for critical applications, and a division of ITW (A Fortune 200 Company) is seeking candidates for a Senior Electronics Engineer. This position will be based out of our headquarters facility in Hatfield, PA (Suburban Philadelphia). In addition to our Pennsylvania operations, Brooks maintains manufacturing locations in, Hungary, and Korea. The Company also maintains sales offices throughout the world. Our products are used in laboratory and process applications in end markets such as: life sciences, chemicals, semiconductor, analytical instruments, nuclear, and solar cells.

Job Description

Basic Function

The Senior Electronics Engineer is responsible for the design and development of electronic hardware related to Brooks’ pressure measurement and control product families. This position requires an individual who is self-directed, highly motivated, and organized with strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. They must possess the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a cross-functional team environment and should demonstrate results-oriented leadership in driving projects to completion.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Perform embedded systems hardware development for flow and pressure control devices.
Perform analog circuit design including power supply design (switching and linear), voltage and current I/O circuitry, as well as circuits with discrete semiconductors.
Design digital circuits using microprocessors and associated peripheral devices in embedded systems.
Design modular architectures that can support multiple product configurations. Reuse existing designs as appropriate. Modify existing designs to improve performance, reliability, cost, and manufacturability.
Follow Brooks’ product development process, providing deliverables and supporting others within the project scope.
Develop and/or interpret product requirements specifications, and complex drawings or schematics.
Use CAD tools for schematic capture and perform simulations (e.g. SPICE) to achieve circuit design goals.
Support printed circuit board (PCB) layouts, working within 2D and 3D spatial constraints.
Design or co-design electro-mechanical assemblies (e.g. cable assemblies).
Perform analysis of electronic components, including derating, lifecycle and environmental compliance.
Mentor and assist other engineers through peer design reviews and sharing of expertise.
Coordinate and/or perform design verification and validation testing of new designs with the reliability engineering group.
Participate in the research and analysis of data such as design proposals, specifications, and manuals to determine feasibility of design or application while adhering to project timing.
Identifies, with support from marketing and engineering management, promising areas of research or technology that address current needs and have larger potential markets.
Utilizes originality, ingenuity, and creativity to manage complex and large scope project assignments.
Collaborate with other functional areas (e.g. Firmware & Mechanical Eng., Technology Research, Marketing, Manufacturing, Sourcing, Test Agencies, Contract Manufacturers) both inside and outside Brooks.
Create design documentation packages for production release and initiate change/release notifications.
Perform design work and testing for agency approvals (e.g. EMC, UL).
Diagnose/troubleshoot problems and provide solutions within project constraints.
Support initiatives for continuous improvement, including documentation of team processes and product functional documentation (e.g. theory of operation).
Follow all safety procedures.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Extensive knowledge of embedded electronics, including analog, digital and power circuit design, required.
Working knowledge of circuit design and development tools (e.g. Altium Designer, OrCAD, SPICE) required.
Proficiency with use of electronic lab equipment (e.g. power supplies, multi-meters, oscilloscopes, function generators, network analyzers) required.
Familiarity with industry standard communication protocols (e.g. EtherCAT, DeviceNet, RS485, Profibus, Modbus, Foundation Fieldbus, Ethernet/IP, HART) strongly preferred.
Ability to take on multiple concurrent assignments under minimal supervision.
Excellent communicator who exhibits strong verbal, written and presentation skills.
An assertive, consummate team player who can effectively negotiate with others to achieve win-win outcomes.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project) required.
Programming experience desired, but not required.

Education And Experience

B.S. in Electrical Engineering is required. MS in Electrical Engineering preferred.
10+ years of experience with analog/digital circuit design and development is required.
Experience with Semiconductor systems/products and/or other control systems highly desired.

Additional Information

Our employees enjoy competitive, merit-based salary plus excellent benefits including:

Health and dental insurance
Company Paid Life Insurance / Short and Long Term Disability
401K plan with generous company match
Vacation, personal days and holidays
Continuing education reimbursement program
Flexible spending accounts

The opportunity to join a well-established (70 + years in business) yet dynamically changing organization that works together as a team to meet the challenges of satisfying customers’ needs and managing rapid growth to better compete in a global marketplace.

About the job
Role Summary

Knowledgeable of process equipment and systems, manufacturing operations, and automation control (Delta V, etc) and provide direct production support during processing operations. Services include review of process requirements and evaluation of equipment and systems to ensure deliverables meet or exceed process specifications and manufacturing requirements. Assist with production planning and provide / support coordinating production activities working with the Manufacturing Area Leads. Provide technical guidance and systems and automation training to production colleagues. Requires direct production support on 24/7 rotating shift schedule as determined by the manufacturing processes.

Provides process engineering support of cGMP clinical and /or commercial manufacturing processes and equipment. Provides direction of process engineering support to ensure operational success of the maintenance coverage program. Analyzes repeated issues with equipment.

Conducts all activities and makes decisions that are in accordance with Company policies & SOPs, Pfizer Values, & global regulatory guidelines (including cGMP/cGLP/cGCP), environmental guidelines, as appropriate, etc. Advise management of non-conformance issues and opportunities for continuous improvement via data trend analysis, interpretation of data, gap analysis and implementation of corrective activities. Provides input on decisions for SOP’s, batch records, forms or other cGMP related documents developed or revised to support continuous improvement efforts, investigation corrective actions, process descriptions, manufacturing operations, automation control (DeltaV, etc.) and regulatory audit commitments.

Role Responsibilities

Individual Accountabilities:

Spends majority of time on the production floor to proactively identify areas for improved efficiencies and ensure that product quality is maintained through all phases of production including operational parameters of manufacturing equipment, automation control, processing dynamics, and integrated utilities to identify and resolve quality, and technical, risk to manufacturing. Serve as the areas technical SME and develops expertise in various manufacturing operations and processes including automation controls that operate and monitor the processes.
Requires general knowledge of scientific principles, technical knowledge of production equipment, automation control systems, processing requirements and any related procedural requirements with emphasis on assigned production area.
Capable of identifying technical problems and solving them with minimal guidance. Ability to analyze operational process issues and automation challenges to recommend / initiate appropriate corrective and preventative actions. Acts as a departmental liaison with primary support groups such as engineering, technical services, quality control, quality assurance, development and utilities. Manage / implement process, equipment, and automation changes in support of manufacturing operations.
Primary point of contact for operator support and issue resolution
Responsible for problem diagnosis / root cause(s) determination (automation, mechanical, documentation, training, etc)
SME of process, equipment, and automation change requests for prioritization
Coordinates activities necessary to test and qualify equipment and automation changes in the production environment
Uses scientific and OE tools/techniques to identify areas to optimize yield and/or and improve efficiencies
Translate process descriptions instructions to meet production equipment / system capabilities
Review and contribute to applicable documentation (i.e. MBRs, SOPs, etc)
Ensure equipment requirements can meet processing needs
Review P&IDs and provide support as needed
Determine area/equipment interlocks
Establish equipment synchronization requirements
Participates in process operational improvements
Focus on Safety and GMP Compliance as operational priorities and as performance measures that should be included in metrics.
Know the processes and procedures, including the principles and practices of good data management (ALCOA), and be able to guide, advise, and coach their teams.
Review the content of all Leader Led Conversations and, on an annual basis, conduct two ‘Leader Led Conversations’ with their teams aimed at fostering a culture that supports compliance with procedures, including good data management.

Shared Accountabilities:

Works with Tech Services, Engineering, Automation, QA, etc to ensure robust manufacturing processes: Contribute to P&IDs, PFDs and process descriptions
Coordinate activities with PCS to resolve automation issues and changes
Coordinate activities with maintenance to resolve mechanical issues
Per guidance from Tech Services establish process parameters, timers, run rates, material flow, etc as needed
Works with PCS to develop detailed automation design(s) and specifications

Qualifications

High School Diploma (or Equivalent) and 8 years of technical professional experience in GMP experience in pharmaceutical industry OR
Associate's degree with 6 years of technical professional experience in GMP experience in pharmaceutical industry OR
Bachelor's degree in Life Science (e.g. Biology or Chemistry) or Engineering or equivalent, with at least 3 years of technical professional experience in GMP experience in pharmaceutical industry OR
Master's degree in Life Science (e.g. Biology or Chemistry) or Engineering or equivalent, with more than 1 year of technical professional experience in GMP experience in pharmaceutical industry.
Knowledge of scientific principles, technical knowledge of production equipment, automation control systems, processing requirements and any related procedural requirements with emphasis on assigned production area
Capable of identifying technical problems and solving them with minimal guidance
Ability to analyze operational process issues and automation challenges to recommend / initiate appropriate corrective and preventative actions
Engage and inspire their teams on performance expectations and coach the team to meet those expectations using Coaching Skill principles.
Effectively monitor the actions of their team. Ensure an active daily presence in the GMP work area to observe the work activity and practices within their role responsibilities.
Be accountable for the Good Data Management and Data Integrity understanding and performance of their team.
Be available to their direct reports for real time escalations of any concerns or support needs.
Be observant, investigate and report actions or behaviors that may negatively impact the desired outcome of the GMP process or activity.
Lead and support continuous improvement efforts, where applicable.
Be a role model to support a positive compliance culture.
Be vigilant for potential actions or behaviors that could result in breaches of GMP compliance or Data Integrity principles.

Physical/Mental Requirements

Requires the moving of heavy equipment and the ability to lift ~40 pounds.
Moderate repetitive standing, sitting, bending, and ladder climbing on a daily basis.
The incumbent needs to take the necessary safety precautions when working with pressurized systems, steam, and corrosive chemicals.

Non-Standard Work Schedule, Travel Or Environment Requirements

Day Shift 5-day work week

Sunshine Act

Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. The Controls Engineering job is IDEAL if you enjoy things like...
Designing and implementing modifications to existing electrical, robotic, and PLC automation equipment for uptime and reliability improvement

About the job
Process Control Engineer:
Position Type: Direct Hire

Position Location: Pasadena, TX
Position Salary: $100,000 - $120,000 (Depending on Experience)
Responsibilities:
Responsible for assisting the Site DCS/Systems Manager in overseeing DCS/Systems resources for the site (DCS, historians, PLCs).
Work closely with the Site DCS Manager to determine unit and project priorities, and then work with production personnel to accomplish such tasks.
Perform programming and troubleshooting of assigned DCS/Systems as needed.
Propose modifications to DCS/Systems equipment that improve plant performance, safety, or reliability, and reduce costs.
Develop scope and design of DCS/Systems capital projects and oversee engineering commissioning and startup, assuring on-time completion.
Support the Digital Transformation initiative by proposing projects, developing scope and risk/benefit analysis, and performing cost and ROI estimates.
Perform regular system health monitoring checks, including server and workstation hardware integrity, fault LED’s, communications integrity, available memory, time sync, cabinet internals (dust removal), monitor display quality, etc.
Work with unit process engineers and DCS Manager to develop and maintain DCS interlock lists, DCS training manuals, sequence flowcharts, and How-To documents.
Assist units in maintenance of DCS/Systems and assist in hardware and software changes as necessary.
Monitor and address DCS alarms, update alarm surveys, propose fixes, and work with unit engineers to execute action items.
Develop and maintain a Master Alarm Data Base for all units in accordance with the ISA 18.2 Alarm Management standard.
Keep up to date in training for system software updates and revisions, and revise training manuals as necessary. Provide DCS training for engineers and board operators.
Monitor DCS system alarms (including Windows event logs) and system performance, and work with system TAC to resolve issues quickly to maintain system reliability.
Assist DCS/Systems Manager in configuring and maintaining the Pi system, adding/modifying tags and users, adding notifications, troubleshooting issues with Pi, and monitoring system health.
Review event summaries and monitor logs for DCS manual interventions, and assist unit process engineers in developing DCS solutions to eliminate the interventions if needed.
Review and audit DCS MOC’s for accuracy, assist engineers in simulations, and double check programming changes.
Assist the DCS manager in the development of OT cybersecurity policies, procedures, training, and training logs. Monitor antivirus scans for unwanted files or potential intrusions, and perform audits of USB ports and GPO enforcement.
Apply operating system security patch updates and antivirus software definition file updates in a timely manner.
Perform regular system backups (or monitor automated backups), including trends, event summaries, batch data, and hard drive images, and become proficient in restoring related files as needed.
Develop and maintain KPI’s, dashboards, statistics, and other metrics to keep DCS Manager informed on DCS system health and performance.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering; Higher Education a plus
3+ years of experience in DCS programming in a chemical process
2+ years DeltaV experience in a production plant setting
Experience with MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio, Outlook) a must
OSI Pi (Process Book, Pi DataLink, System Explorer, Pi Batch, SMT, etc.) and Visual Basic programming are considered a plus

Benefits:
Full Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)

About the job
Job Description

Job Duties:

Perform high and extra high voltage HVAC/ HVDC underground transmission lines design, including conductor sizing, circuit rating calculations and cable system’s bonding and grounding.
Develop cable system construction technical specifications.
Develop drawing packages to support the design (route plan and profile, trench cross sections, duct bank designs, key maps, grounding and bonding schematics, etc).
Perform EMF studies, constructability reviews and provide technical expertise on cable technology and testing and commissioning.
Perform ampacity studies and model underground cables using Cyme, cable vendor documentation, and soil parameters provided by geotechnical team.
Prepare CAPEX and OPEX estimates.
Review RFP documents and prepare proposals including scope of work documents, budgetary estimates and schedules.
Issue Power Cable RFPs, assist with bid evaluations and be responsible for the coordination with cable vendors.
Perform work in a technically sound manner and completed in accordance with the Engineering Project Procedures and specific Contract requirements.
Effective planning, organizing, estimating, scheduling, and monitoring of personal work activities.
Prepare thorough and accurate technical reports, correspondence, documentation, calculations, and sketches.
Manage project correspondence and client requests.
Continuous improvement of job-related, engineering, technical and professional knowledge, skills, and performance.
Work with an interdisciplinary project team.

Candidate Specification

Required Knowledge

Proven track record of underground cable project experience.
Detailed understanding of underground high voltage and extra high voltage AC and DC electrical systems.
Detailed knowledge of various cable construction types, cable properties and testing and cable monitoring system technology.
NESC, NEC, IEEE, IEC, ANSI, ASTM and ASCE standards, and all applicable federal, state, regional, and local laws requirements.
Experience working with subcontractors and procurement activities.
Experience with Cymcap engineering software for ampacity calculations.
Experience working with electrical utility companies and/or private developers.

Preferred Knowledge

HVDC and related technology knowledge and construction experience.

Education And Minimum Experience Requirements

BS or MS in Electrical Engineering, MS preferred.
3+ years of experience required.
Professional Engineer License (PE) or ability to obtain the PE within 1 year.

Key Responsibilities

Lead technical design and development across advanced sensing, communications, and system controls through applications of electrical / electro-mechanical technologies in Robotics surgery. This position holds accountability for the technology programs and will work closely with our internal R&D teams and with external development partners as well.
Be a technical leader responsible for projects from conception through final execution, partnering with other core development teams including mechanical, biomedical, equipment/testing development, and clinical fields to integrate enabling technologies across a broad array of surgical solutions.

About the job
Who we are:

At The Shyft Group we are driven to deliver. Proudly the North American leader in specialty vehicles, our portfolio of last-mile delivery vehicles, work trucks, and motorhome chassis bring people, goods, and services where they need to be.

We are strengthened by nine industry-leading brands -- Utilimaster®, Blue Arc™, Royal® Truck Body, DuraMag®, Magnum®, Strobes-R-Us®, Spartan® RV Chassis, Red Diamond™, and Builtmore™. With 50 years and millions of miles behind us, we continue to charge forward — leading the commercial vehicle transition to electric, innovating across all our brands, and earning our position among Fortune’s 100 Fastest Growing Companies.

Producing engineering drawings for and design fixturing / tooling
Implementing lean manufacturing principles such as visual controls, pull inventory systems within a process, workplace organization and continuous improvement
Providing manufacturing technical support for production operations, which includes tooling, fixturing and process troubleshooting utilizing existing systems and procedures, as well as investigate new technologies, methods, and processes to improve existing operations
Monitoring and correcting safety / ergonomic issues
Support the CI (Continuous Improvement) team to develop and organize lean events
Supporting the NPI (New Product Introduction) process; evaluating new projects for tooling and equipment needs
Driving continuous improvement and eliminate waste in all manufacturing facilities
Aiding in workstation load balancing for all manufacturing areas
Verifying, reviewing, and implementing torque specifications as well as high risk part specifications
Investigating problems, determine root cause, and implement corrective and preventative actions by communicating with and assisting cross-functional teams (quality, engineering, production, materials, purchasing, etcetera) to resolve issues
Other tasks as assigned

Experience with working a low volume/high variation manufacturing operation

Good hands-on engineering skills and ability to work on production equipment

General Description Of Position

Function as a lead engineer on assigned Entergy projects and provide support to the P&C Entergy project team. Lead engineer is expected to be familiar with the following aspects of the typical electrical protection system:
Relay One-Line Diagrams

Wiring Diagrams
Interconnections

As-Builts

Essential Functions Of Position
Serve as Lead Engineer on assigned Entergy projects.
Be a direct interface with the Entergy P&C team.
Attend project meetings for current and future Entergy projects.
Support Entergy scoping projects as needed by performing conceptual drawing creation, scope of work (SOW) creation, creating Class III estimates, and participating in bid reviews.
Be lead engineer on assigned Entergy projects and interface with Entergy P&C team as well as EPC engineering team. This includes, but is not limited to, attending meetings, providing direction to the EPC, reviewing design packages for conformity to standards, and answering RFIs.
