About the job
Overview

Buzzi Unicem USA is one of the leading cement manufacturing companies in the United States. With over 1,300 valued employees, Buzzi Unicem USA manufactures and distributes its cement products throughout the Midwest, Southwest, Northeast and Southeast regions of the country. Globally, Buzzi Unicem SpA operates in 14 countries and employs almost 10,000 people. We are passionate about sustainably producing our cement products for the benefit of society by providing the foundation for crucial infrastructure projects such as roads, bridges, tunnels, airports, dams, and residential and industrial buildings.

Our commitment to positively contributing to society is a core principle for our business, and the reason we focus heavily on sustainable development. As part of our corporate culture, we recognize our role in meeting the current generation’s needs, while preserving environmental quality and protecting the needs of future generations.

Additionally, quality serves as the foundation of the way we do business at Buzzi Unicem USA. We have established at all our production sites, quality targets for our products that meet not only local regulatory standards but also our customer requirements.

Buzzi Unicem USA strives to provide a corporate culture supporting career growth through strong leadership and development planning. We offer a competitive salary, along with comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits. Plus, our benefits include flexible spending accounts, supplemental life insurance and other voluntary benefits – such as accident and critical illness. We also provide a 401(k) savings plan, Employee Assistance Program, a tuition reimbursement program, professional development and advancement opportunities.

Join our team, be part of the solution, support evolving innovations, and help us continue providing quality products, all while being supported by strong leadership and a comprehensive and competitive benefits program.

Responsibilities

Buzzi Unicem USA is looking for a Junior Process En gineer, to be part of our training program at our Greencastle, IN plant. The Junior Process Engineer will receive direction and mentoring from our Production Manager and other Sr. Technical Staff . R esponsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to the following:

Supporting the plant in ensuring the equipment operates efficiently to maximize production rates and minimize fuel and power consumption.
Working with the plant and the Engineering Department on strategies for automatic process control projects.

About the job
Overview

Bergmann, an affiliate of Colliers Engineering & Design is currently looking for a Electrical Project Engineer to join us in our Buffalo, NY office.

Bergmann mechanical, electrical and plumbing (MEP) engineers are experienced in a wide range of projects, including power generation & distribution, lighting systems, fire alarms, security and access control systems. We design new and renovated systems, as well as energy controls. We offer both new building commissioning and retro-commissioning. Our experts are skilled at reducing energy usage while creating comfortable interior environments. Our professional engineers evaluate how the design impacts both short-term capital costs and long-term operational costs. Our team can also conduct constructability reviews to lower project costs and shorten the time to completion.

Responsibilities
Independently evaluate, select and apply standard engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria, using judgment in making minor adoptions and modifications to create schematic.
Assignments have clear and specified objectives and require the investigation of a limited number of variables.
Consults with team concerning unusual problems and development.
Prepare project plans and specifications.
Responsible for accuracy of design, specifications, drawings, etc.
Establish project design concepts, design criteria and scope, space requirements, etc.
Make engineering computations.
Project cost estimating.
Coordinate between trades, architect, client, etc.
Equipment selection, sizing, etc.
Check work of designers and CAD operators.
Review of shop drawings.
Provide suggestions for improvements of Electrical Standards.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering.
Minimum of 4 years’ electrical engineering design experience is required.
Revit and AGI Lighting software skills preferred.
Passion for power, lighting and fire alarm design.
Willing to travel to client location(s), as needed.
EIT preferred.
Ability to work closely with others.
What We Offer

Bergmann, an affiliate of Colliers Engineering & Design, our people are our most important resource. That’s why we are committed to providing all our employees with a safe, comfortable work environment, potential for career advancement, and the ability to impact society through their projects as well as Company sponsored activities.

This dedication begins with supporting a work life balance through a generous compensation package that includes: company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage; paid pregnancy disability leave; short- and long-term disability insurance; life insurance; a company-matched 401(k)/Roth; paid time off that includes parental and military leave; employee referral and professional license bonuses and a straight time policy that compensates exempt employees for billable hours worked in excess of 40 billable hours within a work week.

We have also created an internal culture that provides the resources and technology needed to encourage personal and professional growth opportunities through reimbursement for education; a free in-house resource for hundreds of educational and self-enrichment courses; mentorship program; wellness program; Women’s Organization and ongoing philanthropic opportunities.

Apply today to learn how you can join our team of professionals, so we can help you Accelerate Your Success!

About the job
Summary

Venturi, LLC, a Chenega company, has an excellent opportunity for a Hardware Engineer IV . Venturi is a subcontractor to a company that operates, maintains, and sustains mission-critical systems to provide safe and effective launch, testing, and tracking of Department of Defense, civil, commercial, and international space lift vehicles. We support ballistic missile, guided weapon, and aeronautical tests and evaluations as well as support space situational awareness operations and experiments to defend the United States to ensure our nation’s safety. Our employees serve at the forefront of global defense and space operations. We offer our team of experienced, professional employees an environment of challenging, stimulating, and personally and professionally rewarding career opportunities.

Compensation for this position includes an annual salary of $120,000 to $139,000 per year plus competitive benefits.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, modify, evaluate, and implement new and existing hardware systems.
Support the lead engineer with the technical aspects of a project and the supporting multi-disciplined project team.
Support Systems Engineering for both the Eastern and Western Ranges in a Subsystem Lead capacity in support of both subsystems, including leading and conducting Subsystem Working Group (SSWG) meetings, as needed, to ensure subsystem needs and deficiencies are being addressed and that resolution/way ahead the plan is in place.
Research, design, develop, modify, and implement highly complex, new, and/or existing capabilities for range support hardware systems.
Assist with the development of complex systems modeling, simulation, and analysis to provide the most appropriate technical solution.
Support complex Level 1, 2, and 3 testing to qualify hardware systems for Range operations.
Plan, conduct, and assist in the execution of projects.
Develop, recommend, and implement design approaches for products and/or processes.
Coordinate the efforts of technical support personnel for assigned projects.
Analyze, develop, recommend, and implement approaches to meet the Range requirements.
Review literature, patents, and current practices to support business requirements and/or new industry technology.
Prepare reports regarding new technology to communicate to appropriate personnel.
Evaluate component suppliers and vendor capabilities.
Act as a liaison with approved vendors/suppliers to maintain product/process availability and working relationship.
Serve as an interface for project information to internal management and the customers.
Develop an understanding of the Range radars, including transmitters, receivers, antennas, and control systems.
Provide leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.
Assist depot with problematic repairs of Line Replaceable Units (LRUs).
Provide expertise to level 2 requests for engineering assistance to restore operational systems.
Identify, document, and prioritize the Radar and Optics subsystem needs, deficiencies, and inefficiencies in support of both the eastern and western Ranges.
Support the development of Return on Investment (ROI) data in support of identified needs, deficiencies, and inefficiencies.
Support the development of risk statements.
Provide systems engineering oversight and leadership for products and/or processes, including the identification and review of changes to the Configuration Item (CI) Tree.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering or another technical degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics
15+ years of related engineering experience
U.S. citizenship or U.S. naturalization
Valid U.S. driver’s license required
Interim Secret clearance is required with the ability to obtain a Secret clearance

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Experience working with Windows-based computer systems and components and the Office tool suite.
Experience providing inputs to complex project proposals within defined time constraints involving multi-discipline teams.
Fundamental knowledge of hardware systems integration and testing.
Fundamental knowledge of the engineering lifecycle and systems engineering processes
General knowledge of instrumentation systems troubleshooting.
Proficient in the use of specialized test equipment, including but not limited to VOMs, spectrum analyzers, and oscilloscopes.
Fundamental knowledge in technical writing for the development of technical reports (White Papers) and other technical support documentation.
Familiarization with computer systems, including single-board (SBCs), servers, and workstations.
Familiarization with the Linux and Windows Operating systems.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret security clearance.
Ability to effectively communicate technical issues verbally and through written media, like graphical slides and verbal presentations to contract management and customers.
Ability to read and understand wire diagrams, schematics, and mechanical drawings.
Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills to balance, plan, prioritize, and execute projects.
Strong leadership and conflict management skills.
Good human relations and interpersonal skills to interact with internal and external support personnel and guide less experienced engineers.
Ability to work within a dynamic, fast-paced environment with time constraints.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

About the job
We believe real value is powered by the unique skills and experiences of our professionals. The interchange of ideas from a diverse group of people gives our teams an expanded perspective and the ability to find better solutions for our clients.

Company : Black & Veatch Corporation

Req Id : 97132

Job Title : Electrical Engineer 1 - EDGE Program - Various Locations - Summer 2023

Location : RGCOLST, KCP, RGANAR, RGBLOOMIN3

Job Summary

Functions in an engineer capacity. Under close supervision, performs routine aspects of engineering assignments requiring knowledge and application of basic engineering principles. Applies knowledge of engineering principles to prescribed techniques and procedures to complete project assignments.

The EDGE Program provides early-career professionals a unique combination of at least 3 rotational job experiences over 3-4 years, structured training curriculum, and direct access to business leaders. The program is intended to accelerate career progression and broaden the development of participants promoting a successful career at BV.

Key Responsibilities

Engineering Standards:

Develops familiarity by reading, understanding and applying departmental design guides, standards, systems, applicable engineering codes and Black and Veatch policies and procedures

Quality/Continuous Improvement:

Develops an understanding and complies with the Black and Veatch quality program
Supports continuous improvement and change management efforts

Engineering Production:

Contributes to preparation of less complex engineering deliverables such as drawings, reports, specifications, and studies of limited scope
Performs routine research and develops recommendations for equipment and/or materials selection
Collects, assimilates, and manages data for engineering work
Prepares basic engineering calculations following standard methods and principles used in similar engineering analysis
Understands and adheres to budget, schedule, and quality requirements

Project Coordination:

Shares information with others as requested
Coordinates with others when directed by supervisor or project leadership

Client Focus:

Focuses on the needs of internal clients (project team leadership) while attempting to gain basic understanding of external client's main interests and drivers
May provide support to business development or pursuit activities

Knowledge Sharing, Innovation and Technology:

Shares current knowledge of latest technology and processes

Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Non-Technical Skills:

Learning on the Fly
Problem Solving
Intellectual Horsepower
Written Communications
Drive For Results
Informing
Listening
Dealing with Ambiguity

Preferred Technical Skills:

Basic knowledge of engineering design principles and applicable design guides and standards related to assigned engineering discipline
Basic industry knowledge and technology trends
Basic knowledge of company quality program
Basic knowledge of construction and constructability practices and principles

Minimum Qualifications

No experience required. Requires a bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from either a recognized accredited program in their home country or the country in which the professional is practicing. All applicants must be able to complete pre-employment onboarding requirements (if selected) which may include any/all of the following: criminal/civil background check, drug screen, and motor vehicle records search, in compliance with any applicable laws and regulations.

Must have a 4 year degree
Must have a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or higher
Must have less than 2 years professional experience relevant to BV
Required intermittent travel to project sites
Required short-term and long-term relocation to project sites and regional offices
All applicants must have work authorization and will not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa

Competencies

Decision quality

Salary Plan

About the job
Walsall, West Midlands based – Brand new net-zero brick factory

Competitive Salary Plus Benefits

Are you an inspirational engineer? Would you like to work for the UK’s largest brick maker? Do you want to be part of a ground breaking engineering team where we put our people at the heart of everything we do? If so, this may just be the role for you!

We are looking for talented Electrical Engineers to become an integral part of our new, exciting, state-of-the-art net-zero factory with Ibstock Plc. Join the Ibstock team, and take your place leading the way as an exemplar of British Manufacturing and global environmental best practice in the construction products sector.

Our new factory will be a pathfinder project, highly automated with significant investment having been made in some of the latest robotic innovations and it will be able to produce more than 100 million bricks every single year! However, building the factory is only part of the story because in order to bring it to life, we need to find the very best people to work in it!

JOB PURPOSE

As an Electrical Engineer, you will be responsible for plant wide proactive and reactive maintenance activities, to ensure the optimum performance of the factory.

ROLE OVERVIEw
Work with the factory team to implement the strategic plan for the site.
Utilise a Computerised Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to facilitate planned preventative maintenance and stock control.
Carry out planned preventative maintenance, inspections, service and repairs.
Carry out reactive maintenance activities as required.
Ensure all relevant data is recorded accurately.
Application of the Ibstock Management System (IMS) to generate and facilitate continuous improvement practices across all areas of the manufacturing facility to optimise capability.

Know Ledge, Skills And Experience
Has knowledge of current Health, Safety, and Environmental legislation in a manufacturing workplace.
Is an outstanding team player, who is flexible and meets challenge with a pragmatic and resilient approach.
Has the ability to fault find, repair and provide solutions to problems.
Is able to use IT systems effectively.

Desirable
Is experienced in working in a preventative planned maintenance environment.
Has experience of maintaining large engineering plant and equipment:
Maintaining electrical equipment
Carrying out fault diagnosis on electrical equipment and circuits
Modifying or rewiring electrical circuits
Carrying out fault diagnosis on fluid power equipment and circuits
Siemens PLC Fault Finding

Qualifications Required
Advanced Apprenticeship (Level 3) in Electrical Maintenance (or equivalent).

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that some people from minority groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Here at Ibstock PLC we are dedicated to building belonging, empowering you to be your true self by offering a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you are excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Ibstock PLC are committed and passionate about building a diverse environment. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, national origin, disability or age.

About the job

With more than 120 operations and approximately 20,000 employees worldwide, Precision Castparts Corp. is the market leader in manufacturing large, complex structural investment castings, airfoil castings, forged components, aerostructures and highly engineered, critical fasteners for aerospace applications. In addition, we are the leading producer of airfoil castings for the industrial gas turbine market. We also manufacture extruded seamless pipe, fittings, and forgings for power generation and oil & gas applications; commercial and military airframe aerostructures; and metal alloys and other materials for the casting and forging industries. With such critical applications, we insist on quality and dependability – not just in the materials and products we make, but in the people we recruit.

PCC is relentless in its dedication to being a high-quality, low-cost and on-time producer; delivering the highest value to its customers while continually pursuing strategic, profitable growth.

In 2016, Berkshire Hathaway, led by Chairman and CEO Warren E. Buffett, acquired Precision Castparts Corp.

Job Description

Process Quality Engineer

Essential Job Functions:

Work with a multifunctional team, to drive customer satisfaction, product compliance with industry codes and customer requirements.
Conduct training on quality assurance concepts and tools.
Familiarize with AS9100, API, AS13100 standards and associated tools.
Active and daily participation in our internal audit program. Includes performing audits and making sure all audits and audit findings are closed in a timely manner.
Support area managers and training center with closing gaps and making improvements to our training process and documentation.
Provide hands on support with implementation of corrective actions, updates of procedures, and working across departments to drive actions to closure.
Use a pareto analysis to identify and drive quality improvement projects to eliminate our high defect drivers.
Work with departments to update the PFMEA to capture failure modes identified through defect analysis.
Conduct MSA studies when necessary.
Perform 6S audits

Required Experience and knowledge:

Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of five (5) years of professional work experience as a Quality Engineer. Aerospace Quality experience is preferred.
Drawing interpretation, and familiarity with regulatory specifications (AS9100, ISO9001, API, NADCAP, etc.).
Prior experience in areas of quality assurance such as: RCCA, controls plans, internal auditing, process control, calibration, document control and product evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to provide technical leadership and teamwork across functional boundaries.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
Experience using Microsoft office products (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)

This position will report to the Quality Director

About the job
Job description:

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:

The Automation Engineering position provides hands-on, technical support for new and existing automated processes at the Raleigh, NC site. The primary functions of this role include working with and troubleshooting programmable logic controllers (PLC's), vision systems, and other automated control systems, preventive maintenance, new equipment installations, and system integrations. This position is based in a highly technical manufacturing facility and requires strong attention to detail, commitment to quality, a high degree of flexibility, good communication skills, a desire to learn, and the ability to work in a safe manner. The Automation Engineering Technician will work with the Project Engineers, Process Engineers, Process Mechanics, Facilities Mechanics and other Operations personnel to make sure that all equipment is fully functional and maintained for maximum utility. The Automation Engineering Technician is a "hands on" role. This position will work under the supervision of the Engineering Manager, along with the Automation Engineers, applying scientific knowledge, engineering knowledge, mathematics, and ingenuity to complete assignments related to the support of automated systems and equipment in the manufacturing environment and serve as a key technical resource for automated systems focusing on preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and problem resolution for electronic/mechanical equipment issues.



YOUR ROLE:

-Diagnose and troubleshoot PLC, vision systems, and other automated control systems.

-Provides troubleshooting support for automated manufacturing equipment.

-Diagnose and troubleshoot motor/drive controller issues.

-Develop and review electrical and other drawings in support of plant processes.

-Communicate ideas and concerns effectively in working with team members.

-Works with internal customer and implementation resources to meet project requirements.

-Assist Automation Engineers in developing scope of work for Automation/Instrument and Controls system, networks and projects.

-Guide the development of, or reviews of, P&IDs, One Line Diagrams, Schematics and I/O lists. Identify and consult with others on solutions to unusual, difficult, or complex tasks.

-Assist Automation Engineers in developing preliminary and final cost estimates.

-Work with internal resources for design preferences, HMI graphics design and standard development.

-Prioritize and balance competing project demands and conflicting project requirements.



YOUR BACKGROUND:

-Associates Degree in Electrical Engineering; Mechanical Engineering; or equivalent. 2+ years hands on automation experience.

-Experience in programming, maintaining and troubleshooting PLCs (Allen-Bradley preferred). HMIs (PanelView), variable-speed drives, vision systems, servo-systems, industrial sensors and Relay Ladder Logic.

-Experience completing and documenting preventive and non-routine maintenance.

-Proficiency with Rockwell software, such as RS Logix 5000, RS Studio 5000 FactoryTalk Studio, etc.

-Knowledge/Experience programming and integration of Fanuc robotics.

-Experience working in a pharmaceutical or regulated industrial environment.

-Passion for finding better ways, developing and documenting best practices.

-Ability to read and understand P&IDs and control schematics. Installation and maintenance of industrial communication control networks.

-Communicate clearly and concisely in verbal and written communications.

-Strong background in standard PC applications, Computer validation knowledge.

About the job
CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our 10,000 employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.

Summary

CHS has an exciting opportunity at our Oil Refinery facility in McPherson, Kansas. We are looking for a Senior Electrical Engineer to prepare designs and specifications related to refinery electrical equipment, distribution systems for electric power, and control systems. You must be a detail-oriented, results-driven individual with a commitment to quality, accuracy and the ability to organize and prioritize workloads to meet deadlines. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to work in both a team environment and on self-directed tasks are essential. To be considered, qualified candidates must live in the McPherson/Wichita, KS surrounding area.

Responsibilities
Make recommendation for equipment changes that will improve reliability and efficiency.
Develop designs and layouts of electrical systems.
Write specifications for and requisition material and equipment.
Perform liaison work with Purchasing Department and Warehouse on equipment and materials involved in designs.
Review drawings, specifications and purchase orders prepared by outside contractors and relating to CHS's electrical systems under the direction of Manager or Sr. Engineer.
Oversee work of CHS drafters on electrical work.
Confer with Maintenance Department concerning new construction and maintenance problems.
Make field inspections of new construction, and maintenance projects.
Confer with process engineers regarding design projects.
Check invoices of outside contractors.
Make cost estimates on new construction and maintenance work.
Administer/establish electrical equipment reliability programs including transformer oil testing, infrared scanning and surveys, vibration monitoring, electric motor PdMA, and lubrication programs.
Oversee Process Safety Management (PSM) electrical areas of concern including area electrical classification, arc-flash studies and requirements for PPE, electrical relay coordination, and LOTO of electrical systems and equipment.
Act as liaison between CHS and the Board of Public Utilities (BPU).
Keep abreast of new technology as relates to electrical equipment and distribution systems.
Assist lower-level engineers as needed on projects.
Wear appropriate personal protective equipment, including respirators.
Maintain and promote a strong safety culture and follow all safety policies, procedures, and regulations. Identify and communicate workplace hazards and correct or seek assistance in correcting unsafe actions or conditions.
Perform other duties as needed or assigned.

Minimum Qualifications (required)
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Engineering Technology
4+ years of related electrical engineering experience

Additional Qualifications
Proficient with MS Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook
Experience in a refinery or petrochemical plant
Licensed Professional Engineer
Experience with power and power distribution equipment in industrial environment with medium and lower voltage applications, and familiarity with relay coordination software and reliability methods
Experience with plant construction and large sized projects in excess of $10 million
Experience working with construction and consulting organizations
Ability to Design and Specify Plant Low, Medium and High Voltage Power Systems, Motor Control Centers, Variable Frequency Drives, PLC Panels, Switches
Ability to coordinate the communication for projects involving outside utilities, department managers and outside consulting agencies to keep everyone informed of project schedule, goals, objectives, and necessary equipment and manpower

Physical Requirements
Ability to wear all required PPE, including respirators
Pre-employment screening is based on the job requirements and industry guidelines and may or may not be required for the position. If required, selected candidates must pass pre-employment screenings to include all or a combination of drug, criminal, motor vehicle check, physical requirements and FMSCA Clearinghouse.

CHS offers a competitive total compensation package. Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision, Hearing, Life Insurance, Health and Day Care Savings Accounts, Paid Vacation, 401K, Company Funded Pension, Profit Sharing, Long and Short Term Disability, Tuition reimbursement, and Adoption assistance.

About the job
Job Location: Hershey, PA (travel is required and project-dependent)

Job Summary:

The Sr. Engineer, Process Design & Implementation will perform conceptual and detailed engineering design, implement, and execute capital projects, and manage small capital projects. This position will work collaboratively with other Engineers, Manufacturing Business Units, Quality and Regulatory Compliance, Commercial Teams, and Vendors. The successful candidate will demonstrate integrity, strong communication and people skills, analytical mindset, project leadership, and technical acumen.

Role Responsibilities:

Conceptual and detailed engineering design and cost estimation for capital projects supporting North American manufacturing:
Develop manufacturing solutions that meet the business requirements and provide processing solution for the project.
PFD & P&ID generation and development.
Equipment speciﬁcation & selection and evaluation of equipment suppliers.
Cost estimating for capital projects and process solutions.

Implementation & Execution of capital projects to support North American Manufacturing:
Construction scope and bid package development for small to large capital projects.
Coordinate and oversee the Equipment and system installation, check- out, and commissioning.
Successful transition of deliverables and documentation to Plant Operations and Maintenance.

Capital Project Management:
Budget, schedule, and resource management of small to medium size capital projects.
Make critical decisions under pressure and with limited information.

Qualifications:
B.S. in Chemical, Mechanical, Food, Agricultural, or other closely related field
At least 4 years of experience working in Food Processing or Chocolate and Confectionery Industry
Process engineering, process design and project management experience, including process troubleshooting and optimization

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Required:

Knowledge and experience in process design typical for the food and pharma industry, including:
A basic understanding of common process unit operations and equipment used; A basic understanding of sanitary design and construction practices; A basic understanding of GMP’s; A general knowledge of common equipment suppliers
Possess a basic understanding of the design, application, and maintenance of food manufacturing equipment, material handling, process piping systems, and process automation & instrumentation.
Demonstrated proﬁciencies in the food, pharmaceutical or other industry that is relative to Hershey manufacturing processes.
Prioritize solutions and develop schedules based on an understanding of the required business objectives.
Proven troubleshooting and optimization skills

Additional information regarding travel & location:
This position will require domestic and international travel at times to support the ongoing business. Travel is project dependent.

About the job
HCLTech is a global technology company, home to 222,000+ people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering and cloud, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending December 2022 totaled $12.3 billion. To learn how we can supercharge progress for you, visit https://www.hcltech.com/.

About this Job

This position will be accountable for translating system requirements into appropriate high voltage electrical system designs, integrating power sources, drivetrain architectures, and accessory components into one system for machine programs. It will also have accountability for electrical system auditing, trouble-shooting, validation, and issue resolution to ensure alignment to safety and regulatory standards and reliability expectations.

Responsibilities
• Creating electrical sub-system diagrams
• Sizing high voltage cables
• Ensuring proper overload protection device selection and coordination
• Driving usage of validated high voltage connection systems
• Reviewing cable and harness routings
• Assisting ePowertrain technical leads in conveying the software requirements and component electronic information for HV diagnostics, events, and warnings to the various controls teams and integration teams as needed
• On-site build support
• Troubleshooting and analysis of field data
• Contributing to Service Literature creation

Responsibilities also include:
• Educating process partners on the hazards and best practices for working on high voltage electrical systems
• Assisting with establishing and documenting high voltage electrical system integration best practices
• Working with software teams to create machine software libraries for the product lines of accessory components being established by the power electronics team
Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical, Computer, or Automotive Engineering.
• Minimum 10 years of engineering experience
• Minimum 5 years of electrical schematic creation and harnessing experience
• Minimum 2 years of machine electrical system integration experience
Top Candidates Will Also Have:
• Experience driving common solutions across multiple platforms to reduce engineering effort
• Experience with CREO electrical schematic tools and the print release process

Why Us
We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 60+ countries across the globe and 222,000 employees
Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented

About the job
Electrical Controls Engineer – Orlando, FL
Exciting opportunity for an Electrical Controls Engineer with Design experience in Orlando, FL!
WestRock is a company where each of us genuinely belongs, is respected and valued, can do our best work, and where diversity, inclusion and equity are competitive advantages!
The Opportunity:

The Electrical Controls Engineer position is responsible for bringing together electrical design and programming associated with WestRock’s equipment. This position is with our Automated Packaging System (APS) Team based in Orlando, FL where you will assist to develop equipment through the implementation of immerging technologies and best in class controls design practices.

How you will impact WestRock:
Develop efficient flow charts for the theory of machine operation to serve as a basis for efficient controls design and programming.
Develop root level Allen-Bradley PLC and HMI control programs.
Interface with Project Management and Mechanical Engineering team to ensure that electrical designs and programming are in-line with overall project objectives.
Assist the Application Engineering department to develop strong control concepts to support new customer applications.
Research and implement immerging technologies that lead to world class design and implementation of WestRock equipment, with strong emphasis on design flexibility and redeployment.
Create a foundation of commonly utilized and proven designs/programs that can be standardized/reutilized.
Attend conferences and training as required to maintain proficiency.

What you need to succeed:
B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and technical/professional experience.
Minimum 3-years’ experience in electrical/controls/programming - Required
CAD skill required (AutoCAD Electrical preferred). Ability to implement industry safety standards into electrical and programming design for robot cells:
Strong Microsoft apps skills: i.e., Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Analytical ability and great problem-solving skills.
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking skills.
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence.
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities.
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies, and potential.
Benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k with match and more!
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.
WestRock is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to create and maintain a diverse workforce where everyone feels valued, respected, and included. WestRock does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

About the job
Teledyne Scientific Company has an immediate opening at its Thousand Oaks, California facility to add a Power Electronics Engineer to the team! The Power Electronics Engineer plans and executes research activities in power electronics development, integration, prototyping and testing of high-performance dc-dc converters.

Job Duties:
Plans and executes research activities in power electronics development, integration, prototyping and testing of high-performance dc-dc converters.
Be knowledgeable with power electronic circuits, gate drivers and control, wide bandgap power devices, and high frequency passive components.
Have a sound understanding of the fundamental concepts and principles of power electronic design and diagnosis of problems and their resolutions during prototype development and tests.
Assist in the design of robust, high frequency power converters assembled using chip-scale packaging.
Effectively communicate results using written technical reports and verbal presentations. Frequent and effective communication among a diverse group of scientists and engineers is a must.
Ability to work across a diverse team composed of wide bandgap device design engineers, power device processing engineers, passive component designers and process developers, and layout/packaging engineers.
Ability to meet deadlines and rapid resolution of problems in fast-paced R&D projects.

Requirements:
Proficient in circuit layout, assembly, prototyping, and testing
Proficient with test equipment, such as oscilloscopes, high voltage/high current and fast transient probes, impedance and network analyzers.
Assist with the design of power electronic components by interacting within the team and providing critical design insights.
Prior experience in high frequency power electronics, integration, prototyping, and testing.

Required minimum education and experience:
M.S. in Electrical Engineering or related field with focus on power electronics.
Knowledge of basic principles of power electronic design and integration.
Previous experience in prototyping of power electronic circuits, testing and diagnosis/resolution of issues.
Demonstrated proficiency with written and verbal communications, and ability to work within a diverse group of engineers.
Citizenship Requirements
Due to the type of work at the facility and certain access restrictions, successful applicants must be a U.S. Citizen.

What can Teledyne offer YOU?
A Competitive Salary & Benefits Package
Excellent Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance as of First Day
Paid Vacation and Sick Time
Paid Holidays
401(k) Eligibility with Company Match
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Educational Tuition Reimbursement
Employee Fun Events throughout the year

About Us
Teledyne Technologies Incorporated specializes in providing a broad range of high technology solutions and products to the marketplace. Teledyne Scientific Company, the central Research Lab of Teledyne Technologies, is a cutting edge R&D organization with more than 50 years of legacy of new technology development and transition. The company has world class laboratories and facilities, and a highly dynamic, multi-disciplinary work environment.

column1: Electrical Engineer - Hydrogen and Process *Texas Hybrid*
column8:
About the job
Together, we own our company, our future, and our shared success.

As an employee-owned company, our people are Black & Veatch. We put them at the center of everything we do and empower them to grow, explore new possibilities and use their diverse talents and perspectives to solve humanity's biggest challenges in an ever-evolving world. With over 100 years of innovation in sustainable infrastructure and our expertise in engineering, procurement, consulting and construction, together we are building a world of difference.

Company : Black & Veatch Corporation

Req Id : 97047

Opportunity Type : Staff

Relocation eligible : Yes

Full time/Part time : Full-Time

Project Only Hire : No

Visa Sponsorship Available: No

Why Black and Veatch

Recognized by Glassdoor as a 2023 Top 100 place to work , Black & Veatch allows you to lend your talent and perspective to humanity’s biggest challenges in a flexible environment where you are empowered to grow and explore new possibilities. We offer competitive compensation; 401K match and benefits that start day 1. Our hybrid environment allows you to balance your work and personal life.

At Black & Veatch, you own your career with purpose and meaning . You are empowered to grow and explore new possibilities at every step of your career journey. Bring your big ideas knowing you are safe to be who you are and speak up with concerns or questions and put your diverse talents and perspectives to use.

The Opportunity

The Electrical Engineer will work in a mid-level engineer capacity performing all aspects of conventional design engineering and analysis. Under the direction and support of a Senior Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work on a slated two-year Hydrocarbon Processing (HPI) project encompassing petroleum refining, gas processing, petrochemical, and chemical technologies. There is also potential to work on projects encompassing other areas of process such as hydrogen, ammonia & fertilizer, new energy, and LNG. In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Work in new areas of energy such as hydrogen, ammonia, and other new energy technologies.
Explore various technologies within the process space to expand your skillset and knowledge.

If you want to grow and further develop your technical skills in the GFC industry alongside our most talented engineering professionals and clients - this is an excellent opportunity for you! Although project experience ingas, fuels and chemicals (GFC) is preferred - we are interested and excited to consider candidates with any Power Generation Facility design experience (i.e. LV/MV - Power Plants, Nuclear Plants, Hydrogen Facilities, etc.).

Please note: This role will be hybrid: 2 days per week remote, 3 days per week in-office out of any Black and Veatch office in Texas or our headquarters in Overland Park, KS. It is a plus if you live in the Houston, TX area. We are open to assisting with relocation if you are open to moving to one of our TX office locations or our headquarters!

The Team

Black & Veatch's Oil, Gas & Chemical Electrical Engineering team provides services from consulting, design, full engineering, procurement & construction (EPC), and commissioning & start-up for LNG facilities, Floating LNG facilities, gas processing & NGL fractionation, gasification & gas to liquids, hydrogen, and ammonia & fertilizers.

Our knowledge, capabilities, and innovation include our proprietary PRICO® technologies. This enables our team to assess and choose tailored solutions with greater quality and efficiency for our clients. The value chain spans natural gas, natural gas liquids, midstream, wholesale markets, power generation, and utility segments.

Key Responsibilities

Prepare a variety of moderately complex engineering calculations and deliverables following standard methods and principles.
Perform complex research and develop recommendations for equipment and/or materials selection.
Understand and adhere to budget, schedule, and quality requirements.
Initiate contact with other disciplines as needed to identify and coordinate details of work.
Actively seek to understand and apply client interests and drivers through normal client contact and through interaction and communication with project leadership.
May provide direction, guidance, and mentoring to others.

Preferred Qualifications
EIT and/or PE Certification
Experience as an electrical engineer in the process, oil & gas, new energy, ammonia & fertilizer, LNG, floating LNG, or hydrogen generation spaces.
Working knowledge of the NEC (NFPA 70 National Electrical Code).
Experience with at least 2 of the following:
Hazardous Area Classifications as defined by the NEC.
ETAP or SKM Electrical system analysis modeling software.
Industrial power distribution system designs including MV and LV switchgear, MCC’s, VFD’s, power distribution transformers, batteries and UPS.
Protective relay settings and equipment sizing calculations associated with power distribution equipment.

Minimum Qualifications

Requires a bachelor's degree in engineering from either a recognized accredited program in their home country or the country in which the professional is practicing.
Minimum of 3 years related work experience.
All applicants must be able to complete pre-employment onboarding requirements (if selected) which may include any/all of the following: criminal/civil background check, drug screen, and motor vehicle records search, in compliance with any applicable laws and regulations.

Salary Plan

ENG: Engineering

Job Grade

129

Black & Veatch endeavors to make www.bv.com/careers accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process because of a disability, please contact the Employee Relations Department at +1-913-359-1622 or via our accommodations request form . This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only; you may not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications. General inquiries about the status of applications will not be returned.

Black & Veatch is committed to being an employer of choice by creating a valuable work experience that keeps our people engaged, productive, safe and healthy.

Our comprehensive benefits portfolio is a key component of this commitment and offers an array of health care benefits including but not limited to medical, dental and vision insurances along with disability and a robust wellness program.

To support a healthy work-life balance, we offer flexible work schedules, paid vacation and holiday time, sick time, and dependent sick time.

A variety of additional benefits are available to our professionals, including a company-matched 401k plan, adoption reimbursement, tuition reimbursement, vendor discounts, an employment referral program, AD&D insurance, pre-taxed accounts, voluntary legal plan and the B&V Credit Union. Professionals may also be eligible for a performance-based bonus program.

We are proud to be a 100 percent ESOP-owned company. As employee-owners, our professionals are empowered to drive not only their personal growth, but the company's long-term achievements - and they share in the financial rewards of the success through stock ownership.

By valuing diverse voices and perspectives, we cultivate an authentically inclusive environment for professionals and are able to provide innovative and effective solutions for clients.

Black & Veatch Holding Company, its subsidiaries and its affiliated companies, complies with all Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) affirmative action laws and regulations. Black & Veatch does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender Identity and expression, disability, veteran status, pregnancy status or other status protected by law.

For our EEO Policy Statement, please click here . If you’d like more information on your EEO rights under the law, please click here and here .

Notice to External Search Firms: Black & Veatch does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be obligated to pay a placement fee for unsolicited resumes. Black & Veatch Talent Acquisition engages with search firms directly for hiring needs.

About the job
Job description:

About Tower Semiconductor
Recruiting World Class Talent For A World Class Leader! Join Tower Semiconductor!

Looking for a career path in the high tech manufacturing industry? Become part of a team focused on delivering the most exciting semiconductor technology to the world! If you enjoy working with others in a fast pace environment and are looking for an opportunity to grow your career in the high tech industry then Tower Semiconductor is the place to be!

Tower Semiconductor is a global specialty foundry leader! We specialize in manufacturing analog integrated circuits for more than 300 customers worldwide in growing markets such as automotive, medical, industrial, consumer and aerospace and defense, among others.

Job Description
Tower Semiconductor is searching for a recent engineering/science Ph.D. graduate to be assigned to the Diffusion/Epitaxy area as a process engineer to support sustaining, area improvements, process transfers, and development in a high volume manufacturing fab located in San Antonio, TX. The Tower Semiconductor fab in San Antonio is a growing manufacturing site, delivering specialty electronic devices for a wide range of applications with high quality, low cost, and excellent cycle times. A qualified candidate will be self-motivated, have strong technical and analytical skills, and posses a practical, hands-on approach to engineering problems.



This Job Is For You If
Take ownership of the processes assigned and establish the direction for improvements, sustaining, and overall operation.
Work closely with process and integration engineers to improve process metrics, such as SPC, yield, parametrics, and defects, as well as to achieve first-pass success of technology transfers.
Selection and qualification of semiconductor processing tools.
Monitor fab metrics with statistical process control (SPC).
Root cause investigation of discrepant material. Implement yield and defect improvement projects.
Write operating specifications and provide technical training to wafer fab personnel.
Work with equipment engineering to improve uptime, tool utilization, and flexibility.
Troubleshoot process and tool excursions.
Identify cost savings opportunities and drive projects to reduce overall costs.
Implement advanced process control to improve Cpk at critical levels.
Ensure matching of newly installed equipment to support production ramp.
Develop new semiconductor manufacturing processes using design of experiments (DOE).
Harden fault detection and classification (FDC) strategy in the areas of responsibility.
Job Requirements
Recent Ph.D. graduate, preferably in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or Physics.
Minimum 3 years of hands on diffusion experience.
Demonstrated above average academic performance.
Highly desirable coursework includes semiconductor processing technology, device physics, and statistics.
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience with semiconductor fabrication tools.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Candidate must be able to communicate with audiences at any technical level.
Must be a self-starter, dependable and highly motivated.
Ability to work and communicate with equipment engineering to improve the area.
Strong problem solving and data analysis skills.
Strong computer skills.
This position requires an adaptable, detail oriented practical thinker and problem solver who is a quick learner and who has the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
*MON*

About the job
As a preferred provider of wet and dry process technology, our client looks forward to talking with smart, energetic, team-oriented people who can grow with them. They provide competitive salary and benefits, including employee stock ownership, and some of the best co-workers you’ll find anywhere. If this appeals to you, please read on!

Job Title: Sr. Electrical Engineer
Location: Chandler/Phoenix, AZ

This individual will assume responsibility for technical assignments for the design and development of semiconductor capital equipment and other industrial machinery, and will draw upon their experience with AC/DC power distribution, automation & PLC control systems, and digital/analog interface & cabling interconnection.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
· Design AC/DC power distribution systems per NFPA 79, SEMI S2
· Design motion controls with stepper/servo motor & drive, temperature PID control
· Design PLC I/O controls: Beckhoff PLC, I/O & safety modules, RS232/485, Profibus, Profinet
· Schematic capture, component layout, cable drawing, bill of material, ECO documents
· AutoCAD, OrCAD, 3D SolidWorks a plus
· Electrical troubleshooting
· Project management and design reviews
· Support production on new system assembly & test
· Work on CIP projects
· Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
· BS or MS degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical discipline, with 10+ years of experience

About the job
TITLE: Plant Electrical Engineer

LOCATION:

Ingredion is hiring a Plant Electrical Engineer to provide technical leadership in support of maintenance and operation of the site power distribution systems, and to ensure continuous improvement in the system reliability.

The PLANT SERVICES Group is focused on providing technical and operational support services to ensure more efficient and reliable plant production operations.

As a PLANT ELECTRICAL ENGINEER, Your Responsibilities Will Include

Managing and coordinating the execution of the annual MV preventative maintenance program.
Monitoring key performance variables in the electrical distribution system and coordinating tactical countermeasures to address risks to system reliability and safety.
Knowledge of Motor Controls, MCCs, VFDs, Wye-Delta starters, Medium Voltage starters,
Understanding of Control Systems and PLCs, DCS,
Background in plant instrumentation; Pressure, flow, temperature, pHs,
Developing and executing against strategic capital plans, ensuring delivery of scope within cost and timeline expectations.
Providing expert troubleshooting support related to electrical and power distribution systems.
Maintaining technical documentation for power distribution system, including design data, process models, and historical performance data.
Knowledge of applicable codes and standards including: OSHA, ANSI, IEEE, NEC, NFPA, and NEMA.
Driving continuous improvement in electrical system reliability through the Preventative Maintenance Optimization (PMO) cycle, and through root cause analysis (RCA).
Partnering with site electrical maintenance contractors to establish and maintain a high standard of trade skill and execution capability to support plant needs.
Providing electrical design development, evaluation, and implementation support for project engineers and unit maintenance teams.
Managing Arc Flash Safety program and electrical/instrumentation PM documentation.
Ensuring application of best-in-class technologies and techniques in control of electrical systems.

The PLANT ELECTRICAL ENGINEER position is well-suited for you if you:

Enjoy working with cross-functional and multi-disciplinary teams to solve complex technical challenges.
Show a passion for reliability and proactive mindset.
Demonstrate strong initiative and sound technical judgement.
Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic manufacturing environment.

Qualified Candidates Will Have

Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering
7-10 years of experience in industrial power distribution
the ability to apply analytical problem-solving techniques to identify and resolve root causes
the ability to distill complex technical information to speak to a broad group of stakeholders and facilitate a clear understanding of risk
a proven track record of delivery against project objectives
PMP and/or CMRP a plus
Knowledge of steam turbine generator a plus

Relocation Available? YES Within country

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, military status, or disability status.

Relocation Available:

Yes, Within Country

About the job
Req ID: 116257
Region: Americas
Country: United States
State/Province: Texas
City: Richardson
Job Summary
The RF Engineer is responsible for leading and managing the work of developing new electrical systems/circuits for various applications. Research system ideas and draw up plans for these systems, and capture them in schematics and system specifications. Test, simulate, validate and qualify their systems and make adjustments as needed. Provide support throughout the manufacturing of the electrical systems they have designed.
The Manager, Electrical Design Engineering manages cross functional teams with other designers, customers, manufacturing engineering and project leadership to ensure robust and high quality product development. Enhance designs with feedback from reviews in areas such as manufacturing, test, supply chain, reliability, industrial design and simulations.
Detailed Description
Performs tasks such as, but not limited to, the following:
Lead the design, development and implementation of technical solutions in multiple domains. Participate in project planning and scheduling.
Review, interpret and may negotiate customer requirements/specifications and provide customer feedback
Lead the deployment of strategic programs and coordinate site-wide deployment efforts.
Proactively promote industry best practices
May manage relationships with key vendors/partners.
Design, modify and implement systems that meet customer and Celestica needs. E.g. creation of Schematics, Bills of material, diagrams, drawings, etc.
Testing, simulation and measuring (including troubleshooting) the performance of systems
Keep up to date with relevant industry knowledge and regulations
Solve complex problems
Liaison with suppliers, customers, contractors, and other internal teams.
Analyze and interpret data and information
Recommend modifications for systems
Create reports and documentation
Set yearly plans and goals for the department, give direction on expected performance, provide regular performance evaluations and ongoing feedback. Accountable for all department objectives and achieving agreed targets for key performance indicators.
Enabling CompetenciesProject Management - Ability to manage/lead complex, multiple line engineering projects that may also involve other functions. Demonstrate solid understanding of the technical, financial and people aspects of the project. Able to create a project/change management plan and ensure that the project is delivered within the assigned time and budget. Ability to recognize project barriers and develop mitigation plans
Leadership - Demonstrate "People & Team Leadership Behaviors" as per Celestica Leadership Imperatives.
Financial Acumen / Business Planning - Ability to create financial plans for your projects, align them internally with your line of management and other functions and externally if needed. Create project plans, profitability calculations, risk and sensitivity analysis, able to recognize barriers and mitigate profitability risks. Fully knowledgeable about internal and external financial reporting, accounting and tax requirements relevant to your area of expertise.
The following competencies may also be required: Coaching/Mentoring; Communication/Negotiation/Presentation; Creative Problem Solving; Customer Interaction/Stakeholder Management; Quality & Lean; Working Effectively with Others; D/PFMEA; 8D/Corrective Action; Equipment Safety; Design of Experiments (DOE).
Technical Competencies
The following are the associated Technical Competencies that are required for the various Standard Jobs within the Design Engineering Electrical career stream. This list is for illustrative purposes and may not be inclusive of all skills.
Standard Job : Technical Skills DIGITAL/LOGIC : EE-Embedded, FPGA, DSP, Static Timing, Tolerance Analysis, EE-Digital, EE-Power Point of Load supplies, EE-Battery, Signal Integrity, Schematic Modeling, Power Integrity, ESD Controls & Standards
POWER : EE-Power Switching Supply, EE-Point of Load Supplies, EE-Battery, Power Integrity-CoreSim, Tolerance Analysis, EE-Analog, Schematic Modeling
PCB/LAYOUT : Signal Integrity, Schematic Modeling, Cadence, Mentor Xpedition, Mentor PADS, Altium Designer, Other Layout tools, Tolerance Analysis, Power Integrity
SCHEMATIC DESIGN/SIGNAL INTEGRITY: EE-Digital, EE-Analog, Tolerance Analysis, Static Timing, Schematic Modeling
ANALOG : EE-Analog, Tolerance Analysis, RF Design(<5Ghz), High Frequency (>20Ghz) RF Design
RF : EE-Analog, RF Design (<5Ghz), High Frequency (>20Ghz) RF Design, Signal Integrity, Tolerance Analysis
Physical Demands
Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment.
Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data.
Repetitive manual movements (e.g., data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc.) are frequently required.
Occasional travel may be required.
Typical Experience
4 to 6 years.
Typical Education
Bachelor degree
Notes: This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
Celestica’s policy on equal employment opportunity prohibits discrimination based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran or disability status, or other characteristics protected by law.
This policy applies to hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, fringe benefits, job training, classification, referral and other aspects of employment and also states that retaliation against a person who files a charge of discrimination, participates in a discrimination proceeding, or otherwise opposes an unlawful employment practice will not be tolerated. POSITION SUMMARY for a Station Equipment Standard Engineer:

Each of the positions in the Engineering job family is responsible for performing engineering work activities and projects requiring the application of engineering knowledge in a safe, effective, efficient manner for the accomplishment of assigned objectives. The following are activities that will be performed, but not limited to:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Subject Matter Expert (SME) for assigned station equipment: knowledge lead for specific station equipment and technologies; answering all technical, design, and application questions; leading SME team meetings and training support SMEs’; supporting all aspects of the equipment such as design application, installation and testing, maintenance practices, and long-term support and operation; write, review, and contribute to the development of system-wide specifications, guidelines, and processes.
Equipment Contract bid events and support: development of technical RFI, RFP, and bid templates; leading technical evaluation of bids; creating recommendation of award for management review; coordinating drawing review, approval, and implementation into design standards, specifications; developing catalog templates and ordering guides; participate in contract maintenance and lifecycle activities.
Turn-Key Project bid events for specialized technology: development of technical RFI, RFP, and bid templates; leading technical evaluation of bids; creating recommendation of award for management review; interface with AEP portion of Turn-Key project; lead drawing and design reviews; act as a technical PM for the project; help maintain the implementation schedule and meet the ISD; provide Engineering support for Commissioning and Construction activities; lead the project close-out efforts.
Engineering support for existing FACTs/HVDC installations: technical Coordinator and Subject Matter Expert (SME) for FACTs and HVDC installations including Static VAR Compensators (SVCs), Static Synchronous Compensator (STATCOM), high-voltage, direct current (HVDC), Series Capacitors, Synchronous Condensers, Energy Storage, and other FACTs or Technology Fleet projects as assigned; responsible for entire life cycle of project including field and operation support after commissioning.
Engineering support for Asset Management: support of all asset management systems including, IPS and Asset Health Monitoring and training for engineering and field groups; participate in development of studies for systematic asset management and rehab programs for major station equipment and assist with equipment sparing needs; ensure data quality of Asset Management systems and provide updates as standards change.
Technical liaison between equipment vendors and Station Engineering: get quotes, drawings, or other technical information as required by different project needs; facilitate communication and support for engineering and all other stakeholders; lead failure analysis of station equipment and champion lessons learned and continuous improvement initiatives
Battery Energy Storage System projects: support Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) projects for Energy Delivery for both Transmission and Distribution; support and lead project through stages such as bids, overseeing engineering and design, supporting construction and commissioning, and solving operational and maintenance issues as needed.
Technical Proficiency of PCE and TLE Standards: understand PCE and TLE standards from a high-level and how they interact with SE standards; familiarity with standards, codes, and regulations relevant to the area of assignment; understanding of Control Diagrams, Schematics and Manufacturer Outline Drawings.

About the job
Company Description

The California Independent System Operator (ISO) manages the flow of electricity across the high-voltage, long-distance power lines that make up 80 percent of California's power grid. We safeguard the economy and well-being of 30 million Californians by operating the grid reliably 24/7.

As the impartial grid operator, the California ISO opens access to the wholesale power market that is designed to diversify resources and lower prices. It also grants equal access to 25,865 circuit-miles of power lines and reduces barriers to diverse resources competing to bring power to customers.

The California ISO's function is often compared to that of air traffic controllers. It would be grossly unfair for air traffic controllers to represent one airline and profit from allowing that company's planes to go through before others. In the same way, the California ISO operates independently—managing the electron traffic on a power grid we do not own—making sure electricity is safely delivered to utilities and consumers on time and reliably.

The California ISO is committed to the health, safety, and work/life integration of it employees and is proud to offer flexible work arrangements. This position would be eligible to participate in a hybrid schedule.

Relocation Assistance is available.

Job Description

The person in this position serves as subject matter expert and technical lead within the PSTD department. Supports highly complex power system analytical assignments, leads technical discussions and implementation of software developments based on the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology, including development/reviewing/approving functional and non-functional business requirements, software design, test plans, and integration plans for both electricity market systems and advanced power systems applications. Ensures test cases for software changes are consistent with intended business requirements to minimize exposure to any unintended business consequences. Acts as project lead to implement policy changes and Operational enhancements initiatives. Maintain good relationships with other internal departments and with associated software vendors as appropriate to implement software changes in efficient and team spirit manner. Leads analysis of highly complex technical issues and business rules and presents results to other ISO's departments and external market participants in conferences, workshops, market simulations calls, and other internal and external stakeholder meetings as required to implement new market design policies, and new market and advanced power systems applications enhancements.

What's In It For You

Our purpose is to lead the way to tomorrow's energy network. Make a difference and impact millions of people who depend on electricity in their everyday lives.
You get to work on interesting and challenging assignments that will help grow your skill set.
You will work in an extremely collaborative environment inside our LEED certified Folsom, California campus.
You will be challenged, be a part of a winning team, and your contributions will be rewarded and recognized.
What You Will Be Doing
Leads project implementation teams to enable successful implementation of key projects and initiatives from inception to production delivery. Partners with project teams including project management office, policy, legal, and other ISO's operations business units, ensuring software development lifecycle of complex power systems software applications are successfully implemented based on industry best practices and SDLC methodology.
Performs and leads teams performing complex mathematical and engineering analysis of market software and advanced power systems applications results to determine optimality of solutions with respect to incurred cost and impact on reliability of the power system grid.
Performs and leads duties needed to supplement designing, testing, documenting, user training or other such activities associated with market applications, power system advanced applications, and other support legacy applications, including coordination with external market participants during market simulations, and responding to market participants disputes or inquiries when necessary.
Ensures complete and accurate documentation of implemented application or modification is developed and maintained to provide permanent records or system component and backup material with focus on adherence to requirements and compatibility of all segments of the project including the quality of work done by others.
Demonstrates a thorough knowledge of policy issues and related matters, and works under minimum supervision. Anticipates, identifies and resolves implementation, design and integration-related problems or potential problems within assigned areas, and may propose solutions to such issues. May propose solutions to issues and problems outside of assigned areas of responsibility.

We’re looking for people who put their innovation to work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.

What You Will Experience In This Position

Understand the challenges faced by prospects, customers, and the industry at large
Understand and document the customer requirements aligning
Align requirements with available software and hardware solutions
Create new solution definitions to meet customer challenges using electrical design and manufacturing applications
Create and deliver presales technical presentations (online and in-person) to demonstrate customer benefit.

Suggest enhancements to customer design and manufacturing processes in the electrical control systems market.
Create and support training and professional service offerings
Assist sales teams in understanding and navigating technical discussions with customers.

You Have

Previous experience in or with Technical sales / Pre-sales applications engineering roles, Post-sales implementation, Solution architecting
Ideally 5+ years working with Electrical design tools in the Enclosure and automation design space
3+ years of experience deploying engineering CAD solutions
3+ years providing professional training and implementation services
Driven and motivated to quickly gain sound knowledge and understanding of the policies and procedures of nVent
Interact well with multiple stakeholders and able to work in a global environment.
Possess excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Additional languages are a plus.
Strong learning agility and great analytical skills.
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Acesss)
Possess a high energy level and strong work ethic with a commitment to continuous improvement in a dynamic and changing environment that strives to exceed expectations.
Desire to work collectively and actively chip in to a positive team culture
Ability to travel up to 50% annually; some international

Preferred

Experience working with standard relational databases like MS SQL, Oracle, etc.
Demonstrated experience in programming or project management is an asset
Proficiency with E3.series design suite

We Have
A dynamic global reach with diverse operations around the world that will stretch your abilities, provide plentiful career opportunities, and allow you to make an impact every day
At nVent, we connect and protect a more sustainable and electrified world with inventive electrical solutions. We’re a nearly $3 billion high-performance electrical company with a dedicated team of 10,000+ people at more than 130 sites around the world. Our solutions deliver value to industrial, commercial, residential, energy and infrastructure customers, providing mission critical solutions that improve performance, lower costs and reduce downtime.
We design, manufacture, market, install and service high-performance products and solutions that connect and protect mission critical equipment, buildings and essential processes. Our robust portfolio of leading electrical product brands dates back more than 100 years and includes nVent CADDY, ERICO, HOFFMAN, RAYCHEM, SCHROFF and TRACER.

Dedicated to absolute integrity
Focused on the customer first
Respectful and team oriented
Optimistic and energizing
Accountable for performance
Benefits to support the lives of our employees

$84,000.00 - $156,000.00
