About the job
Arsenal Bio, a privately held programmable cell therapy company engineering advanced CAR T therapies for solid tumors, is seeking a talented Automation Engineer to work onsite based in our South San Frncisco office.

ArsenalBio’s mission is to develop efficacious and safe cellular therapies for patients with chronic diseases, initially cancer. Our products are being designed to herald the transition of adoptive cell therapy from a hospital based treatment to outpatient therapy, like most other cancer treatments.

Driven by a collective of diverse experts across immunology, synthetic biology, molecular biology, automation and computational biology, we are united in purpose to deliver radical breakthroughs for people with cancer, and prioritize the team’s outcomes over individual goals to achieve our company mission – together.

The role of lab automation engineer is difficult to characterize in one short breath. An enormous diversity of technologies run the modern lab, and the task of integrating these technologies together requires a uniquely wide-ranging amalgamation of skillset. Enter the automation engineer. From benchtop experiment, to process diagram, to liquid handler, to measurement modality, to data pipeline, to analysis, to operating with production-grade reliability… Each step of the way is within your purview. Your contributions will deliver unmatched scale to the screening of CAR-T therapy products, and will be on the bleeding edge of the best-in-class therapies ArsenalBio is developing. You will work between almost every group at the R&D stage at the company, forming the bridges between vision and execution for future screening programs.

What You Will Do:
Evaluate company and user requirements, evaluate existing and proposed workflows for automation, and design and build end-to-end automated solutions on a team of multi-talented engineers and scientists
Quick turnaround prototype development (automated protocol, software, hardware, etc) providing fast proof-of-concept to new ideas
Work closely with the Automation Operations team to develop and deliver automated protocols that can scale and be executed reliably
Design, implement, test, and continuously improve laboratory solutions in use by the Automation Operations team, as well as lab users across the organization
Stay informed of new technologies inside and outside of the industry that could bring innovation to the current status quo
Release and maintain documentation on development and production products, both for internal engineering use as well as externally facing documentation for lab users

What You Will Bring:
Bachelor’s degree in an engineering or biological sciences discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years industry experience, with 1-2 years experience in a technology development role (i.e. involvement in mechanical / electrical / software engineering, data science, systems engineering, mechatronics and robotics)
Strong computer skills, comfort navigating Windows and Unix based operating systems on an administrator level
Working proficiency in biological research techniques, including experience with a broad set of instruments and data types which are common in the laboratory setting
Strong understanding of the scientific method

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working in a laboratory or biology-adjacent environment
Experience with high-throughput experiment design, process design, and the instruments commonly used in these settings
Intermediate to professional proficiency with a programming language, C# and Python are immediately relevant
Comfort reading and applying ideas in a variety of programming languages, Javascript, Go, Java, C++
Experience with cloud platforms, e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience with robotic motion systems, open and closed loop control, troubleshooting these types of systems

$108,600 - $133,000 a year

What We Will Offer You:

ArsenalBio has a generous and comprehensive benefits package that includes but is not limited to medical, dental, and vision as well as mental health resources, virtual and telehealth options, coaching, infertility treatment, parental leave and health savings accounts. We also offer flexible work schedules and flexible time off, which includes two extra “Arsenal Days of Rest” every quarter for employees to recharge.

We have a robust mentorship program, and comprehensive development tools to help employees take control of their career paths and grow into their best selves. ArsenalBio believes in investing in the well-being of our employees - both at work and at home, as they are our greatest asset. They bring scientific talents in molecular biology, immunology, pharmacology, protein chemistry, computational biology, automation, genome engineering, software and other fields to make the future happen now.

ArsenalBio prioritizes the providing of a safe and healthy workplace that is consistent with COVID-19 public health guidance and legal requirements. In order to protect our employees and visitors, we require all visitors (candidates) and employees to present proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 when coming onsite.

We are committed to hiring the best talent from diverse backgrounds. A diverse workforce engenders richness of thought, creativity and discovery. We invite individuals who embrace intellectual achievement to bring their unique personal and professional journeys and together we will build transformative cell therapies for cancer patients.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

The estimated base salary offer for the preferred primary location of San Francisco Bay area ranges from $108,600 – $133,000.

Salary ranges for other locations may vary from this range. Base pay offered may vary depending on job related knowledge, experience, education, and location. In addition to these factors, we believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current employees as part of any final offer.

To all recruitment agencies: ArsenalBio does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, or ArsenalBio employees. ArsenalBio is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About the job
About the Job
The Business Process Engineer / Analyst works with the organization to find areas where performance or processes can be improved and helps them develop strategies to stay competitive in the business. The role will support Dennis Group's Project Execution division in discovering, mapping, and improving core function business processes surrounding our Project Management and Construction Management workflows. From the pre-construction & bidding stages of a project to the closeout stage, the Business Process Engineer / Analyst will conduct research and analysis to help drive potential new business initiatives.

Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:
Research and conduct site observations to identify the equipment, methods, and personnel needed for effective processes.
Examine emerging business best practices and technological developments that can help to automate and streamline processes to help businesses perform more efficiently.
Gather information through process mapping, flow-charting, and workshops. This information can then be used to develop better process engineering.
Meet with stakeholders within the division (Project Managers, Construction Managers, Field Operation Managers, Administrative Project Managers, etc.) to determine the business goals to achieve and work towards.
Create reports and presentations utilizing qualitative analysis regarding companies, markets, and industry trends.
Prepare financial reports in support of monthly/quarterly business review meetings with senior management.
Communicate with project controllers, project managers, cost center owners and accounting personnel to ensure that business operations are closely monitored and potential risks are mitigated.
Take responsibility for analyzing actual results against budget and/or forecast and communicating variances to senior management.
Analyze and review monthly financial results and ensure any identified errors are corrected timely.
Gather data, analyze, and make recommendations to meet project objectives, prepare client presentations.
Drive business / division decisions by providing quantitative and qualitative data analyses
Primary goal is to assess business requirements and make evidence-based recommendations to support process improvements.

About You
Bachelor's degree in Business or related degree (Statistics, Finance, Information systems)
8+ years of relevant experience, preferably within a general contractor construction company or design-build engineering & architectural firm.
Proven knowledge and experience with process flow definition, mapping and optimization of business processes
Experience within a design-build, project management/execution and construction management company/industry
Lean or Six Sigma basic certification
Certified Business Analysis Professional certification (CBAP)
Proven research skills and understanding of how other organizations work to provide best recommendations. This should include understanding from competitors, clients, vendors and key stakeholders.
Advance knowledge and experience with process flow diagram software and other Business Intelligence (BI) tools.
Advance knowledge in Excel (pivot tables, charts, formulas, etc.)
Business Process Training & Development content creation & delivery; presentation skills

About Us
We plan, design, engineer, and build food plants for major brands across the country and the world. For the past three decades, we’ve focused exclusively on the food and beverage industry, helping your favorite brands put your favorite foods in the grocery store. Simply put, food isn’t one thing we do, it’s all we do.
Dennis Group offers competitive compensation packages commensurate with experience. We provide comprehensive employee benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid time off including an open vacation policy, as well as bonus, profit-sharing, and retirement plans.
Dennis Group is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.

Through our 30 years of scroll compressor expertise, our air conditioning-related products help bring comfort and convenience to commercial, industrial, and residential spaces. The cold chain business helps ensure that food safely and efficiently travels from farm to fork. Approximately 1600 employees work in Sidney, who all support a multitude of business functions. With the blend of businesses and functions represented under this one roof, there are many opportunities for advancement within the Sidney location.







Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose:

We invest in our employees to ensure they have the marketplace knowledge, skills, and competencies to bring this Purpose to life while competing and leading in a global economy.

Our training programs focus on end-to-end development, from onboarding through senior leadership.

Our success is measured by the positive impact we make on people, our communities, and the world through our unwavering focus on environmental, social, and regulatory progress. Learn more about us!

Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer you the right options to meet your individual/family needs: medical insurance plans, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), tuition reimbursement and more. We also provide you flexible time-off plans, including paid parental leave, vacation, and holiday leave.



At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their experiences and perspectives – and that reflects the world around us. We believe a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .



Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.



Emerson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .



Emerson is a leading global technology, software and engineering company providing innovative solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets.

Our Automation Solutions business helps process, hybrid and discrete manufacturers maximize production, protect personnel and the environment while optimizing their energy and operating costs.

Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.

We help customers in the world’s most essential industries solve the biggest challenges of modern life.

Every day, our global workforce fulfills our unified Purpose and lives out the Values we hold close as an organization:

Our Causes – – shape, define and fuel Emerson’s culture while inspiring our innovative spirit and driving our focus.

Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or recently received your master’s degree, you’ll find opportunities with us. Join our team and start your journey today!

column1: Sr. Digital and Mixed Signal Design Engineer
column8:
About the job
SUMMARY OF QUALIFICATIONS of a Sr. Digital and Mixed Signal Designer (Need at least 5+ years of industry experience)

Fortemedia, Inc
2150 Gold Street, Suite 250, San Jose, CA 95002
Primary Skills and Responsibility
Solid design experience in DSP blocks such as SINC, FIR filters, PDM to PCM and PCM to PDM conversion. Will have to work on RTL design of voice processing SoC including module level logic design and system integration, micro architecture specification, RTL IP management and its integration to Fortemedia design.
Experience in RTL level ASIC design, including use of a source control system and experience in debugging RTL code using simulation tools. Resolve synthesis and timing analysis issues
Define/architect the hardware/firmware trade-offs, power architecture, memory topology, SoC bus fabric/bus subsystems, debug/emulation infrastructure, test infrastructure and peripherals required
Perform and present Power, Performance, Area, Risk and schedule analysis for SoC features/functions as necessary
Knowledge of Matlab system/architecture modeling would be a plus.
Good knowledge on Analog/Mixed-Signal IC Design using state-of-the-art CMOS process down to 22nm using Cadence virtuoso tools.
FPGA emulation, prototype build up and silicon validation
Learn and expand Fortemedia mission projects and all their derivatives including ICs for digital and analog microphones, voice processing algorithms, software and hardware; provide technical support to FAE/sales team and customers
Experience on design and verification of sigma delta analog to digital (ADC) and digital to analog (DAC) circuits converter will be a plus
Solid knowledge on DFT implementation
Qualification
5-7+ years of experience in SoC design development for architecture and micro-architecture from specs. Major in EEE or related field with a master plus at least 5 years of experience in ASIC or SOC design. Candidate with PhD and 3+ years of industry experience will be acceptable.
Must have gone through at least 3 ASIC tape out from Spec to Silicon. Hands on experience in ASIC microarchitecture and RTL design.
Strong background on low power and low latency mixed signal design.
Should possess strong communication and leadership skills to ensure effective communication with team members.
Familiarity with hardware implementation of digital signal processing. Good technical knowledge on DSP, voice processing. Voice recognition experience is a plus.
Experience in system level development for both embedded software and hardware on SoC is desirable.
Familiarity with ASIC flow from RTL to Tape out and post silicon debug and test/product engineering.
Proficiency in RTL design, DFT, synthesize, timing closure, SoC integration and verification.
Experience in design and verification of MEMS based audio processing will be a plus
Knowledge of ultra-low power architecture/system design for battery powered electronic devices.
Estimated range: $150,000 to $200,000 a year

About the job
Why engineering at Stryker?

At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development.

Need another reason to apply? Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team: https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team

We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com

Our benefits include bonuses; commissions; healthcare; insurance benefits; retirement programs; stock based plans; family and parenting leaves; tuition reimbursement; wellness programs; onsite fitness centers and cafeterias; discount purchase programs; and service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities.

At Stryker's Emergency Care division, we work on life-saving and emergency medicine technology, and data solutions, serving EMS, hospital, military, and emerging models of healthcare. We make the legendary Power-PRO® brand of powered ambulance cot and LIFEPAK® brand of patient monitors and defibrillators – considered one of the most powerful tools in emergency medicine. Join our Team and see how your skills can flourish in an environment rich with advanced technology, innovative medical science, and high-performance culture.

Who We Want

Problem solvers. Leaders who take a logical, systematic and proactive approach to diagnosis and resolution.
Dedicated achievers. Relentless about quality, people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations.
Detail-oriented thinkers. Organized engineers whose precise technical documentation ensures accuracy.
Game changers. Go-getters who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.

What You Will Do

Together with our customers, you will work to improve healthcare by developing and maintaining emergency medical equipment at Stryker.

At Stryker, we change healthcare for the better by creating equipment that genuinely saves lives. In your role as a Staff Electrical Engineer, you’ll be responsible for working on product development teams to execute and coordinate R&D activities over the entire product development cycle. You’ll be involved from the very beginning – supporting with the concept and prototyping – and you’ll be there throughout the execution, implementation, and fielded product support phases. We’ll look to you to collaborate with multiple cross-functional teams to ensure proper creation, evaluation, and test of our products, as you’re a torchbearer when it comes to establishing the proper design and quality in our products. From prototype design development and experimentation to executing formal engineering tests and creating supporting documentation to release products, you are the crucial conduit to deliver our equipment to market while ensuring it maintains high quality during use. Your precision with design, development, debugging, and testing sets the stage for lives to be saved.

Technical Responsibilities

You will design and develop electrical components and sub-systems for medical devices
You will apply advanced circuit and electrical system test methods
You will conduct or design prototyping and bench testing
You will conduct problem solving, identify potential solutions, and evaluate them against component and sub-system requirements
You will conduct research and studies to support product design
You will translate design inputs to engineering specifications and produce component and sub-system level designs

Med Device Compliance

You will follow fundamental industry standards, design requirements and test strategies which apply to regulatory requirements
You will independently create or refine engineering documentation
You will follow R&D procedures like design controls and risk management

What You Need

Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering (BSEE) or related discipline required
4+ years of related work experience required

What We Would Love That You Have (Preferred Qualifications)

Working knowledge of electrical design process, electrical components, and manufacturing methods
Ability to interpret, analyze, and test electrical designs
Proficiency with design and concept generation CAD, CAE, or simulation tools
Ability to apply analysis tools and statistical methods
Knowledge of system components and associated requirements
Understanding of the system lifecycle and effects of design choices on the system

About Stryker

Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better.

The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually.

More information is available at stryker.com

R494957

About the job
The job opening is for a Electrical Engineer for Sperry’s Electrical / Electronics Research and Development Technology group. The work involves developing high reliability systems that operate in harsh environments; high temperature and high pressure in “down hole” Measurement / Logging While Drilling systems.

You will be responsible for the following:
Design of DC/DC and AC/DC converters for high efficiency in space constrained environments with knowledge of voltage and current control methods and advanced understanding of modern power supply topologies

About the job
ABSL Space Products (a division of EnerSys Advanced Systems) is the world-leading manufacturer of Lithium-ion batteries for space applications. The ABSL team in Longmont, CO designs Lithium-Ion battery systems to meet the strenuous requirements of space travel. Our batteries power the future of space exploration, scientific advancement, and more in some of the finest spacecraft and launch vehicles in the industry. The ABSL team is tight-knit and employees value the small company feel while also being a part of EnerSys, the global leader in stored energy solutions. The ABSL team is growing and looking for individuals that share a common interest in the space and power industry and want to work in this exciting environment.

Learn More About Our Company

What We’re Offering

3+ weeks of paid time off plus 10 paid holidays
Medical/dental/vision for employee and dependents at a discounted rate
Life insurance, short term disability, educational reimbursement, flex spending and employee stock purchase plan
401K (we match 100% at 6% contribution level)
9/80 schedule (9hr days M-F and then every other Friday off – every other weekend is a 3-day weekend)
Be part of a smart, high performing and passionate team.
An office conveniently located in Longmont, right off diagonal highway.
Culture: We are a group of smart, talented people who are passionate about what we do…and we have fun while doing it! Here in our Longmont location, we have all different backgrounds, which promotes creativity and fosters an inclusive environment. We pride ourselves in focusing on our customers’ needs and by involving all associates in the day-to-day operations of our business.

Compensation Range: 105,900 - 132,400 DOE

Compensation may vary based on applicant's work experience, education level, skill set, and/or location.

Job Purpose

This is an excellent opportunity for an established engineer with 8+ years of experience in electrical design and development to join a growing international space component supplier.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Lead the design and development of analog, digital, and power electronics for space battery systems as well as fulfillment of complex requirements documents to demonstrate product compliance to specifications.
Coordinate and validate project testing and analyses plans/reports against customer requirements.
Lead electrical schematic capture, circuit board layout, and generation of assembly documentation per internal and industry standards.
Perform and review analyses in technical reports including Part Stress/Derating, Worst Case Circuit, Reliability, Radiation, and Failure Modes and Effects (FMEA).
Communicate directly with technical personnel in customer organizations to provide product data, field technical questions, and support technical reviews.
Assist in the development of technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.
Participate in investigations, resolutions, and product improvement meetings.

Qualifications

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, or similar with 8+ years of related experience.
Experience reviewing, interpreting, and responding to customer and industry requirements.
Experience with electrical laboratory equipment.
Above average Microsoft Word, Excel, and Visio skills.
Experience with schematic capture programs, Cadence OrCAD preferred.
Experience with lithium ion batteries preferred.

EnerSys provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. About the job
Responsibilities

Peraton is seeking a Senior Systems Engineer / Electrical Engineer to provide technical leadership and management support for a program that delivers a broad range of engineering and scientific services to a national level customer.

Our unique team of technical and business disciplines provide operational support for Systems Engineering/Integration, Mission Planning, and Business Operations to multiple functional mission areas. The team is responsible for technical design, operations, and mission planning and business operations for the full life-cycle of customer specific operations (from concept through development and installation/O&M).

Responsibilities:

The candidate will be responsible for supporting our client's mission goals and strategic objectives. In this position, the candidate acts as an advocate for the government customer as an authority on the architecture designed, CONOPS, and mission requirements.

The Senior Electrical Engineer is responsible for but not limited to:

Maintaining a strong understanding of electrical engineering theory, design, and industry best practices and should be comfortable working on behalf of the government customer with limited oversight.
Ability to independently lead multiple efforts from initial concept through completion and also represent the Government in a number of various forums.
Providing technical guidance for the management of design, development, and production of disparate efforts and initiatives and will help guide the integration, test, and deployment of developed systems.
Overseeing the engineering activities of component developers, verify the capabilities and interfaces of developed products, support system test and deployment activities for fielded system(s).
Demonstrated ability to analyze and assess a problem, decompose complex issues, and develop solutions and strategies to operational scenarios.
Communication is a key to success in this position.
Other responsibilities include:

Ability to manage, plan, and provide technical oversight for technical projects.
Clear and effective communication of technical design details and benefits/trade-offs to key decision makers who may include a mix of technical and non-technical audiences.
Identification of technical risks early in the development process (for each project) and work with developers to derive mitigation strategies.
Interacting with customers on technical matters, often requiring coordinated activity across organization lines.
Participation in design reviews and provide an independent technical assessment of solutions proposed by the contractor development team.
Communication of progress, status, briefings, and tasking to customers and team.
Ensuring accurate translation of high-level mission CONOPS into system level requirements; develop lower-level detailed implementation requirements.
Ensuring system requirements are traceable to client requirements and government standards through formal verification methods.
Participating in the design and definition of system functionality and component interface.
Working with contractor development teams on requirements definition, development, standards.
Overseeing component development and verification.
Developing test plans and procedures to validate system requirements.
Assisting with the creation of documentation and user manuals for deployment.
Providing support to client programmatic and technical forums.
Attending relevant component readiness reviews and testing milestones and provide recommendations to customer management.
Assisting in the review and assessment of contractor deliverables, and provide an independent assessment.
**Ability to travel up to 15-25%. Most travel to occur CONUS, but some OCONUS travel may be required.**

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Top Secret/SCI with polygraph.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent; BS/BA and 12 years of relevant experience, or MS/MA and 10 years of relevant experience, PhD and seven (7) years of relevant experience
Demonstrated experience in the design, development, testing, and production of electronic systems and/or sensors to deployed to the field
Experience with Microsoft Office products, such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Project
Demonstrated strong interpersonal and communication skills with demonstrated ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team in pursuit organizational goals
Demonstrated expertise in writing, and ability to brief complex technical information to non-experts
Experience with end-to-end integration and test methods including identification and mitigation of programmatic and technical risk
Experience with testing and evaluation
Desired Qualifications:

BS/BA and 15 years of relevant experience, or MS/MA and 13 years of relevant experience, or PhD and 9 years of relevant experience
Demonstrated experience in the design, analysis, and testing of low power circuits
Demonstrated experience with RF system design, propagation modeling, and analysis
Experience prototyping initial designs and performing in situ debug testing/analysis of designs
Working knowledge of electronic modeling, simulation and design tools (e.g., Spice, HFSS, Cadence, Synopsys, Allegro, etc) is a plus
Working knowledge of systems engineering principles and processes
Experience in complex, multi-segmented system development, integration, and test of projects including specialized, relevant technical experience in the general areas of systems integration, system development and verification, hardware and software development
Experience with various development approaches (e.g., agile, waterfall, etc.)
Demonstrated experience with Quick Reaction Capability (QRC) development efforts
Applied knowledge of the systems development life cycle, including requirements analysis, documentation development, control gates, and system verification
Ability to work within and across multi-discipline teams to ensure interfaces are thoroughly defined, properly designed, and correctly implemented
Familiarity with IC organizations and experience working across multiple organizations within the IC
Prior experience as a SETA

Peraton Overview

Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can't be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.

Target Salary Range

$146,000 - $234,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

EEO Tagline (Text Only)

An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

About the job
We’re looking for people who put their innovation to work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.

This is a remote opportunity for candidates based in US**

What You Will Experience In This Position

Understand the challenges faced by prospects, customers, and the industry at large
Understand and document the customer requirements aligning
Align requirements with available software and hardware solutions
Create new solution definitions to meet customer challenges using electrical design and manufacturing applications
Create and deliver presales technical presentations (online and in-person) to demonstrate customer benefit.
Deliver webinars, seminars, and other forms of public speaking to educate and create awareness in the market.
Suggest enhancements to customer design and manufacturing processes in the electrical control systems market.
Create and support training and professional service offerings
Assist sales teams in understanding and navigating technical discussions with customers.

You Have

Bachelors Degree in Electrical, Computer Science, Mechanical or Equivalent
Previous experience in or with Technical sales / Pre-sales applications engineering roles, Post-sales implementation, Solution architecting
Ideally 5+ years working with Electrical design tools in the Enclosure and automation design space
3+ years of experience deploying engineering CAD solutions
3+ years providing professional training and implementation services
Driven and motivated to quickly gain sound knowledge and understanding of the policies and procedures of nVent
Interact well with multiple stakeholders and able to work in a global environment.
Possess excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Additional languages are a plus.
Strong learning agility and great analytical skills.
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Acesss)
Possess a high energy level and strong work ethic with a commitment to continuous improvement in a dynamic and changing environment that strives to exceed expectations.
Desire to work collectively and actively chip in to a positive team culture
Ability to travel up to 50% annually; some international

Preferred

Experience working with standard relational databases like MS SQL, Oracle, etc.
Demonstrated experience in programming or project management is an asset
Proficiency with E3.series design suite

We Have
A dynamic global reach with diverse operations around the world that will stretch your abilities, provide plentiful career opportunities, and allow you to make an impact every day
At nVent, we connect and protect a more sustainable and electrified world with inventive electrical solutions. We’re a nearly $3 billion high-performance electrical company with a dedicated team of 10,000+ people at more than 130 sites around the world. Our solutions deliver value to industrial, commercial, residential, energy and infrastructure customers, providing mission critical solutions that improve performance, lower costs and reduce downtime.
We design, manufacture, market, install and service high-performance products and solutions that connect and protect mission critical equipment, buildings and essential processes. Our robust portfolio of leading electrical product brands dates back more than 100 years and includes nVent CADDY, ERICO, HOFFMAN, RAYCHEM, SCHROFF and TRACER.

Innovative & adaptable
Dedicated to absolute integrity
Focused on the customer first
Respectful and team oriented
Optimistic and energizing
Accountable for performance
Benefits to support the lives of our employees

About the job
Position Summary
Provide advanced and/or cross-technology engineering through all phases of the Technology/Project Life Cycle. Accountable for the overall systems infrastructure including engineering, implementation and integration, and technical services and support. Design, implement/install, maintain and administer infrastructure systems including hardware, software and various configurations. Monitor overall performance to proactively identify potential issues and tune appropriately. Perform root cause analysis on failed components and implement corrective measures. Mentor and coach others to establish and improve processes and procedures. Demonstrate the company's core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety.

About the job
Dynamic Design Solutions (DDS), an Addtronics company, solves the manufacturing industry's most challenging problems with unique and creative solutions. Trusted by some of the largest and most influential manufacturing companies in the world, the DDS team of dedicated professionals delivers unique, high-quality, custom designed automation equipment. DDS also offers design and fabrication of all types of industrial tooling, especially highly engineered, complex parts, and assemblies. Located in Charlotte, NC, DDS has been a trusted partner within the manufacturing industry for over 25 years.

About the job
Role:
TTS is seeking a competent Controls (automation) Engineer who will leverage their expertise in PLC programming, control panel design, instrumentation, AC and DC systems, troubleshooting, and testing to support our conversion, modification, upgrade, and service projects throughout the world.
The Controls Project Engineer shall work as part of the TTS Engineering team with emphasis on:
· Software development, testing, startup, and commissioning for PLC-based Control Systems
· Detailed design of PLC-based Control Systems
· Detailed electrical design of AC and DC systems
· Creation, review, and approval of required project deliverables
· Oversight and direction of electrical technicians for control panel fabrication
· Factory and On-site testing and validation of system performance
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Review and ensure the project design fulfills all Customer requirements as established in the Customer’s technical specifications, request for quotation/proposal, and purchase order.
· Drawing creation, review, and approval for electrical assembly/layout drawings, wiring diagrams, system block diagrams, system wiring schematics, system topology/architecture diagrams, and communications/network diagrams.
· Software development from one of or a combination of the following:
o Logic Diagrams
o Control Narrative/Specification
o OEM Documentation and Drawings
o Cause & Effect Diagrams
o Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs)
· Troubleshoot existing PLC programs using historical data, real-time data, and customer feedback
· Site services to include, control system installation supervision, testing, startup, and Customer training
· Work to TTS Engineering and Project Execution guidelines, standards, and processes
· Effective communication and collaboration with multiple levels within the organization
Experience:
· Minimum 3-5 years Electrical, Controls, and/or Project Engineering experience
· 3 years in an automation environment with direct involvement in software development, configuration, testing, and implementation (required)
Desired Skills & Experience:
· Proficiency with Allen Bradley/Rockwell Automation, Siemens, or GE/Emerson PLC platforms
· Proficiency with RSView Studio, FactoryTalk View, Cimplicity, Wonderware, or Archestra Human Machine Interface (HMI) platforms
· Familiarity with any of GE, Westinghouse, Siemens, Pratt & Whitney, Rolls Royce, Solar, ABB, Mitsubishi gas turbines for power generation and/or oil & gas applications
· Ability to understand Electrical Schematics, Cable Schedules, Control Logic Diagrams, Piping and Instrument Diagrams, and Cause & Effect Diagrams
· Electrical design including specification and selection of Electrical and Controls components, Low Voltage Power distribution (480 VAC/120 VAC), and process control instrumentation
· Creation of connection drawings using AutoCAD 2-D Software
· Ability to analyze electrical/mechanical systems and manufacturer’s data sheets
· Proficiency with appropriate tools to conduct electrical testing, including digital multi-meters, process calibrators, and function generators
· Proficiency with Microsoft Office (including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Project)
· Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering (preferred), or related field
Miscellaneous:
· Travel:
o Travel to customer sites is required
o Travel is project based (domestic and international) and can vary based on project timelines
o Estimated travel is 25%

About the job

Summary

Do you love creating elegant solutions to highly complex challenges? Do you intrinsically see the importance in every detail? As part of our Silicon Technologies group, you’ll help design and manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient processor, system-on-chip (SoC). You’ll ensure Apple products and services can seamlessly and efficiently handle the tasks that make them beloved by millions. Joining this group means you’ll be responsible for crafting and building the technology that fuels Apple’s devices. Together, you and your team will enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices. The Hardware PCB Design Engineer includes a broad scope of work as listed below.


Key Qualifications

We are looking for expertise using Cadence Allegro for multi-layer board layout.

Detailed knowledge of PCB manufacturing processes and design rules.

Symbol and footprint generation based on datasheet.

We are looking for an understanding of circuit theory.

We are looking for an understanding of power delivery networks (PDN).

Experience with PCB Layout CAD tools.

The ability to plan large PCB designs and estimate efforts.

Coordination and collaboration with team members on complex, sophisticated projects.

Spreadsheet and presentation skills are a plus.


Description

In this role, you will design, floorplan, and complete PCB designs. This includes early assessment of effort, initial placements, routing, and final rule verification. Designs are released for manufacturing and require the support of DFM and component inquiries. You will be able to navigate CAD tasks using scripts, automation, and design management. You will also be responsible for collaborating with fab vendors to access manufacturing feasibility for challenging board stack ups. You will have a close working relationship with people from unique backgrounds and skills. An emphasis is on designing power delivery input and output networks around power converters in addition to high speed signaling.


Education & Experience

BS and a minimum of 3 years of relevant industry experience.


Pay & Benefits

At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $130,000 and $242,000, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

About the job
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Nexcelom Bioscience is a developer and marketer of image cytometry products for cell analysis in life science and biomedical research. Products range from single and high-throughput cell viability counters and image cytometers (Cellometer and Cellaca) to high-throughput microwell image cytometry workstations (Celigo), used in thousands of research laboratories in academic institutes, and pharmaceutical and biotech companies. The company contributes to the life science industry through innovation and expertise in the science of cell counting. The product family includes instruments, consumables and reagents. Nexcelom customers engage in a wide variety of research, including cancer research, immunology, stem cell research, neuroscience, etc. Nexcelom offers different Cellometer models to count and analyze cell lines and primary cells, through bright field and fluorescence imaging modes. In addition, Celigo is a powerful high image quality, high throughput image cytometry system for adherent and suspension cells in microwell plates. Nexcelom Bioscience is a fast-growing company in a huge market. With its headquarters and manufacturing facilities in the Boston area, the company currently has over 100 global employees, who are fast-paced, customer-centric, helpful to colleagues and customers, and passionate to make an impact in life science.

About the job
We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

Are you looking to become an operations expert for the New Glenn Upper Stage, and follow the life of the program to integrated test and flight support? We are a small team of passionate experts, each with full ownership over the operations of our respective domains. Our team is looking to hire someone who can take ownership of defining and enforcing the operation of their subsystem. Come join us in this exciting and fast paced role to make a direct impact on the history of human space exploration!

The ideal candidate is highly diligent, forward-thinking, can handle a diverse range of data, and has a deep passion for Blue Origin's mission. We are seeking someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to contribute to safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is essential!

Responsibilities

Engage in the entire design cycle of New Glenn Stage 2 tank development, including conceptual design, detailed design and analysis, manufacturing, qualification testing, integration, and mission support
Apply design and manufacturing knowledge/experience to lead coordination of complex projects across teams and domains internally and externally, driving execution
Collaborate with internal partners (welding engineering, manufacturing engineering, M&P engineering, production, design/analysis engineering) to define requirements, dependencies, and schedule needs for delivering tank components, assembly, and testing and integration
Develop recovery strategies for non-conformances or other identified escapes
Coordinate configuration changes with upstream and downstream partners
Identify risks, develop mitigation plans, and ensure team accountability for following through with planned actions
Review and track schedule and budget; manage and report progress to program leadership
Drive process improvements to continuously enhance program operation with safety and quality in mind

Qualifications

Minimum of a B.S. degree in Engineering or related technical field
Experience with a combination of analysis, design, test, and operations for launch systems, preferably focusing on stage 2 tanks
Hands-on experience in developing, authoring, and implementing integrated tests or operating launch vehicles
In-depth working subsystem domain knowledge
Ability to work with partially defined requirements and changing criteria
Passion for Blue Origin's mission: Millions of people living and working in space!
Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum

If you don't meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. Studies have shown that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single desired qualification. At Blue Origin, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, please apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Export Control Regulations

Applicants for employment at Blue Origin must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e. current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Blue Origin is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to attracting, retaining, and developing a highly qualified, diverse, and dedicated work force. Blue Origin hires and promotes people on the basis of their qualifications, performance, and abilities. We support the establishment and maintenance of a workplace that fosters trust, equality, and teamwork, in which all employees recognize and appreciate the diversity of individual team members. We provide all qualified applicants for employment and employees with equal opportunities for hire, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment, regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin/ethnicity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local law. Blue Origin will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state, and local laws. For more information on “EEO Is the Law,” please see here and here.

Blue Origin will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Washington Fair Chance Act, Los Angeles Fair Chance in Hiring Ordinance, and other applicable laws.

Affirmative Action and Disability Accommodation

Applicants wishing to receive information on Blue Origin’s Affirmative Action Plans, or applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the application and/or interview process, please contact us at EEOCompliance@blueorigin.com.

Paid Time Off: Provides up to 4 weeks per year, in addition to 14 holidays

Discretionary bonus programs

About the job
Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are committed to a diverse and equitable workforce with an inclusive culture that values and celebrates the diversity of our people, talents, ideas, experiences, and perspectives. This is important for continued success of the Laboratory’s mission.

Pay Range

$148,650 - $200,328 Annually for the SES.3 level

$178,410 - $240,384 Annually for the SES.4 level

Please note that the pay range information is a general guideline only. Many factors are taken into consideration when setting starting pay including education, experience, the external labor market, and internal equity.

Job Description

We have openings for exceptional electrical engineers to work on projects in applied electromagnetics, specifically in the area of pulsed power science and technology. You will oversee and direct the development of one-of-a-kind systems for multiple experimental programs in support of LLNL’s stockpile stewardship mission. You will be a key contributor in the design, instrumentation, and execution of unique experiments employing high power pulsed electrical energy and/or energetic materials (high explosives) to study matter in extreme states. You will have the opportunity to bring your creativity and innovation to bear on some of the most challenging technical problems our nation faces and guide the development of novel engineering practices and approaches to continually improve the performance and reliability of R&D systems. These positions are in the National Security Engineering Division (NSED) within the Engineering Directorate and may require travel as part of a program assignment.

These positions will be filled at either level based on knowledge and related experience as assessed by the hiring team. Additional job responsibilities (outlined below) will be assigned if hired at a higher level.

You will
Oversee and direct activities for the design, laboratory testing, and analysis of pulsed power and electromagnetic devices and components in support of state-of-the-art pulsed power experimental platform research and development.
Propose ideas experimental campaigns in support of programmatic goals and objectives: oversee and direct activities of small team in the execution of experiments and experimental campaigns.
Provide independent assessments, and analysis, of complex pulsed power and electromagnetic system performance and risk.
Serve as the primary technical contact on a multi-disciplinary team to direct efforts in the fulfillment of program objectives.
Adhere to the highest standards of personnel safety and facility oversight while leading the execution of high-value, high-consequence demonstrations and experiments.
Present and disseminate research results at scientific conferences and in peer-reviewed publications, in open and classified environments, internal and external to LLNL.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Additional Job Responsibilities, At The SES.4 Level
Direct technical tasks and influence technical direction in the execution of highly complex experimental campaigns requiring teams of moderate-to-large size.
Serve as a subject matter expert in applied electromagnetics and/or pulsed power system design and analysis for the laboratory, at-large.
Work with senior and program management to establish and revise strategic roadmaps for programmatic efforts and technology thrust areas.
Routinely interact with senior LLNL management, program sponsors, other national laboratory staff and/or external entities to enable the execution of experimental campaigns.
Qualifications
Ability to secure and maintain a US DOE Q level security clearance which requires U.S. citizenship.
Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or a related field, or the equivalent combination of education and relevant previous experience.
Significant experience in applied electromagnetics and/or pulsed power systems and technology.
Significant experience with diagnostics used in electromagnetic and/or pulsed power systems.
Experience in overseeing and directing small teams to conduct experiments.
Experience working within large, multi-disciplinary teams.
Ability to travel.
Advanced written and verbal skills necessary to author and communicate technical reports, publications and presentations, to internal and external organizations.
Additional Job Responsibilities, At The SES.4 Level
Expertise in innovation and creativity in solving highly complex problems with ill-defined requirements and constraints.
Expertise in overseeing and directing moderate-to-large sized teams to conduct experiments.
Experience in direct interaction with senior leadership, sponsors or customers during the course of programmatic work.
Qualifications We Desire
PhD in Electrical Engineering or related field or the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.
Experience in conducting experiments with high explosive pulsed power systems.
Experience with grounding and shielding techniques and electromagnetic comparability practices.
Experience with advanced scientific modeling and simulation tools.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Position Information

This is a Career Indefinite position, open to Lab employees and external candidates.

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?
Flexible Benefits Package
401(k)
Relocation Assistance
Education Reimbursement Program
Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Accountability (IDEA) - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity
Our core beliefs - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/our-values
Employee engagement - visit https://www.llnl.gov/diversity/employee-engagement
Security Clearance

This position requires a Department of Energy (DOE) Q-level clearance. If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. Also, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. Q-level clearance requires U.S. citizenship.

Pre-Employment Drug Test

External applicant(s) selected for this position must pass a post-offer, pre-employment drug test. This includes testing for use of marijuana as Federal Law applies to us as a Federal Contractor.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

We invite you to review the Equal Employment Opportunity posters which include EEO is the Law and Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.

Reasonable Accommodation

Our goal is to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates applying and interviewing at the Laboratory. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please use our online form to submit a request.

About the job
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Nexcelom Bioscience is a developer and marketer of image cytometry products for cell analysis in life science and biomedical research. Products range from single and high-throughput cell viability counters and image cytometers (Cellometer and Cellaca) to high-throughput microwell image cytometry workstations (Celigo), used in thousands of research laboratories in academic institutes, and pharmaceutical and biotech companies. The company contributes to the life science industry through innovation and expertise in the science of cell counting. The product family includes instruments, consumables and reagents. Nexcelom customers engage in a wide variety of research, including cancer research, immunology, stem cell research, neuroscience, etc. Nexcelom offers different Cellometer models to count and analyze cell lines and primary cells, through bright field and fluorescence imaging modes. In addition, Celigo is a powerful high image quality, high throughput image cytometry system for adherent and suspension cells in microwell plates. Nexcelom Bioscience is a fast-growing company in a huge market. With its headquarters and manufacturing facilities in the Boston area, the company currently has over 100 global employees, who are fast-paced, customer-centric, helpful to colleagues and customers, and passionate to make an impact in life science.

JOB SUMMARY

Reporting to the Lead Mechanical Engineer, the electrical engineer will aide Nexcelom in providing researchers with cutting edge Image Cytometry tools. As a part of the product development team, this position is responsible for the electrical design, analyses, testing and documentation of new products and improvements, to meet marketing requirements and customer specifications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead electrical/electronic design and development of systems/sub-systems by verifying/understanding product requirements and defining functional requirements.
Collaborate and contribute towards design of new products from inception through production, understand issues and needs during different project phases and advocate suggestions across diverse teams within the organization.
Collaborate and develop/execute electronics design, at system and subsystem level, including architecture, detail design and analysis, component/system characterization, verification, and system integration
Create complete documentation packages (Schematics, Circuit design, Component placement, PCBA, commercial part specifications and Bills of Material).
Lead design and peer reviews and develop/debug to sustain existing and new product electrical design.
Provide clear and concise technical updates to broader team and management.
Ensure electrical design and documentation complies with safety and EMC/EMI standards, supports third party safety testing.
Work with hardware firmware and software for prototyping subsystems.
Design and write test protocols and reports in support of product verification/validation.
Address field issues by determining root cause and implementing corrective actions as necessary.
Work with suppliers to qualify components, troubleshoot issues and develop & deploy test tooling for manufacturing and vendors.
Perform Engineering Change Orders to document and communicate engineering changes throughout the organization, and coordinate implementations for smooth transitions of changes throughout manufacturing operations.
Interface with cross-functional engineering team, Marketing, Applications, Service and Operations throughout the Development Lifecycle.
Keeps abreast of state-of-the-art electronics and related technologies to ensure performance and quality of company products.
Follow new product phased-gate development process through design, manufacturing transition and commercial release.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering (BSEE) and two years industry experience in an electronics engineering field. OR
Master's degree in Electrical Engineering (MSEE).
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

BSEE/MSEE and three or more years of relevant industry experience.
Deep understanding of EE fundamentals, including analog and digital design experience.
Experience with PCB design – schematics, placement and routing, and circuit simulation.
Two or more years experience with demonstrated capability in Altium PCB designer.
Experience with prototyping, characterization/troubleshooting using signal generators, multimeters, logic analyzers, and oscilloscopes.
Proficiency with C++ / C# / VHDL/Labview/MATLab programing.
Experience with change order processes and document control systems.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Extensive use of Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Experience working with cross-disciplinary teams in an R&D environment,
Electronics design experience, preferably in the automation/life science applications with experience in linear motion control, bench top automation, precision positioning devices, computer-controlled hardware, imaging hardware, heating systems and fluid dispensing.
System level experience in troubleshooting production and field problems to determine root causes.
Demonstrate excellent understanding of electronics test methodologies, design for manufacturing, design for test, and design for reliability.
EMC board design and pre-compliance skills.
Safety regulatory UL/CSA/EN 61010 or equivalent knowledge.
Experience with embedded processors like Arm, PIC, and St Micro.
Experience with communication protocols - USB / Serial / Ethernet / Bluetooth / Wi-Fi.
Knowledge of ISO regulated environments.
Experience with Matlab/Python/Equivalent for data analysis.
Aptitude to learn new systems and retain technical information.
Commitment to customer excellence with demonstrated ethics and integrity.
Self-starter, detail oriented, with strong collaborative skills.

About the job
Company Description

We are Olsson, a team-based, purpose-driven engineering and design firm. Our solutions improve communities and our people make it possible.

Our most meaningful asset is our people, and we are dedicated to providing an environment where they can continue to learn, grow, and thrive. Our entrepreneurial spirit is what has allowed us — and will continue to allow us — to grow. The result? Inspired people, amazing designs, and projects with purpose.


Olsson provides engineering services for data centers, large commercial developments, hospitals, laboratories, school/university buildings, and military facilities.

As an Electrical Engineer with our Fort Worth Mechanical/Electrical team, you will be responsible for designing and coordinating electrical systems using Revit including the creation of Construction Documents and specifications. Responsibilities include coordinating with other disciplines, performing supporting calculations, meeting with clients to discuss conceptual and final designs, and travel to job sites for observation. Our electrical design services can include power distribution, lighting, and electrical modeling.







Olsson is a nationally recognized, employee-owned firm specializing in planning and design, engineering, field services, environmental, and technology. Founded in 1956 on the very mindset that drives us today, we’re here to improve communities by making them more sustainable, better connected, and more efficient. Simply put, we work to leave the world better than we found it.

As an Olsson employee, you’ll receive our traditional benefits package (health care, vision, dental, paid time off, etc.), plus you’ll:

About the job
Location: Irvine, United States of America

Thales people architect solutions that enable two-thirds of planes to take off and land safely. We create in-flight entertainment systems that engross 50 million fliers every year and we develop the avionics that control the world’s largest commercial aircrafts. Our simulators train the next generation of pilots for fighter jets, transporters and search and rescue helicopters. And, together, each and every member of our aerospace team makes a difference.

Thales is seeking a Sr. Electrical Design Engineer (Project Lead) in Irvine, CA. The primary responsibility of the Sr. Electrical Design Engineer (project lead) is to lead the HW design, development, test and qualification of IFEC LRU products to satisfy our customers and meet market demands (competitive in size, weight power, performance, are reliable, maintainable, replaceable, and repairable). He/she is responsible to perform a subset of all the hardware-engineering activities required to develop a HW embedded solution/product. Participates in co-engineering activity with the PCB, Mechanical, SW and System engineering teams.

In this capacity he/she will understand the customer’s needs and through life cycle concerns, whatever means are used (e.g. advanced studies, simulations, mock-ups, models, prototypes, etc.), formalizes mission / function description, architectural design and requirements, assembles the solution / product elements in a logical and controlled manner to evaluate the design, behavior, interactions and performance, and confirms that the requirements against which the solution / product has been designed are fulfilled, demonstrates that the solution / product satisfies the overall approved operational needs and that the product data package is ready for release to production and to operation and support functions.

Key Areas of Responsibility
Manage daily work and performance of the LRU HW Design Engineering Team
Ensures Hardware Engineering activity managed within constraints provided by the Project Engineer and Product Manager
Participate in the electrical design, development and test activities and qualification of state-of-the-art embedded digital and analog high speed, mixed signal communication circuits
For the team, he/she schedules, co-ordinates and monitors the implementation of tasks
Ensure that hardware-engineering aspects of projects are completed in a timely and cost-effective manner and will integrate efforts from various functional groups to accomplish goals
Provide a technical interface to subcontractors and customers
Conducts comprehensive electrical design reviews with engineering team and manufacturing partners to confirm that design parameters, cost and manufacturability requirements have been met
Write technical specifications, documents to make sure the product meets the customer, marketing, manufacturing and system design requirements
Work with Quality team to ensure quality systems and processes are in place to achieve hardware-engineering success
Participate in critical project reviews and reports to management outcome of the issue investigations
Participate in regular meetings with 3rd Parties / maintains action item lists
Lead as required sustaining engineering electrical investigations, process and documentation updates in collaboration with Thales industrial operations, product engineering and product support engineering teams and manufacturing partners
Responsible for risk management (anticipation, action and escalation)
HW development process enrichment with lessons learned and traceability to process changes
Management of 3rd party suppliers and contractors
Manage and control development schedule, product performance and compliance to the requirements
Monitor progress and conduct projects electrical milestone reviews and meetings
Manage development and sustaining projects.

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree in engineering or related discipline
5 years’ experience in Electrical embedded hardware design for high speed digital and analog communications systems
Experience in embedded design, IP/Networking, voltage regulator power supply, disk drive data storage.
Experience using schematic capture and layout viewer (ORCAD, Cadence, Mentor Graphics, PCAD, etc.)
Experience using digital test equipment such as Oscilloscopes, Logic Analyzer, Spectrum Analyzer, Emulators, Debuggers, etc.
Hands on knowledge of Linux OS and scripting language
Experience using Product Data Management tools: Team Center (or similar)
Experience in planning, implementing, and administering engineering programs and projects
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office use: Excel, Project, Outlook, Word, Visio; PowerPoint

Preferred Qualifications
7 years’ experience in Electrical embedded hardware design for high speed digital and analog communications systems
5 years’ experience in leading electrical/HW engineering project team
3 years’ experience with aerospace industries
Boeing, Airbus Line Fit qualification experience
Experience in avionics electrical design, development, DO-160 qualification and documentation

The anticipated TTC range for this role is $114,583 - $165,000.
