Excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to work both independently and with others
Preferred Qualifications
Design for Six Sigma Blackbelt certification
Ability to train and coach technical specialists and engineers
Ph.D. degree in Electrical or Equivalent Engineering from an ABET accredited university

About the job
Overview

Merrick and Company is a nationally known multi-office and multi-discipline firm consisting of a diverse, dedicated and talented staff which has achieved design excellence throughout its 60+ years of existence. With offices worldwide, Merrick and Company has been ranked as one of the top 100 design firms by Engineering News Record. Merrick provides personalized services to various clients throughout the world. We are seeking an experienced Laboratory / Facility Electrical Engineer for our Life Science business unit in our Greenwood Village office.

Candidates that have a desire for personal and professional growth, a well-defined understanding of design and construction document processes, and adaptability for short term and long-term projects in an environment that requires a blend of creativity and high technical skills. Successful candidates must be self-starting, motivated, innovative, articulate, self-disciplined, and confident in a demanding, exciting and fast-paced environment. This position requires a competent professional engineer who will be responsible for all phases of engineering production and BIM for a variety of work ranging from programming through construction administration. This includes interpreting, organizing, executing and coordinating the design and production effort for one or more large or complex projects.

Typical salary range for this position is $110,000.00 - $130,000.00. Base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Job Description
Design of electrical systems for facilities / laboratories for Government, University, and private clients.
Provide conceptual / detailed design and analysis for facility power distribution (600V), site power distribution (15kV), emergency power generation, grounding and lightning protection, lighting design, telecommunications (voice/data), fire alarm / mass notification, security, access control, and special systems.
Provide supporting documentation such as calculations, reports, and specifications.
This individual is expected to possess extensive knowledge on electrical regulatory codes.
Meet with clients to prepare and/or validate proposed scope of work.
Prepare fee proposals for engineering design work.
Work with other disciplines to ensure accuracy of the package, meet schedule, and budget commitments and meet expectations for attendance and punctuality.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely; both verbally and in writing
Ability to work effectively within a collaborative team environment
Ability to complete tasks with accuracy and with strong attention to detail
Ability to consistently meet deadlines, completing tasks as previously defined
Ability to travel as needed.
Ability to write and edit specifications
Work in a design team environment, including directing and mentoring the work of junior engineers and designers, and delegating work as required as well as provide management of the local team.
Capable of performing all of the above with minimal direction
An agreed upon hybrid schedule, working from both home and office, is available to employees in good standing.
Required Experience
Eight (8) years of experience in facility Electrical Engineering design
Professional Engineer (P.E.) license is required
Minimum four (4) years of experience using REVIT/AutoCAD or other design software-based drawing generation
Experience using electrical calculation tools is desired, including lighting and power software such as AGi32, Elum Tools, SKM Power Tools, ETAP, and EasyPower.
Proficient using Microsoft Office Excel & Word
Experience with technical codes such as NEC, NESC, NFPA, IEEE is required
Experience with USDA, ARS, CDC and other laboratory clients is highly desired
Client projects for this position require U.S. Citizenship.
Physical Requirements
The job requires the ability to sit for extended periods at a computer workstation.
Ability to perform site and field visits to review existing electrical systems and observe construction
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Apply online only. No e-mail, hard copy or third party resumes accepted.
Merrick & Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes health insurance, dental and vision coverage, employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) opportunity, 401(k) options, and paid time off (PTO). This position is also eligible for annual performance and spot bonuses.

An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/vets.
We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

About the job
Bausch + Lomb (NYSE/TSX: BLCO) is a leading global eye health company dedicated to protecting and enhancing the gift of sight for millions of people around the world—from the moment of birth through every phase of life. Our mission is simple, yet powerful: helping you see better, to live better.

Our comprehensive portfolio of over 400 products is fully integrated and built to serve our customers across the full spectrum of their eye health needs throughout their lives. Our iconic brand is built on the deep trust and loyalty of our customers established over our nearly 170-year history. We have a significant global research, development, manufacturing and commercial footprint of approximately 12,500 employees and a presence in approximately 100 countries , extending our reach to billions of potential customers across the globe. We have long been associated with many of the most significant advances in eye health, and we believe we are well positioned to continue leading the advancement of eye health in the future.

Position Summary

The Process Automation Engineer will be a key member of the Contact Lens Engineering organization and will lead and contribute to Automation Engineering projects for new product development, capacity expansion, continuity of supply, and maintenance of business functions.

Key Responsibilities

Lead process engineering efforts in support of the design, development, and scale-up of automated manufacturing systems for medical devices.
Responsible and accountable for the successful delivery of new manufacturing processes to production and for improvement of existing processes.
This engineer will lead product & process identification, development and optimization activities, writing protocols, data gathering, and analysis.
Evaluate new manufacturing technologies.
Responsible for development of processes that consistently yields parts conforming to specifications.
Ensure product quality and all tasks are in accordance with established SOPs, GMPs, Divisional Specifications, and EHS standards.
Drive process qualifications and validations with generation of appropriate documentation (impact analyses, validation protocols, test procedures, etc.).
Execute assigned validation testing, ensuring accuracy and completeness of documented results.

Qualifications And Experience

BS in Plastics, Chemical or Mechanical Engineering.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in Engineering, Process Development, and/or Quality Engineering.
Hands-on experience and technical expertise in a development environment a must. Experience with Design software (SolidWorks or AutoCad) and Mold flow simulation software.
ISO-9000, GMP, medical device manufacturing experience a plus.
Statistical analysis required within a development or manufacturing setting.
Experienced with high volume and/or high precision manufacturing a must.

Special Skills:
Computer Literacy with skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Access, plus MiniTab, JMP (or equivalent software)
Experience & expertise in Statistical Analysis including DOE and SPC. Communication, Organization, Report Writing, and Presentation skills a must.
Must be able to develop working relationships with various internal core competencies and lead team members.
Specialized Training: Six Sigma Black Belt and DFSS experience preferred.

About the job
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter Diagnostics? Take a closer look.

At first glance, you’ll see that for more than 80 years we’ve been dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and healthcare forward. Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. We’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. Look again and you’ll see we are invested in you, providing the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.

The Senior Process Engineer for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for leading Technical Operations projects, including process validations and post-launch design changes, and being the overall subject matter expert in Technical Operations for Microbiology consumable manufacturing process and operations.

This position is part of the Technical Operations Team, reporting to the Manager, Manufacturing Science, located in West Sacramento, CA and will be on-site 60% at a minimum. At Beckman Coulter, our vision is to relentlessly reimagine healthcare, one diagnosis at a time.

You will be a part of the Technical Operations Team and report to the Manager of Manufacturing Science. If you thrive in a fast-paced, multifunctional role, where you can bring your authentic self to achieve your best, and be part of a diverse team to build world-class diagnostic devices—read on.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Lead process validations and performance qualifications as the subject matter expert in microbiology consumable product manufacturing and technical operations processes. These include projects related to process improvements, cost savings, material qualifications, design changes, and routine updates to manufacturing processes.
Lead risk assessments for all Tech Ops projects and validations, primarily as it pertains to product performance.
Develop and implement process controls for new and old processes. Create, revise and train associates to standard work instructions and procedures.
Analyze complex scientific data using strong foundation in sampling statistics and using tools such as JMP, SAS, MS tools etc. Experience in DOE, basic programming, and proficiency in using computer and software tools for data analysis and general organization is a strong plus.
Collaborate effectively with a highly cross-functional team consisting of Manufacturing engineers, Line operators, product SMEs, QC/QA, supply chain, R&D, Regulatory, and Marketing; driving consensus to achieve project goals.
Use DBS tools such as visual project management, value stream mapping, standard work etc. to lead and manage multiple projects and priorities under dynamic timelines.
Work with contract manufacturers, suppliers, and customers of custom product to build robust manufacturing processes, and continuously improve on existing ones.

The essential requirements of the job include:

Bachelor’s degree in Microbiology, Biomedical Engineering, or related field, with 5+ years’ experience OR Master’s degree in field with 3+ years’ experience OR Doctoral degree in field with 0-2 years’ experience
Experience working in medical device manufacturing, pharmaceutical, or other regulated environment, with strong foundation in GMP/GDP, ISO 13485/MDSAP standards etc.
Hands-on experience with analytical assays such as HPLC, UV-VIS spectrophotometry etc., and exposure to other biological laboratory work.
Strong foundation in risk assessment, DOE, statistical sampling, and experience using various tools for data analysis such as JMP, SAS etc.
Excellent written and oral communication of technical data, and strong technical documentation experience in including but not limited to, validation protocols, risk assessments, data summary documents.
Self-starter, who can excel independently under minimal guidance, as well as thrive in a cross-functional team environment.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:

Hands-on laboratory experience in Microbiology, or other biological science, including exposure to biological sample preparation, cell culture etc.
Programming background or ability use and apply scripts for process improvement activities and reduce redundancies.

At Beckman Coulter Diagnostics we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, hybrid working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement in which you can work part of the time at the Company location identified above and part of the time remotely from your home. Additional information about this hybrid work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics can provide.

The salary range for this role is $90,200-$120,000. This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.

This job is also eligible for bonus/incentive pay.

We offer comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

About the job
Company

Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Job Area

Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Camera Engineering

General Summary

At Qualcomm, we invent breakthrough technologies that transform how the world connects, computes, and communicates. You interact with products and technologies made possible by Qualcomm every day. Qualcomm is a Technology Platform company known worldwide for its Snapdragon platform providing solutions in Wireless connectivity and Multimedia along with Compute, IoT, Automotive and AI - and this is where you come in as a Design Verification Engineer in the Snapdragon Sight team.

Camera Image processing has evolved to become an integral part of our daily life creating everlasting connected memories and assisting innovative devices through human and computer vision technologies.
Mobile: Capturing DSLR like quality images on your Mobile devices.
Automotive: Accelerating the digital transformation through Snapdragon digital chassis by powering the Snapdragon Ride for ASIL compliant ADAS solutions and Snapdragon Cockpit for in-car virtual assistance, contextual safety use cases and advanced graphics and multimedia.
AR/VR: Reimagining reality as we know it by enabling Immersive realism & 360 video while preserving battery life.
IoT: Connecting the cities of future with Qualcomm Technologies’ smart city solutions
Compute: Collaborate from virtually anywhere with extraordinary battery life.

Snapdragon® Sight powers all the diverse platform solutions provided by Qualcomm. Our team delivers the Camera ISP to majority of Android Eco-system Smartphones, AR/VR and IOT devices, provides Imaging & vision solutions for automotive platforms across ADAS & infotainment applications to world-wide Automotive manufacturers. It is an opportunity to be part of the team that creates highly advanced/specialized Camera ISPs and consistently ranks as the best Imaging solution.

Join us for a limitless opportunity to learn, grow and lead the world of Imaging and design verification. We have exciting opportunities to work in broad spectrum of verification functions in IP development from mid-level to experienced technical leadership roles at our San Diego/Irvine/Santa-Clara/Austin/Boulder locations.

Preferred Qualifications
System Verilog, C/C++/DPI programming skills and/or Perl/Python scripting skills
ASIC Logic / RTL Design experience & background with experience in FPGA and Emulation model development
Experience in Veloce/Palladium/Zebu/FPGA prototyping, silicon verification and system validation
2+ years of experience in camera hardware or systems design and optimization.
2+ years of experience in Image Signal Processing design, development, implementation, and verification.
5+ years of experience in programming (e.g., HDL, HVL, C, C++, Python), computer architecture, or embedded systems.
1+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Direct and above).
Exposure to Formal flows
Experience with Verification of Complex IP/SOC with exposure to End-to-end verification methodologies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to work in a collaborative environment with geographically distributed teams
Experience with simulation acceleration and emulation platforms is a plus

Principal Duties And Responsibilities
Deliver emulation models from RTL using industry standard emulation technology
Plans simulation acceleration,emulation and prototyping activities based on project milestone coordinate with different teams of design, software, firmware driver and usecase development
Develop high performance transactors and emulation testbench in System Verilog and C/C++/DPI
Drive emulation methodologies for HW verification and SW/FW development
Develop emulation tools, workflows and infrastructure in collaboration with RTL, validation and FW/SW teams
Develop system level usecases suitable for execution on emulators
Partner with vendors to debug issues and deploy new emulation capabilities

Level Of Responsibility
Working independently with little supervision.
Providing some supervision/guidance to others.
Making decisions that are moderate in impact; errors may have relatively minor financial impact or effect on projects, operations, or customer relationships; errors may require involvement beyond immediate work group to correct.
Using verbal and written communication skills to convey information that may be somewhat complex to others who may have limited knowledge of the subject in question; may require basic negotiation and influence, cooperation, tact, and diplomacy, etc.
Working within prescribed budget and resources.
Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions).
Completing most tasks with multiple steps which can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework.
Exercising substantial creativity to innovate new processes, procedures, or work products within guidelines or to achieve established objectives.
Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or incomplete; advanced data analysis/interpretation skills may be required.
Occasionally participating in strategic planning within own area affecting immediate operations.

About the job
Now seeking a highly motivated and technically proficient Electrical Hardware Engineer to upgrade the electrical hardware in an automotive product line. The ideal candidate will possess a strong and intuitive understanding of analog, mixed signal, and signal processing fundamentals, with expertise in analog hardware and mixed signal design. The candidate should be comfortable with practical aspects of the hardware development life cycle, including working with vendors and customers, testing, and using their hands.

About the job
A collective energy and ambition. A place where you can make a real difference.

We’re a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our consumers and the environment.

Our unique, informal culture champions courage, determination and collaboration. Knowing we have an open and supportive team means each of us has the freedom to take responsibility and ownership. We have a shared passion to work hard, innovate and push boundaries.

United by the belief that when we strive for growth, anything is possible. While we might not be the largest company in our industry, we believe we can have the biggest impact because: Together We Have the Power to Win.

Controls Engineer - Days
Monday - Friday TBD 7:00am - 5:00pm

What we’re about:
Innovation-We consistently generate new ideas, thinking outside the box while remaining strategically focused. We always think in terms of possibilities, not limitations.
Collaboration-We rely on open and honest communication to develop productive working relationships within and across our business units and functions. The mutual respect we have for our colleagues enables us to challenge each other, leading to an even more cohesive team.

Entrepreneurialism-We pride ourselves on fostering this spirit where risk-taking and action is encouraged. We are extremely competitive externally, but not internally.

What you’ll do:
This position will be responsible for providing plant engineering support in the design, assembly, integration, testing, troubleshooting, and commissioning of PLC-based control systems.

Essential Functions:
Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), company policies, safety policies and practices, quality standards, and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP).
Responsible at all times for ensuring that tasks are performed according to food safety, quality, and regulatory guidelines.
Promote a safety culture and awareness within area of responsibility and support all plant safety policies and procedures at all times.

Manage capital projects relating to automation and controls infrastructure, etc. and complete projects as assigned within defined scope, allocated costs, time commitments, and expected outcome.

Continually improve packaging and manufacturing equipment controls logic for better efficiency and reduced waste.

Lead cross-functional teams and address technical challenges to achieve critical objectives.
Understand business needs, risks, and organizational dynamics as well as their implications based on developing alternate plans and choices.

Identify and support cost reduction and efficiency improvement initiatives.
Develop and coordinate all technical training requirements for operations and maintenance personnel related to instrumentation and controls.
Promote active leadership in the implementation of plant-wide lean manufacturing efforts and TPS while integrating lean manufacturing disciplines in the engineering department.
Assist with quality software systems for customized reports and data analysis.
Support and recommend continuous improvement initiatives utilizing lean manufacturing tools and techniques.
Perform other related duties as required and assigned.

What you’ll need:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related field plus five (5) to seven (7) years engineering experience in a high volume, multiple SKU, fast-paced manufacturing environment or a combination of education and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to do the job.
High energy, self-starter with the ability to influence others.
Leadership and project management experience.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Skilled use of standard computer software including MS Office Suite.
Proficiency in CAD and solid modeling; AutoCAD & SolidWorks.
Capable of reading detailed blueprints, schematics, and P&IDs.
Familiarity with PLCs and machine control logic.
Knowledge of Lean and Six Sigma methods.
Ability to maintain punctuality and predictable attendance.
Ability to wear appropriate personal protective equipment and clean room attire; perform moderate physical activity which requires standing and/or walking for more than four (4) hours per day and up to twelve (12) hours per shift and lifting and carrying items weighing up to 50 pounds; and perform work onsite in a light industrial environment, including some exposure to non-toxic dust.

What we’ll offer:
Competitive salary including annual bonus & Stock Incentive Program
Comprehensive benefits package along with generous 401K
Career ownership & development
Diversity & Sustainability

About the job
General Atomics Electromagnetic Systems (GA-EMS) designs and manufactures first-of-a-kind electromagnetic and electric power generation systems. GA-EMS’ expanding portfolio of specialized products and integrated system solutions support critical fleet, space systems and satellites, missile defense, power and energy, and process and monitoring applications for defense, industrial, and commercial customers worldwide.

Whether a specific satellite for a specific mission or a constellation of interconnected spacecraft, the GA-EMS Space Systems team is re-defining how customers can access the possibilities of space. GA-EMS offers modular and scalable satellite platforms backed with a history of operational flight experience to support defense, civil, commercial, and academic mission requirements.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Satellite Electrical Engineer (EE), FPGA Design to join our Space Systems Division team located in Englewood, Colorado. We are looking for someone with drive, talent, and experience in FPGA development and programming who also thrives in a fast-paced, Research and Development (R&D) environment.

The successful candidate will report to the Manager of Space Systems Electrical Engineering and, alongside high-caliber staff, will be engaged in the engineering support and new development of small satellites, space-based payloads and a variety of other technologies in the expanding product portfolio of GA-EMS.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with GA-EMS Engineering staff and chief engineers in the concept development and design, integration, and test of processing solutions and high-speed data transfer for space-based systems using modern FPGA and MPSoC devices in custom-designed, high-requirement hardware designs.
With limited management consultation, serve as a recognized authority in FPGA and MPSoC development; conceptualize, articulate, direct, oversee, and implement innovative resolutions to highly technical and complex engineering problems; and determine technical objectives for the review, research, design, development, and/or solutions for designated engineering systems, projects, and programs.
Anticipate and report on future engineering challenges that will directly impact the present and future engineering objectives of the business.
Evaluate the integration of the engineering solutions within the overall engineering environment and ensure that appropriate development, documentation, testing, and engineering updates are completed.
Plan for future applications of solutions based on new developments in engineering technology.
Develops new and expands existing business opportunities.
Perform other duties as assigned or required.
We offer a 9x80 work schedule where we have every other Friday off

We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.

Base Salary: $128,130 - 229,358

Job Type: Full-Time Salary

The General Atomics(GA) group of companies is a world renowned leader in developing high - technology systems ranging from the nuclear fuel cycle to electromagnetic systems; remotely operated surveillance aircraft; airborne sensors; advanced electronic, wireless, and laser technologies; and biofuels. We offer an excellent opportunity to realize your full potential and fulfill your career aspirations.Join the GA Team where you can make a difference! Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer

About the job
The Electrified Propulsion Component Design and Development Engineer will be responsible for the development and validation of electric vehicle power electronics and electrified vehicle systems/devices for passenger cars and trucks. Develop power electronic devices DVP & R. Manage and ensure all required development/validation testing completed on time per program milestone. Communicate effectively with internal, external teams and the supplier. Ensure achievement of all functional objectives and assure compliance to program goals. Report development validation issues and status to management in various forums.

Additionally, this position will be responsible for the activities related to Power Electronics components, high voltage power inverters, motor generator units, designs for Electrified Vehicle applications, including the creation and maintenance of documentation outlining best practices supporting Stellantis internal continuous improvement initiatives and the development of product technology roadmaps.

Basic Qualification
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited, or ABET equivalent university
Minimum of 5 years of the automotive experience focusing on inverter design and testing
Demonstrable understanding of power electronics and devices
Understanding of electrical engineering protocols and standards Working technical knowledge in applications engineering and product design/development (specifically within an automotive context)
Working level knowledge of DVP&R and DFMEA
Good analytical and problem solving skills
Highly motivated and self-starter
Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment
Working level knowledge of Power Electronics analysis and simulations tools.
Ability to interface professionally with key customers, cross-functional teams and all levels of personnel/management.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Able to manage multiple responsibilities, one's own time while being mindful of deadlines
Must be task oriented, detail oriented, and accurate with work.
Preferred Qualifications
Master of Science in Electrical Engineering or 5 years of experience in high voltage/high power/electric vehicle environments Power electronics/electrical models and simulation experience.
5 -10 years of the automotive experience focusing on inverter design and testing.
Power electronics specifications expertise in Electric motor and powertrain controls experience Printed Circuit Board (PCB) design and fabrication experience.
Semi-conductor manufacturing knowledge.
Annual

About the job
Job Description

Our world demands low carbon energy solutions to achieve a Net Zero future!

We are looking for a Sr. Electrical Engineer/I&C Team Lead in one of our offices within the West Region (Irvine, CA, San Diego, CA, Roseville, CA, or Santa Rosa, CA). The leader will be responsible for leading a design team of electrical and I&C engineers and designers in the West EDO (Engineering Design Organization), and will work collaboratively with Project Managers, Business Development leaders, and the EDO Business Group Leader to deliver design projects and develop our technical resources and capabilities. In this role, you will collaborate with and provide mentorship to our team on a variety of electrical power generation, distribution, and utilization systems required for waterworks, industrial, and environmental projects.

And as we look to transition from traditional energy sources to adopt more renewable alternatives, you can play a key role in enabling and accelerating this change.

We’ll support you every step of the way as you join us in finding sustainable energy solutions to make a positive impact that will last for generations.

Responsibilities towards the Employees:

Mentor, develop and work closely with the team to achieve the performance criteria established for the business group
Encourage a collaborative environment to foster engagement, development and retention of the group under your responsibility
Actively collaborate with other team leaders in EDO to achieve excellent business results
Provide practical technical advice and mentorship to engineers and technical staff for the completion of projects
Support and meet GHD's Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) management system requirements
Act as an ambassador to attract and promote career opportunities
Be an agent of transformation to promote our values

Responsibilities towards GHD’s Market Groups:

Build effective relationships with the various market's key contacts. Support the development of new markets/market sectors in your specialty
Support proposal preparation and related activities, while being aligned with regional objectives
Demonstrate and promote project delivery skills by working with project directors and coordinators, as well as uni-disciplinary and multidisciplinary teams
Potentially act as a project manager or project director on relevant projects
Actively participate in client, professional and industry events to promote the GHD brand
Provide support for critical business development initiatives

Technical Responsibilities:

Demonstrate experience leading teams to complete preliminary and detailed designs
Perform roles as Project Subject area Lead, Senior Electrical Engineer, and Quality Reviewer on projects
Review design outputs, calculations, design briefs, and technical reports and detailed design in accordance with industry standards and GHD’s quality systems
Contribute towards the ongoing GHD design practice standardization across the region and nation

The Ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:
Design Experience in the following:
Motors and motor controls
Power distribution equipment
Low and medium voltage switchboards and switchgear
Electrical power generating equipment and systems
Development of elementary and schematic diagrams
Indoor/outdoor lighting systems
SCADA systems
P&IDs
Proven understanding of NFPA70 (NEC) and other electrical industry codes, standards, and recommended practices
Ability to manage priorities and develop team resources
Ability to adapt leadership style according to the composition of your team
Excellent written and spoken English communication.
Excellent people management and mentoring skills with ability to gather, influence and empower a group of professionals
Analytical mind with problem-solving skills
Good knowledge and proven experience in project delivery

Qualifications:

BS in Electrical Engineering
Registered Electrical Professional Engineer in California. Registration in additional States is a plus.
10-15 years of electrical engineering experience in the consultant industry for related market sectors such as Water/Wastewater, Energy and Resources, Environment, Buildings and Properties, and Transportation
Minimum 5 years of experience in managing teams to develop, mentor, and lead professional technical staff

Take on some of the world’s toughest challenges - with everyone at GHD backing you every step of the way.

We'll give you control over your career, empower you to find innovative solutions and help you create a lasting impact.

See where your commitment could take you with GHD!

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workplace. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

Salary Range: $119,500- $179,500

About Us

Why GHD?

Being the best we can be is in our culture.

We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.

More about Life and Work @GHD

Our commitment to you

Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.

Our Commitment to you

Who we are

We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation . GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

GHD Expertise and Service Lines

About the job
Job Description

Our world demands low carbon energy solutions to achieve a Net Zero future!

We are looking for a Sr. Electrical Engineer/I&C Team Lead in one of our offices within the West Region (Irvine, CA, San Diego, CA, Roseville, CA, or Santa Rosa, CA). The leader will be responsible for leading a design team of electrical and I&C engineers and designers in the West EDO (Engineering Design Organization), and will work collaboratively with Project Managers, Business Development leaders, and the EDO Business Group Leader to deliver design projects and develop our technical resources and capabilities. In this role, you will collaborate with and provide mentorship to our team on a variety of electrical power generation, distribution, and utilization systems required for waterworks, industrial, and environmental projects.

And as we look to transition from traditional energy sources to adopt more renewable alternatives, you can play a key role in enabling and accelerating this change.

We’ll support you every step of the way as you join us in finding sustainable energy solutions to make a positive impact that will last for generations.

Provide support for critical business development initiatives

Perform roles as Project Subject area Lead, Senior Electrical Engineer, and Quality Reviewer on projects
Review design outputs, calculations, design briefs, and technical reports and detailed design in accordance with industry standards and GHD’s quality systems

Electrical power generating equipment and systems

P&IDs

Analytical mind with problem-solving skills

About the job
Life changing therapies. Global impact. Bridge to thousands of biopharma companies and their patients.

We are PCI.

Our investment is in People who make an impact, drive progress and create a better tomorrow. Our strategy includes building teams across our global network to pioneer and shape the future of PCI.

Job Title: Automation Engineer I

Job Summary

The Automation Engineer I is responsible for maintaining regulatory aspects of manufacturing networks, control and monitoring systems, and data collection used throughout PCI manufacturing facilities under the guidance of management or more experienced team members. The Automation Engineer I shall possess the skill set necessary to ensure the success of GXP automation and engineering projects at the various site. The incumbent is responsible for maintaining a qualified computing infrastructure and implementation of Validated automation and control systems. Knowledge of cGxPs, 21CFR part 11, and other regulatory requirements and guidelines is required.

Job Duties

Support the operation of all GMP and non-GMP systems (BAS) and other auxiliary equipment that run on Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC’s).
Provide hands-on support and perform testing of process automation systems such I/A DCS, Rockwell PLCs, Automation hardware, software and modes of networking for iHistorians for operations.
Responsible to support manufacturing with data historian and analytics systems such as OSISoft PI, Historical database, Factory Talk PI Historian and local historical solutions
Provide automation improvements based on cGMP’s related to the operation, validation, and maintenance of manufacturing related computer systems.
Support project execution, operational startup and handover of automation and target equipment systems to end-users.
Participate in continual improvement programs as required.
Support commissioning and qualification activities as required.
Follow applicable standard operating procedures while working with qualified systems.
Assist departmental objectives by proactively identifying continuous improvement opportunities and developing strategic roadmaps.
Support operations on a rotating 24/7 on-call shift.

Skills

Strong analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Good written and oral skills
Demonstrated proficiency in the application of basic manufacturing, engineering, and/or scientific theories, principles, and techniques used in biopharma/medical device processes.
Ability to read/interpret engineering drawings and design documents. Ability to read and troubleshoot engineering drawings, P&IDs and electrical schematics.
Ability to interpret PFD’s, P&ID’s and detailed Automation design documents.
Knowledge of cGxPs, 21CFR part 11, and other international regulatory requirements and guidelines
Proficiency with standard software applications, including MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, MS Power Point
Knowledge of GMP and FDA regulatory requirements for drugs and/or medical devices.

Experience

A minimum of 2 years’ experience programming and or troubleshooting PLC’s (Allen Bradley Rockwell), preferable in a qualified environment.
Experience with electrical standards and local requirements and general electrical safety best practices.
Experience with automation hardware (system I/O modules &/or cards, power supplies, control relays, signal conditioners, etc.). Experience with P&ID loop tuning. AutoCAD, Inventor, or Sold Works software
Prior experience with PLC ladder logic, Allen-Bradley PLCs, iFIX, GE Unicorn, Siemens, Factory Historian, Finesse Emerson DeltaV, RSView32, Wonderware, RSView32, ControlLogix Building Management System a plus.
Experience with commissioning and qualification, and computerized systems validation required.
Experience with electrical standards and local requirements and general electrical safety best practices.

Education

Bachelor’s degree desired, (Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Sciences, Automation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering)

Communications & Contacts

Interacts with all departmental staff.
Works closely with Engineering, Manufacturing, MTS, Quality, EH&S, Facilities, and Validation

About the job
Graduated already in chemical engineering or chemistry, mechanical or industrial engineering? Wanting a career within the Hygiene or Consumer goods manufacturing sector? Are you looking for an engineering opportunity that will inspire you, and allow you to develop your process engineering as well as people management skills? Then Essity as a health and hygiene fast-paced, global manufacturer which produces market-leading consumer tissue products such as Tork is the right company for you!

About The Role

Essity is looking for a talented and self-motivated graduate in the field of process engineering to join one of largest paper manufacturing sites in Menasha, WI. This position is suitable for those who have already completed their studies or will be graduating in 2022 or 2023. You will be part of the team working on the tissue paper manufacturing machines and in our Menasha location.

Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place through our blockbuster innovations coupled with sustainable solutions. We want you to help shape the future of Essity through contributing your technical knowledge, developing our processes and being part of our network of people leaders.

We’re looking for people who embody our values, aren’t afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We’re always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we’d love to talk.

What You Will Do

As a graduate engineer you will play a central role in challenging the status quo, driving change and making a positive impact by delivering concrete results within our global hygiene and health business. You will be joining our professional converting production team at Menasha, where you will work closely with experienced colleagues and developing your knowledge and skills as follows:

Manage safety-oriented processes for yourself and others;
Learning to follow established engineering principles to determine the sequence of steps or processes required to manufacture tissue-based consumer products that meet the organization’s high standards of quality and cost;
Performing standard technical tasks and prepare standard operation sheets;
Monitoring production processes and work methods; collecting, compiling, and analyzing production data to identify opportunities to improve production processes;
Learning to troubleshoot (for example, following root cause analysis methodology);
Driving projects to support continuous improvements and deliverables;
Driving your own continued learning and complete industry-specific in-house training modules,

Who You Are

You will be a recently graduated engineer or will be completing a technical engineering degree (Bachelor or Master degree qualified) who has a natural focus on the environment and a compulsive curiosity about how engineering can play its part in delivering for the future. You should be a data driven and a process-improvement enthusiast who can demonstrate that you are a successful team player, have a passion to lead others and manage responsibilities given to you. Work experience is not required, but internships within a manufacturing environment is an advantage.

What We Can Offer You

We offer you a challenging job in a global company with many strong international brands. We offer a permanent contract with a competitive salary, investment and retirement plan, bonus opportunity as well as paid holidays, PTO (plus bank holidays) from the get-go.

Please note, this graduate program specific to our Professional Hygiene talent development program, within our Midwest operations.

We're looking for people who embody our values, aren’t afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We’re always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we’d love to talk, so don’t miss your chance to apply!

At Essity, we believe every career is as unique as the individual and empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.

If you apply for a job at Essity, you can be sure that the only criteria we consider for selection is professional experience, qualifications, key job-related attributes and working values.

Collaborative and caring Work Environment | Empowerment | Job Impact | Work with a Powerful Purpose | Individual Learning and Development | Health & Safety | Social Responsibility | Innovation

Additional Information

Among other requirements, our policy (COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Mandatory) requires all office and sales employees to be fully vaccinated. You must submit evidence of full vaccination prior to the day on which you are scheduled to start your employment with Essity. “Fully vaccinated” means two weeks have passed since an employee’s final COVID-19 vaccination injection.

Attention to detail and accuracy.

column1: Product Process Engineer- Back to Nature
column8:
About the job
Barilla is an Italian family-owned food company. Established in 1877, it’s now an international Group present in more than 100 countries.

A world leader in the markets of pasta and ready–to–use sauces and Pesti in continental Europe, bakery products in Italy, and crispbread in Scandinavia, the Barilla Group is recognized worldwide as a symbol of Italian know–how.

“ The Joy of Food for a Better Life ” is Barilla’s purpose and only way each person in the Group works and of which is ambassador. It means bringing people closer to the joy of good food and making quality the choice for a better life, from each individual to the plant.

Job Purpose

The primary responsibility of this position is to provide both product and processing technical leadership for Back to Nature North American Bakery business product development (such as cookies, crackers, nuts, & granola) and to identify and industrialize technologies to advance growth and quality objectives and ensure business continuity for Back to Nature products brand. The candidate must develop and execute key technical projects to meet business initiatives focused on New Product Development. This includes crafting and performing tests, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, documenting, communicating results, and commercializing products. It also includes some heavy lifting on margin enhancement projects, “clean ingredient” sourcing, and product optimization. Communication and teamwork skills are essential in this role which operates in a dynamic and cross-functional environment. Partnership with functions such as Marketing- Operations, Packaging, Sales, Purchasing, Finance, external ingredient/product Suppliers, co-manufactures and other Business Partners. The candidate must also have a technical background and be able to apply prior learning or scientific principles to new situations. This position requires an individual to manage multiple assignments concurrently with some supervisor guidance. The candidate is expected to lead their projects and exhibit a collaborative, start-up mindset to apply innovative solutions for the Back to Nature business. Bakery and/or baked goods experience will be a requirement.

How The Role Will Measure Success

Responsible for developing and commercializing new products, renovating existing products, reviewing and evaluating ingredients, and delivering cost savings.
The candidate will be driving highly technical and sophisticated projects to meet the business platform and innovation objectives.
Working collaboratively with Packaging RDQ, Quality , Operations, Marketing , and Sales to drive , scope, and complete projects to meet the business objectives .
Conduct feasibility assessments, prototype development, costing, supervision of manufacturing trials- development of recipe and plant documentation, label development, technical approvals/qualifications, shelf-life assessment and technical support for initial start-up production.
Apply prior learning or scientific principles to new situations
Manage multiple assignments/ tasks concurrently and demonstrate the ability complete work with minimal guidance.
Exhibiting a collaborative mindset and applying creative solutions
Start-up mentality is preferred

What You Will Bring To The Table

Bachelor’s Degree Required: BS/MS in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Food Science & Technology, or related field
Master’s degree Preferred: BS/MS in alternate field related to the above.
5+ years in a Technical Function (which can include all graduate and/or internship work)
Strong understanding of food chemistry, analytical testing, formulations, and processing used in food manufacturing
Understanding of ingredient functionality and interrelationship of ingredients- process- and packaging
Excellent communication- influencing- project management and problem-solving skills
Self-starter with passion to learn is a must
Manage multiple assignments/tasks concurrently with the ability to question the priority of work
Willingness to travel 30% both local and international
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to function effectively in a team environment. Commitment to results; ability to incorporate new learning into existing plans and act decisively

Barilla is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of Barilla to prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and to afford equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state and local laws and ordinances, nationally and internationally. Other classifications include, but are not limited to, family status, health status, multicultural differences, political ideas and sexual orientation.

About the job
Graduated already in chemical engineering or chemistry, mechanical or industrial engineering? Wanting a career within the Hygiene or Consumer goods manufacturing sector? Are you looking for an engineering opportunity that will inspire you, and allow you to develop your process engineering as well as people management skills? Then Essity as a health and hygiene fast-paced, global manufacturer which produces market-leading consumer tissue products such as Tork is the right company for you!

About The Role

Essity is looking for a talented and self-motivated graduate in the field of process engineering to join one of largest paper manufacturing sites in Menasha, WI. This position is suitable for those who have already completed their studies or will be graduating in 2022 or 2023. You will be part of the team working on the tissue paper manufacturing machines and in our Menasha location.

Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place through our blockbuster innovations coupled with sustainable solutions. We want you to help shape the future of Essity through contributing your technical knowledge, developing our processes and being part of our network of people leaders.

We’re looking for people who embody our values, aren’t afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We’re always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we’d love to talk.

What You Will Do

As a graduate engineer you will play a central role in challenging the status quo, driving change and making a positive impact by delivering concrete results within our global hygiene and health business. You will be joining our professional converting production team at Menasha, where you will work closely with experienced colleagues and developing your knowledge and skills as follows:

Manage safety-oriented processes for yourself and others;
Learning to follow established engineering principles to determine the sequence of steps or processes required to manufacture tissue-based consumer products that meet the organization’s high standards of quality and cost;
Performing standard technical tasks and prepare standard operation sheets;
Monitoring production processes and work methods; collecting, compiling, and analyzing production data to identify opportunities to improve production processes;
Learning to troubleshoot (for example, following root cause analysis methodology);
Driving projects to support continuous improvements and deliverables;
Driving your own continued learning and complete industry-specific in-house training modules,

Who You Are

You will be a recently graduated engineer or will be completing a technical engineering degree (Bachelor or Master degree qualified) who has a natural focus on the environment and a compulsive curiosity about how engineering can play its part in delivering for the future. You should be a data driven and a process-improvement enthusiast who can demonstrate that you are a successful team player, have a passion to lead others and manage responsibilities given to you. Work experience is not required, but internships within a manufacturing environment is an advantage.

What We Can Offer You

We offer you a challenging job in a global company with many strong international brands. We offer a permanent contract with a competitive salary, investment and retirement plan, bonus opportunity as well as paid holidays, PTO (plus bank holidays) from the get-go.

Please note, this graduate program specific to our Professional Hygiene talent development program, within our Midwest operations.

We're looking for people who embody our values, aren’t afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We’re always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we’d love to talk, so don’t miss your chance to apply!

At Essity, we believe every career is as unique as the individual and empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.

If you apply for a job at Essity, you can be sure that the only criteria we consider for selection is professional experience, qualifications, key job-related attributes and working values.

Collaborative and caring Work Environment | Empowerment | Job Impact | Work with a Powerful Purpose | Individual Learning and Development | Health & Safety | Social Responsibility | Innovation

Additional Information

Among other requirements, our policy (COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Mandatory) requires all office and sales employees to be fully vaccinated. You must submit evidence of full vaccination prior to the day on which you are scheduled to start your employment with Essity. “Fully vaccinated” means two weeks have passed since an employee’s final COVID-19 vaccination injection.

The Company is committed to equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to qualified candidates and employees pursuant to applicable law. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

If you require reasonable accommodation as part of the application process please contact EssityHRNorthAmerica@essity.com

Together, we are improving lives, every day

Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place. With impactful innovations coupled with sustainable solutions, we strive to reach more people every year with the necessary and essential solutions for well-being.

Application End Date:

About the job
Job Description Summary Job Description Summary

As a member of this world class team, the Lead Controls Engineer will lead and execute the protection and control aspects of Flexible AC (Alternating Current) Transmission System (FACTS) projects. In this role, you will be responsible for the design, testing, start-up and commissioning of the protection and control aspects of fixed series capacitors(FSC), static VAR compensation(SVC) and synchronous condenser solutions within GE’s Flexible AC Transmission Systems(FACTS) portfolio. Job Description

About Us

Grid Solutions, a GE Renewable Energy business, serves customers globally with over 1 2 ,000 employees. We provide power utilities and industries worldwide with equipment, systems, and services to bring power reliably and efficiently from the point of generation to end power consumers. We are focused on addressing the challenges of the energy transition by enabling the safe and reliable connection of renewable and distributed energy resources to the grid. For more about GE’s Grid Solutions, visit https://www.gegridsolutions.com.

Why We Come To Work

At GE Renewable Energy, our engineers are always up for the challenge - and we’re always driven to find the best solution. Our projects are unique and interesting, and you’ll need to bring a solution - focused, positive approach to each one to do you r best. Surrounded by committed, loyal colleagues, if you can dare to bring your ingenuity and desire to make an impact, you’ll be exposed to game - changing, diverse projects that truly allow you to play your part in the green energy transition.

Essential Responsibilities

Lead d evelop ment of custom protection and control solutions , including specifications, layouts, schematics, logic diagrams, programming, wiring, grounding, and other required custom control hardware , for custom FACTS solutions.
Lead c ompos ition of protection and control equipment specifications, issue material purchase request forms, and evaluate vendor quotations for FACTS equipment including protection and control systems
Be the lead contact liaison for technical issues for the customer and proje ct manager
Lead the d evelop ment and execut ion of start - up, testing and commissioning plans
Coordinate with sourcing and project team members on technical matters to meet project specifications, cost control and schedule objectives
Interface with internal and external team members such as principal engineers, control engineers, civil engineers, electrical designers, project managers, engineering leaders and support organizations
Lead the d evelopment of the controls scope for proposals, including writing and /or reviewing technical specifications, estimating design man - hours and materials, supporting sourcing for vendor quotations, directing designers and draftsmen on drawing requirements, and the development of clarifications and exceptions as well as technic al responses
Lead the d evelop ment and execute cost reduction programs that vary in scope and may include low - cost vendor selection, design improvements, process improvements, automation, and new product introduction
Lead the p erform ance of RCA's (root caus e analysis) and execut ion corrective actions
Support project quality procedures and initiatives including aspects of ISO9001

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’ s Degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university or college with a minimum of 5 year of related engineering experience ( OR Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university or college with a minimum of 3 years of relate d engineering e xperience)
Ability and willingness to travel up to 20% as required, which may include remote locations and international travel, and be willing to comply with all relevant company travel and tax policies

Desired Characteristics

Experience in automation controller programming
Experience specifying, configuring and programming Mk6e control systems for power plat applications
Experience specifying, configuring and programming Ex2100e exciters for power plant applications
Experience in microprocessor control hardware, firmware, architecture
Knowledge of and experience using IEEE, IEC, ANSI, NEC, and NESC standards and codes, and ability to engineer design packages when no clear customer specification is provided
Experience in installation, field-testing and commissioning of HV equipment, including required safe work habits
Demonstrated electrical and mechanical troubleshooting capability
Superior communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work in a team environment
Demonstrated creativity and ability to lead a team and be accountable for team results in order to deliver a high quality product on time and under budget
Ability to develop and implement standards and structured programs
Excellent personal computer skills, including proficiency with Excel and Word, AutoCAD, and Microstation

About the job

This position is within the Engineering Solutions Group at XP Power. Successful candidate will be responsible for designing custom power delivery products that includes DC/DC, AC/DC, high/low power, high/low voltage, switch mode power supplies.

The Engineering Solutions Group features a collaborative environment with creative, smart people and cutting-edge technologies. Engineering excellence is expected and encouraged. Come join us in crafting solutions the world does not know of yet!

Support RMA group with root causes analysis.

Experience designing electronic assemblies and/or power conversion products.
RF and High Voltage experience is preferred

Experience in validation with strong debug skills, problem tracking
Experience with test data collection and analysis
Experience with test plan & test procedure development is a plus

Strong project management experience.
Ability to make economic judgments with respect to product cost and manufacturing process.
Excellent verbal, written and organizational skills.
Excellent mathematical and analytical skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and complete tasks with minimal supervision.

XP Power provides a safe and healthy working environment that is stimulating and collaborative, where employees are empowered to make a real difference. About the job
Job # 622833

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

What you’ll be doing...

Join Verizon as we continue to expand our industry-leading network to improve the ways people, businesses, and things connect. Verizon is positioned to lead the “Fourth Industrial Revolution” (4IR) with the emergence of technologies like our best-in-class 5G network and the Internet of Things (IoT) to impact a wide variety of industries such as healthcare, education, manufacturing, public safety, government, and many others. We are in the midst of historic breakthroughs in connectivity and mobility to blend the physical and the digital through cutting-edge technologies such as virtual reality, augmented reality, artificial intelligence, autonomous vehicles, nanotechnologies, 3D printing, wearables, and advanced robotics. As part of this team, you will play a critical role in our network transformation through building a unified network across all lines of business and maintaining the technology that keeps millions of our customers connected. The purpose of this role is to serve as a Product Owner (PO) in a SAFe Agile environment working with development teams to develop NPP RAN Planning software.

Driving requirements, develop process flows, develop priorities and work with NS, HQ, and regions to develop Fuze Planning.
Delivering health reports to provide visibility into design/traffic/pipeline issues and implement solutions to address them.
Working with customers and other Business Stakeholders to define and prioritize stories in the Team Backlog.
Serving as a SME for NPP, Atoll and RF propagation tools.
Working with development and customers to drive the future of Traffic/RF tools and deliver a product that meets business needs while addressing customer needs.
Collaborating with team members and submarkets to drive development changes to help standardize design configurations, equipment, and processes.
Working as a team with the Submarket Engineers, HQ, and Territory peers to create best practice guidelines from their input.
Developing the logic to forecast RAN equipment network needs.
Applying the definition to give project priority guidance to the Submarkets.
Supplying clear, concise, and detailed person to person communication on a daily basis with network team members.
Increasing efficiency of tool development and creating new ways to automate processes and reporting.
Developing the logic to forecast RAN network needs.
Providing concise, and detailed person to person communication on a daily basis with network team members.

This position can be located out of any U.S. based Verizon Hub locations.

Where you’ll be working…

In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.

What we’re looking for...

You'll Need To Have

Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Willingness to travel up to approximately 25% of the time.
Willingness to work rotating schedule (shifts) including nights and weekends based on the needs of the business.

Even better if you have one or more of the following:

A degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
Leadership skills to lead projects to deliver results and be technically competent in RF/Traffic.
Experience in LTE, CDMA and EVDO networks and their performance.
Knowledge of equipment operations and network standards.
Experience in engineering and operations of Nokia/ALU and/or Ericsson equipment.
Knowledge of equipment capacity and future capabilities.
Ability to develop reports and manipulate information using Tableau.
Experience in programming in languages such as Python, JavaScript, SQL, and VBA to drive towards the automation of engineering tools and processes.
Knowledge of VPI, MPT and other capacity planning and RF/Performance tools.
Ability to diagnose and correct various system and interworking problems and provide simple and effective summary recommendations.
Knowledge of network capacity and performance, and ability to prepare network plans.
Knowledge of wireless systems, digital communication, and traffic engineering.
Knowledge of mapping software.
Ability to investigate and implement alternate approaches to resolve difficult problems.
Ability to be flexible to attempt alternate solutions to resolve issues and seamlessly adjust to a dynamic, changing business environment.

If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

Notice(s)

Verizon will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Compensation

Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401 (k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives,we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.

If you are hired into a California, Colorado, or New York work location, the compensation range for this position is between $84,000 and $195,000 based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part-time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

About the job
This company is developing a novel air transportation system, which some refer to as a "flying car." Our approach involves using fully autonomous unmanned aerial vehicles to move items and individuals more effectively. We think this represents an exceptional opportunity for innovation. Our methods differ from those of other businesses in the industry.

They are looking for an Electrical Engineer to join their team in developing hybrid- electric aircrafts. You will have hands-on experience building and debugging hardware and familiarity with power conversion, signal conditioning, discrete semiconductor use, battery management systems and digital communication protocols.



Requirements

Core responsibilities

Participate in developing crucial electronic systems on the aircraft
Develop understandable and precise digital and mixed-signal printed circuit board schematics
Choose components that provide the maximum reliability and minimum mass
Research contemporary methods for power and data transmission/management
Utilize PCB software to design dependable and lightweight layouts
Prepare specifications, participate in DFMEAs, and generate test and validation procedures
Oversee, produce, and sustain wiring interconnect and harness diagrams.
Required

B.S. in Electrical Engineering
PCB design and schematic capture experience
Understanding of power supplies, milliohm meters, oscilloscopes, and benchtop devices
Experience with power conversion (linear and switching regulators)
Familiarity with signal conditioning and conversion (Op-amps, filters, ADCs)
Experience with batteries and battery management systems (energy, resistance, capacity, state of health and state of charge)
Understanding of I2C, SPI, CAN, ethernet, UART
Experience with high frequency radio systems (900-2.4GHz range)
Experience with discrete semiconductor use (FETs, BJTs, diodes)
Understanding of motor driver circuitry (ESCs, inverters, H-bridges)
Ideal candidate

M.S. or PhD in Electrical Engineering
Altium designer experience
Experience with high voltage design (100V+)
Understanding of aerospace regulatory certification
Experience with DFMEA and fault trees, design for reliability
Experience designing high EMI environments


Benefits

Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Stock Option Plan

Our systems address our customers' needs to reduce capital equipment and installation costs while enhancing system level performance and reliability using automated monitoring systems and analytics across the battery, power conditioning and auxiliary systems.

Opportunity: Our client is looking for a Lead Electrical Engineer for their Aircraft Team who will be responsible for new designs and capabilities of the drone delivery system.
