About the job
Do something that means something at Williams. This isn’t just a job - it’s an opportunity to explore and discover your passion with coworkers who become friends and mentors who push you to be your best self in and out of the office. At Williams, we make clean energy happen. And you can too, so bring your energy to ours.

As an Engineer., you will conduct technical and economic evaluations, performance testing, design and construction of new and existing facilities, and research on new developments, applying your strong understanding of industry and operational requirements. Taking initiative and anticipating customer needs will make you a stand-out player. Confidence in presentation-making and the ability to work independently and as a team leader are also vital in this role!

Your work will challenge you, and with our Core Values to guide you, you’ll quickly learn and grow with us.



As an engineer supporting our Power & Automation team, some of the work you will be doing includes:



















#HYBRID

About the job
DPS is seeking an experienced Senior Electrical Engineer with a strong understanding of the engineering lifecycle related to facility design and construction in clean room, laboratories, biotech, pharma, or Life sciences industries. Pharmaceutical and biotechnology products impact all our lives in some way. The projects that we execute deliver lifesaving products to patients globally.

As a Senior Engineer your responsibilities will include engineering and design oversight for facility power distribution systems, grounding, lighting, and low voltage communications systems in some of the most complex pharmaceutical facilities on the planet. Designs may also occasionally include retrofit of existing building systems.

Responsibilities:
Strong understanding of engineering lifecycle related to electrical deliverables.
Work directly with the project team to design electrical systems for Biotech and Pharmaceutical clients.
Detailed design experience for electrical systems.
Layout and size electrical equipment on floor plans.
Responsibilities will likely include demonstrated understanding of switchgear design, low, medium, and high voltage, single line diagrams, line, etc.
Ability to coordinate and interact effectively with other MEP disciplines.
Identifying deliverables, defining requirements, creating design drawings.
Develop technical specifications and layouts while working in tandem with project managers and engineers across multiple disciplines.

Qualifications:
Must be a licensed P.E.
Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Architectural Engineering.
8+ years of facility design required. Design in clean room, laboratories, biotech, pharma, or Life sciences industries preferred.
Takes ownership of assignments, can work both independently and as part of the team.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment effectively.
Excellent organization skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

The Company
DPS Group is a global EPCM firm offering full-service solutions within the Life Sciences (pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical technology) and Advanced Technology (semiconductor, data center, and solar) industries. DPS is dedicated to delivering successful projects with a ‘client-first’ mentality and personal touch across a range of market sectors: Project and Program Management, Procurement, Design, Construction Management, Health and Safety Management, Commissioning, Qualification, and Start-up.
DPS Engineering Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. DPS does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of: race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law.

About the job
Job # 622833

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

What you’ll be doing...

Join Verizon as we continue to expand our industry-leading network to improve the ways people, businesses, and things connect. Verizon is positioned to lead the “Fourth Industrial Revolution” (4IR) with the emergence of technologies like our best-in-class 5G network and the Internet of Things (IoT) to impact a wide variety of industries such as healthcare, education, manufacturing, public safety, government, and many others. We are in the midst of historic breakthroughs in connectivity and mobility to blend the physical and the digital through cutting-edge technologies such as virtual reality, augmented reality, artificial intelligence, autonomous vehicles, nanotechnologies, 3D printing, wearables, and advanced robotics. As part of this team, you will play a critical role in our network transformation through building a unified network across all lines of business and maintaining the technology that keeps millions of our customers connected. The purpose of this role is to serve as a Product Owner (PO) in a SAFe Agile environment working with development teams to develop NPP RAN Planning software.

Driving requirements, develop process flows, develop priorities and work with NS, HQ, and regions to develop Fuze Planning.
Delivering health reports to provide visibility into design/traffic/pipeline issues and implement solutions to address them.
Working with customers and other Business Stakeholders to define and prioritize stories in the Team Backlog.
Serving as a SME for NPP, Atoll and RF propagation tools.
Working with development and customers to drive the future of Traffic/RF tools and deliver a product that meets business needs while addressing customer needs.
Collaborating with team members and submarkets to drive development changes to help standardize design configurations, equipment, and processes.
Working as a team with the Submarket Engineers, HQ, and Territory peers to create best practice guidelines from their input.
Developing the logic to forecast RAN equipment network needs.
Applying the definition to give project priority guidance to the Submarkets.
Supplying clear, concise, and detailed person to person communication on a daily basis with network team members.
Increasing efficiency of tool development and creating new ways to automate processes and reporting.
Developing the logic to forecast RAN network needs.
Providing concise, and detailed person to person communication on a daily basis with network team members.

This position can be located out of any U.S. based Verizon Hub locations.

Where you’ll be working…

In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.

What we’re looking for...

You'll Need To Have

Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Willingness to travel up to approximately 25% of the time.
Willingness to work rotating schedule (shifts) including nights and weekends based on the needs of the business.

Even better if you have one or more of the following:

A degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
Leadership skills to lead projects to deliver results and be technically competent in RF/Traffic.
Experience in LTE, CDMA and EVDO networks and their performance.
Knowledge of equipment operations and network standards.
Experience in engineering and operations of Nokia/ALU and/or Ericsson equipment.
Knowledge of equipment capacity and future capabilities.
Ability to develop reports and manipulate information using Tableau.
Experience in programming in languages such as Python, JavaScript, SQL, and VBA to drive towards the automation of engineering tools and processes.
Knowledge of VPI, MPT and other capacity planning and RF/Performance tools.
Ability to diagnose and correct various system and interworking problems and provide simple and effective summary recommendations.
Knowledge of network capacity and performance, and ability to prepare network plans.
Knowledge of wireless systems, digital communication, and traffic engineering.
Knowledge of mapping software.
Ability to investigate and implement alternate approaches to resolve difficult problems.
Ability to be flexible to attempt alternate solutions to resolve issues and seamlessly adjust to a dynamic, changing business environment.

If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

Notice(s)

Verizon will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Compensation

Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401 (k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives,we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.

If you are hired into a California, Colorado, or New York work location, the compensation range for this position is between $84,000 and $195,000 based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part-time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

About the job
Are you an electrical engineer with a P.E. license? Do you enjoy working with a team of diverse and dynamic professionals as it pertains to new construction projects? Do you enjoy working on power systems, power distribution as well as building automation systems? If working with a growing team that is as focused on your personal and professional growth as you are sounds like a dream come true, then let’s talk!

What to expect:
Preparation and review of electrical system calculations, including system layout and coordination
Sizing and selection of materials; spreadsheet development and basic estimation
Construction document development (using Revit)
Field/site visits during construction and review installed work and verify design intent

Who you are:
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university
P.E. License
Experience working with AutoCAD and/or Revit
Possess a valid driver’s license and be able to perform engineering related field work

Why work with us:
Outstanding work culture and dynamic projects
Above average compensation and comprehensive benefits package
Excellent professional growth potential

Fathom Recruitment adheres to an equal employment opportunity policy. All candidates are referred based on their qualifications only, without regard for their race, sex, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected class or characteristic.

About the job
Overview

REAL ALLOY is the market leader in third-party aluminum recycling and specification alloy production. Headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio, we have 17 plants strategically located across the United States, Mexico, and Canada. We convert aluminum scrap and by-products into reusable aluminum metal for a growing number of applications across various industries. We are ideally positioned to respond to the needs of an increasingly recycling-conscious world. Advanced technologies enable us to process a large variety of scrap and dross and reduce the amount of residual waste from aluminum manufacturing that would otherwise end up as landfill.

We are currently seeking an Electrical Engineer to join their team in Elgin, IL.

About the job
About Us

JSat Automation is hiring a Full Time Process Validation Engineer for their Blue Bell office. This position is a combination of working remotely, in the office and at client sites. We are a global operational consulting, systems integration, and validation firm headquartered in “Blue Bell PA USA”, with offices in Northern and Southern CA, Southern PA, PR, UK, and India.

The Process Validation Engineer will be responsible for owning and executing the process validation studies and protocol executions targeting cell and gene therapy manufacturing facility.

Requirements

Requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Chemical, pharmaceutical, Bio-Process, Bio Tech Engineering, or related field.
3-5+ years of process validation experience

Benefits

Why Join Us?

We’re a personable group of people welcoming you to join us in the pursuit of career excellence and professional growth.
We provide ISPE and third-party validation training.
We provide ISPE, ISA, and IEEE publications.
We encourage professional conference bi-annual attendance.
We encourage publishing in professional magazines.

If you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat to see what skills/experience you are able to bring to this team.

#VIS

About the job
Company Overview

Wherever you work and whatever role you fill, when you represent the Bridgestone name you know that you are a valued teammate who is part of our larger mission to “Serve Society with Superior Quality.” We start by offering each teammate more than just a salary. We provide formal training, competitive performance incentives, paid vacation and holidays, healthcare packages for full-time and part-time employees, and a 401k plan to help build your future.

We believe people can only provide superior service and quality to others when they are allowed to bring their whole selves to work and know they are supported. We believe in championing all perspectives, individuals and teams because we understand the importance of seeing the world and our business through many different lenses. We are building a team as diverse as the world we serve. So, show us what you’re made of. Show us the smart stuff, the tough stuff, the bold, beautiful and brave stuff. Because who you are is what we need.

Bridgestone Americas, Inc. is headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee and is the U.S. subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation headquartered in Japan. Bridgestone Americas and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand products to address the needs of a broad range of customers and industries.

Business Unit

BAMG - Aiken PSR

Management Level

Professional

Job Category

Engineering & Science

Position Summary

This is Process Engineer that will work in functional group in Process Engineering such as Mixing, Stock Prep/Extrusion, Tire Room, Curing, and Uniformity.

Responsibilities

Technical Support

Provide technical support for production areas as required to achieve quality, productivity, and waste goals.

Optimizes production processes by studying current operating conditions, quality, returns and historical data. Implements processing improvements by coordinating with Production. Ensures corporate standards are followed and issues temporary deviations when necessary. Follows 3M trials involving changes to any production process, method, materials, or machine and documents results. Assists in the maintenance of plant process and product specifications through the Tire Engineering Specification System (TESS) or the Compound Formula System.

Provides support to production by participating in regularly scheduled meetings to review safety, quality, productivity, NOT, and waste. Responds to requests from production area for technical assistance in solving machine or process issues. Provides technical leadership for the startup of new processes or equipment and for modifications and improvements of existing production equipment. Leads efforts to improve bekidou/utilization trends.

Process Specifications

Maintain process specifications for all processes, including review of all spec changes.

Supervise Trials

Supervise trials to evaluate new materials for cost reduction, quality improvement, and product development.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering or related Engineering discipline

Preferred: 2 years of strong internship/project experience.

Bridgestone is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. It is our policy to consider for employment all individuals regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Employment Eligibility

If hired, a Form I-9 Employment Eligibility Verification must be completed at the start of employment. Temporary work authorization or the need for sponsorship may disqualify you from employment.

About the job
We’re looking for an early career Electrical Engineer to join our controls development team in midtown Atlanta.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to develop your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As a development engineer focusing on electronics, you’ll be collaborating with our team to design new products for our lighting controls and IoT platform.

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What you’ll do
Design electronics for new products including networking, control and power management circuits
Create prototypes and work in the lab to test and refine your designs
Work with compliance and quality teams to rigorously test your design to ensure a long life, proper operation and compliance with UL, FCC and other applicable regulations
Work with the software development team to bring up the software and create a final product.
Participate in innovation activities to help envision new solutions for our customers while protecting your creativity thought patents.
Your Qualifications
BS Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering
Demonstrated ability to work with a team collaboratively towards a common goal
Experience with ECAD and circuit simulation a plus
Willingness to get hands on in the lab with your designs
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without current or future company sponsorship needs

Our candidate profile is just a guide. We know that many talented people only apply for jobs when there is an exact match. If you don't fit all the criteria but believe this role is for you, we would very much like to hear from you.

What you’ll get in return…

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

About the job
Job Opportunity

Process Engineer

Pasadena, Texas, USA

INEOS Styrolution America LLC

Our Company: INEOS Styrolution is a leading global styrenics supplier, with a focus on styrene monomer, polystyrene, Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene standard, and styrenic specialties. We offer excellent production facilities, revolutionary R&D centers, international reach, and over 90 years of experience pioneering real change through sustainable solutions, all while making the circular economy for styrenics a reality.
The global leader in styrenics: No. 1 leader in styrenics with a focus on Styrene Monomer, Polystyrene, Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene Standard and Styrenic Specialties
Employees: 3,600 worldwide
Production sites: 20 manufacturing sites in 10 countries
Customer base: Customers in 106 countries
Sales: 4 billion EUR in 2020

Safety remains and always will be our number one priority at INEOS. Our US locations are following the INEOS Covid protocols for new hires as a condition of employment:
Candidates must be fully vaccinated prior to start date and show proof of Covid-19 vaccination, or
Provide validation of a religious exemption, medical exemption, or personal conscience exemption (in the State of Texas in accordance with Executive Order GA-40)

THE POSITION

The Process Engineer is a key technical resource in the Operations department and is responsible for providing daily support in the production facilities to ensure safe and efficient plant operation in an environmentally conscious manner. You will lead process-troubleshooting initiatives, track unit performance, set operating targets and guidelines for unit operators, support the unit quality program, and drive plant optimization. Additionally, you will develop and execute process improvement projects in coordination with the Engineering and Maintenance departments. As a member of the Operations team, you will support the site’s process safety program, demonstrate a commitment to SHE through personal action, facilitate effective communication, and promote a high-performance team environment.

Key Responsibilities
Maintain accountability as the Asset Engineer within assigned area(s). Develop and maintain operating envelopes, identify safe operating limits, define consequences of deviation, and establish corrective actions. Investigate any operating envelope exceedances.
Provide daily technical support in the process plant to ensure safe and efficient plant operation in an environmentally conscious manner. Advise team members on process safety, operations technology, and applicable plant experiences.
Interact with site-level, regional, and third-party teams as required to support production forecasting, manage product quality, resolve equipment or raw material vendor issues, resolve operational issues, identify improvements, and provide technical support.
Monitor process variables and operational performance to achieve production, quality, and benchmarking results as specified or as measured by established KPI’s. Support applicable plant record keeping initiatives, including Operations-related accounting activities such as compiling or reviewing data.
Influence integrity management within the process units to ensure that work related to the production facilities is appropriately identified, then completed correctly, promptly, and in a cost effective manner.
Support the manufacturing asset through small project ownership and technical service emphasis, including project definition, project prioritization, project scoping, project alternatives, preliminary / detailed process design, economic evaluation, installation, commissioning, start-up support, post-startup evaluations, and completion of appropriate documentation.
Lead / participate as needed, or as directed, in planning and work execution activities related to unit shutdowns, turnarounds, and start-ups.
Ensure full compliance within the unit to government regulations, SHE standards, policies, rules, procedures, and programs. Support and model behavioral and process safety principles.
Lead / participate as needed in incident investigations, Management of Change (MOC), Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), Layers of Protection Analysis (LOPA), general process safety reviews, and risk assessments. Identify root causes and corrective recommendations in process incident and mechanical failure investigations to prevent reoccurrence.
Manage assigned PSM / audit / quality action items to ensure completion.
Support team success through ownership of additional responsibilities as deemed appropriate by the Operations Manager.

Requirements

Education & Experience:
B.S. Degree in Chemical Engineering
Extensive engineering knowledge and skills
Minimum two (2) years of experience in a similar chemical or refining process, 5-10 years is preferred
This role requires a high level of motivation and drive for excellence
Must be able to function with high autonomy within designated boundaries
Demonstrated effective skills in communication (verbal and written), problem solving, decision making, and operational planning

Experience in general:
Industry experiences demonstrating ability to learn and apply new information
Recent examples of ability to manage multiple priorities concurrently
Proven ability to deliver results in a team environment
Cooperative manner, capable of effective interfacing at all levels within the organization

Technical skills:
Detailed knowledge of chemical plant process equipment and operation of that equipment in continuous processes
High familiarity with common industry practices such as Management of Change (MOC), Root Cause Investigation (RCI), Risk Identification and Management
High familiarity with common industry software applications such as Aspen Process Simulation Tools, Aspen Process Explorer, PI Process Book
Windows operating system and advanced working knowledge of Excel
Knowledge of Safety, Health, and Environmental Quality issues
Statistical process improvement skills preferred

THE LOCATION

This opportunity is located in Pasadena, Texas. Pasadena is part of the Houston metropolitan area, about 30 miles from downtown. Please note that relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What we offer to you:
Competitive salaries, performance-related pay, and bonuses.
A comprehensive benefits package with low premiums including health, short-term disability, and life and accidental death insurance plans
Retirement savings with company match + contributions
Fitness and tuition reimbursement
Flexible work environment
Career development and progression

column1: Entry Level Electrical Engineer - New Product Development, COOPER LIGHTING SOLUTIONS
column8:
About the job
Cooper Lighting Solutions. We build forward-thinking lighting solutions that make people’s lives safer, while making buildings, homes and cities smarter and more sustainable. We deliver an industry-leading portfolio of indoor and outdoor lighting, lighting controls and smart lighting systems.

Cooper Lighting Solutions is a business unit of Signify, the world leader in lighting. Together we have a shared purpose to unlock the extraordinary potential of light for brighter lives and a better world. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

Your opportunity

We’re looking for a Electrical Engineer – New Product Development to join our Connected Buildings team in Cooper Lighting at our Peachtree City, GA or Midtown Atlanta facility.

This position will be responsible for designing the next generation of products into the connected buildings segment.

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What You’ll Do
Coordinate with marketing to ensure project specifications are clear, complete, and achievable and are consistent with voice of the customer.
Ensures design progression via board or circuit development to ensure requirements are met.
Coordinates with Sourcing personnel to ensure vendors are identified, quotations are being obtained and quality standards/form deliverables are being met.
Coordinates with manufacturing personnel to ensure production site has been identified, production equipment and other requirements are being put in place and production readiness is achieved both for internal and supplier plants.
Conduct design reviews as well as the Design and Process Failure Mode Effect Analysis (DFMEA, PFMEA) sessions to Identifying project risks and develop response plans
What You’ll Need
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or other Engineering or Technical discipline from an accredited institution
Experience in mechanical engineering/mechanical design
Basic understanding of thermal behaviors & electrical engineering principles
What You’ll Get In Return…

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

Who We Are

Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.

We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.

About the job
Company Description

We are Olsson, a team-based, purpose-driven engineering and design firm. Our solutions improve communities and our people make it possible.

Our most meaningful asset is our people, and we are dedicated to providing an environment where they can continue to learn, grow, and thrive. Our entrepreneurial spirit is what has allowed us — and will continue to allow us — to grow. The result? Inspired people, amazing designs, and projects with purpose.

Job Description

Olsson provides mechanical and electrical services for large commercial developments, hospitals, laboratories, school/university buildings, and military facilities. As an Entry-Level Electrical Engineer on the Mechanical/Electrical team, you will complete a variety of tasks, which may include the preparation of design documents, calculations and specifications for various projects. Projects would be completed under direct supervision of experienced electrical engineers that will provide mentorship, training and project quality review.

We have one current opening and will consider candidates interested in being located out of our Lincoln, NE or Omaha, NE offices.

Qualifications

You are passionate about:

Working collaboratively with others
Having ownership in the work you do
Using your talents to positively affect communities

You bring to the team:

Strong communication skills.
Ability to contribute and work well on a team.
Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering.
0-4 years of experience.
AutoCAD and/or Revit experience is a plus.
Strong attention to detail.
Desire to provide innovative solutions.

Additional Information

Olsson is a nationally recognized, employee-owned firm specializing in planning and design, engineering, field services, environmental, and technology. Founded in 1956 on the very mindset that drives us today, we’re here to improve communities by making them more sustainable, better connected, and more efficient. Simply put, we work to leave the world better than we found it.

As an Olsson employee, you’ll receive our traditional benefits package (health care, vision, dental, paid time off, etc.), plus you’ll:

Become an owner in the company after your first year through our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
Engage in work that has a positive impact in communities
Receive an excellent 401(k) match
Participate in a wellness program promoting balanced lifestyles
Benefit from a bonus system that rewards performance
Have the possibility for flexible work arrangements

Olsson is an EEO employer. We encourage qualified minority, female, veteran and disabled candidates to apply and be considered for open positions. We do not discriminate against any applicant for employment, or any employee because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender, disability, age, or military status.

About the job
QUALIFICATION/SKILLS:









BS Degree Electrical Engineering
25+ years' experience in design of industrial electrical power systems.
Professional Engineer license is required.
Computer literate and experienced in the use of SKM Power Tools, MS Word, and MS Excel.
Ability to self-execute all electrical engineering and oversee design within a given project as well as lead a team of electrical engineers and designers on larger, more complex projects.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:








Ability to lead and manage a technical team and lead all aspects of executing large electrical distribution systems for complex, multiple process unit projects.
Knowledge and application of switchgear, motor control centers, transformers, motors, and generators used in industrial power systems and the ability to prepare and interpret specifications related to such equipment.
Knowledge and experience in performing detailed power system engineering studies.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Lead an electrical engineering and design team on large scale projects containing multiple process units with multiple execution strategies from various global design centers. Position requires ability to manage and coordinate with overall project management team, other functional discipline teams, and project engineering managers to maintain budget and schedule to meet functional execution strategy.

2. Development of electrical single line diagrams and overall plant electrical distribution systems.

3. Coordination with utility and/or customer to develop required power for operating plants.

4. Specifying and purchasing key electrical equipment such as medium and low voltage switchgear and motor control centers, transformers, VFD's, UPS systems, DC systems, etc. Responsibilities include writing purchase specifications, evaluating quotations, performing technical bid evaluations, vendor document review, and factory acceptance testing.

5. Specifying large induction and synchronous motors and starting systems including reduced voltage autotransformers, reactor start, electronic soft-start/VFD/LCI, etc.

6. Specifying and integrating gas turbine and steam turbine generators for co-generation within process plants.

7. Performing electrical system studies including short circuit, load flow, transient motor start, protection relay coordination, and arc flash, and creating appropriate protective device settings.

8. Provide start-up and commissioning support for electrical distribution equipment and motors.

About the job
These are exciting times at Anord Mardix – we are growing and need your enthusiasm and capabilities to continue to grow. As part of this growth, we are seeking an experienced, Senior Electrical Engineer with deep knowledge of switchgear or related design experience and is ready to lead.

What will you like about the role:
Growing company, hungry for structure and process

About the job
RITM9156725

Electrical Maintenance Engineer

Contribute to the success of Rio Tinto by applying your technical and professional expertise
A company with a world class reputation for safety and performance – Boron, CA
For California based roles the expected annual salary range is $84,640 – $116,380

About The Role

We are looking for a talented Electrical Maintenance Engineer. You will work in a team of professionals with the common goal of adequately maintaining a fleet of large scale mining equipment to be as productive as possible in mining operations. Your specific contribution to the team is to provide engineering support utilizing problem solving and technical skills to drive good asset management practices.

You will work in a fast paced dynamic environment with lots of opportunity to grow and develop. The normal work schedule for this position is Mon-Fri, 9-hour days with every other Friday off.

We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industry’s best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.

Reporting to the Senior Maintenance Engineer and working in the mine mobile maintenance department based in Boron, CA you will

Provide technical guidance and troubleshooting assistance working closely with electrical technicians.
Manage electrical component repairs, supply chain, and warehouse stock.
Conduct failure analysis on electrical components and provide technical reports.
Audit electrical PM process, identify areas of improvement, and implement solutions.
Budget for major component replacements, monitor the condition of electrical components, and schedule replacement.
Identify electrical component improvements and implement solutions.
Ensure compliance with health, safety, environmental and quality programs.

What You’ll Bring

A BS degree in electrical engineering, related discipline, or extensive experience with electrical propulsion mining equipment.
Extensive computer skills including MS Word, Excel, Outlook.
Exceptional problem solving skills.
A self-starter attitude and a desire to learn and improve the business.
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.
Leadership skills to manage technicians and prioritize work load.
Willingness to work in an industrial mining environment.

Beneficial to have

Mining equipment knowledge (CAT, Komatsu, MTU, etc.)
Statex 3 DC electric propulsion Knowledge
SAP knowledge

What We Offer

We are committed to providing our employees with a generous benefits package. Be recognized for your contribution, your thinking, your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress, we provide

A safety-focused and inclusive working environment
Access to top-tier family-friendly health programs including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, life insurance coverage, and various voluntary benefits.
401(k) matching program (company matched .35 per dollar up to 5% of your base pay)
Generous Rio Tinto employee share program, which allows you to purchase Rio Tinto Company shares.
Comprehensive leave policies which cover all moments that matter in life PTO (paid time off), paid holidays, and paid bereavement leave.
A favorable child-caregiver leave program (Up to 100% salary top-up)
Ongoing Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for you and your family; to help in addressing educational opportunities, addiction treatment, depression, stress, domestic issues, financial management, and legal concerns.
Discount programs for leisure purposes and access to Virgin Pulse with incentives supporting your wellbeing.

About Rio Tinto

Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs.
For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.

Where you will be working

Rio Tinto Borates is a global leader in industrial mineral supply and science. We supply approximately 25% of the world’s demand for refined borates, minerals essential to life and modern living. We seek to create mutual value by working closely with our investment partners and host communities. Our 20 Mule Team Borax brand pays tribute to our first borates mining operation in Death Valley in 1872.

Every Voice Matters

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQ+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.

Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V

Rio Tinto participates in E-Verify to confirm work authorization. Please visit http //www.uscis.gov/ for more information.

About the job
Do you want to work at an organization that is people focused, service minded and results oriented, that offers their customers creative problem solving, progressive solutions, and improved outcome? Then Android Industries may be the place for you.We are committed to a culture of excellence, with a focus on best practices and continuous improvement. We understand that our people are our biggest strength, and we know that world-class service happens because of our capable and valued team members. Whether you are looking for an assembly position or a career in manufacturing management, you can thrive as a member of our team.

PROCESS ENGINEER

Process Engineer will be responsible for the development and coordination of the PFMEA standards for all commodities. This role will update the PFMEA standards and ensure alignment with all the plants t o meet the customer and internal system requirements.

All other duties as assigned.

Ability to communicate verbally and in writing with all levels of the organization and with customers and suppliers.

What’s In It For You

Research, design and develop all electrical aspects of new products, processes and systems.
Work closely with software and mechanical disciplines to create final products.

May travel up to 2 weeks per year to interact with customers, vendors, and support tradeshows.
Support and engage in our vision of improving lives.
Live and be an example of Quartzdyne’s core values: Respect, Grit, Transparency, Honesty, Humility and Accountability.

Normal working conditions absent extreme factors

Must be able to lift up to 45lbs periodically
Role is deemed safety-sensitive and may be subject to employer or customer drug testing

Prior work experience with embedded Systems, GUI Development using Qt 5 framework, .NET Framework, .NET 5, MSVC, and LabView

Works well on cross-functional teams
Adapt and exhibit the following Quartzdyne values: Honesty, Integrity, Respect, Transparency, Self-Starter, Humble, Friendly, Accountability, Adaptability, Positive Attitude

About ChampionX

ChampionX is a global leader in providing chemistry programs and services, drilling technology, artificial lift solutions, and automation technologies for the upstream and midstream oil and gas industry. Our world-class safety culture fuels our purpose to improve lives through our commitment to deliver sustainable operations.

About Quartzdyne

Quartzdyne designs and manufactures precision pressure and temperature transducers for the oil and gas industry. Our proprietary offerings have become the industry standard, elevating how critical data is used to assess the performance of a reservoir and increase oil production. Our sensors are world-renowned for providing intensely accurate and high-resolution data under the most extreme conditions. At Quartzdyne, we live by our core values of Respect, Grit, Honesty, Transparency, Humility and Accountability. Quartzdyne is located along the beautiful Wasatch mountain range in Utah.

Medical

Vision

4 weeks of PTO to start
11 paid holidays

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
